user_texts: ['I love this trail! I’ve been down it several times with a mountain bike and onfoot. Great views, nice distance for a good work out, you could bring a snack or some water in the light as it takes 2.5 hrs at a good clip. The distance on this seem to be off base of my apple series 4 watch with GPS. I will attach a screenshot of my route.', 'Hiked this trail years ago, great experience for a new hiker. It was my first hike. Hiked the shorter trail up to the falls, it was challenging for my first time. Worth it though when we made it to the falls. Took the longer route back, much easier for beginners.', 'Hiked this back in September. Took the lower trail to the falls and the upper trail returning. The lower trail needed some upkeep. There were parts that were washed out and fallen trees that required maneuvering to get around. The insects were constant and my husband and I spent the entire hike out there madly swatting at buzzing creatures. The falls were gorgeous. Hike back was longer but fewer flying friends. About 4 hours total.', 'We hiked this last April and it was gorgeous. At the time lots of poison oak and the trails were washed out on lower section.', 'Like many have said there are trees down on both sides of the loop, not to hard to climb over though. On the lower sections how ever one of the gorges that had a small stream running across that path got blocked debris and diverted the street down along the trail. So roughly 15 yards or so of the trail is washed out. In addition to some other erosion further along at another point that makes the trail very narrow on a pretty steep hill. If you’re thinking of doing the loop it’s advisable that you stay on the upper part. Took about four hours to complete. Beautiful view at the end and along the way.', 'Wonderful trail with a beautiful view. It is long and is strenuous at parts. There are quite a few areas with downed trees. It took 4.5 hours with my 9 year old.', 'Took me 4 hours to complete, counting my little break I took on the lookout by the falls. Overall, the trail loop is very pretty, nicely shaded, and well cut, however, for about half of the west section of the loop it was terribly overgrown and not well marked. The lack of trail at one point and even less markings made me a little disoriented for the last quarter of the west side of the loop. But once I got through that by climbing logs and pushing/cutting a whole bunch of branches, the falls and the eastern part of the loop back made it all worth it:) \nBring bug spray, I was also being followed by a little cloud of gnats for a lot of the time', 'Beautiful hike. I went counter clockwise. Practically all downhill to the falls with a slight grade on the way back. The view of Feather Falls and the ravine is more than worth the hike.', 'In this trail’s defense, I should’ve read the reviews more closely before starting. I’m new to hiking & very much enjoy a well groomed trail, but in good shape, so I enjoy longer, harder trails in terms of elevation. This trail was difficult for me due to the fact that in 3 instances there are downed trees that are hard to get around, especially if you have a 20lb or less pup with you. The overgrowth on this trail was difficult for me as well. Also, when you get to the fork in the trail, if you go to the left, there’s a pretty large portion that’s washed out by a creek that I would imagine would be impassable during the spring months as it would probably be flowing much higher than it was today. My little mini schanuzer Norwich terrier made it, but I did have to carry him the last half mile and strenuous portion to the falls. I wouldn’t take him again. Take lots of water! The waterfall is beautiful but we were told by others on the hike that it’s much prettier in late Oct early Nov!', 'Gorgeous views and great workout!', 'We had a great time. Took fork to right on way in. Beautiful sites on the way. Upper Frey creek falls a pleasant surprise. Last 1/2 mile in to Feather Falls is strenuous but totally worth the reward. The view point lookout is a beautiful spot to soak in magnificent views of the falls and the river valley below. The short jaunt to top of the falls rewards you with a chance to soak the aching feet and knees in crystal clear creek. Great spot for picnic. Returned  by way of the lower or (left fork at start). The trail is in a bit of disrepair and a bit over grown  and the end hike out is a lot of uphill. Reward is given when you recross Frey Creek again.  Make sure to take bug spray the flies and gnats were a bit annoying. Fern fronds make an excellent back up fly swatter. Be on lookout for poison oak, very much in abundance on trail!! Lots of great viewpoints.', 'Don’t make our mistake. At the beginning of the hike we got to the fork in the path where you can go to the left or to the right, we went to the right....wrong choice leaving us with an up hill hike in the heat of the day and little shade. ( we made this decision based on a post in the hiking log that said “Go to the right”) This part of the hike is also not well maintained. If you are going in the summer months start early, use bug spray, take plenty of water and be prepared to climb over some fallen trees. The falls are beautiful!!!.', 'Beautiful falls. There are two trails to choose from. You’ll encounter the split about 1/4 mile after you leave the parking lot.  Going to the right will take you on a 5 mile trail that is reasonably gentle elevation wise.  The hike to the falls is mostly downhill, so the return hike involves more energy. The left (west) trail is only 4 miles long but much greater elevation change. You’ll drop 800’ in about two miles.  Remember that you’ll be facing that as the last part of your return trip. This trail’s low point is about 200’ below the falls. Climbing that in about 1.5 miles will be  your approach to the falls. I wouldn’t recommend this trail in the spring or early summer. The low point is literally in a creek that is probably impassable. On either trail bring plenty of water.  A purifier is handy as there are plenty of streams. Trail maintenance is infrequent.  I encountered a lot of overgrowth and two cases of the trail blocked by fallen trees.  Much of the overgrowth was blackberries:  lots of thorns and a few good berries. All in all a good hike but a but strenuous on the return.', "There was no sign on the fork & we didn't think of getting a map before we started so we took the trail on the left & apparently it was the more difficult one. About 3.5 miles in we saw a black bear near the trail ahead of us so we ended up having to walk back in fear & in silence without even seeing the waterfall. I've never walked so fast in my life. It was a great workout, but the trail could use some maintance.", "This trail wasn't worth the effort.  It's long, hot and honestly not that pretty (like some of the women from my past).  The trail is not well maintained, lots of plant life growing into the walking path you can't avoid walking through, a fallen tree you have to climb over.  If you are with a lady in booty shorts, she won’t like it and will keep telling you how much she dislikes it, trust me I know.  There's one good look out point where you can see the waterfall but you're not very close to it.  Other than that spot you can't ever really see it.  When you get to the top of the waterfall the angle is bad and you can't actually see the bottom or the water go off the cliff.  I will say the water at the top is nice, clear and refreshing to get in.  If you like pain with no payoff, this is for you, you masochist.", 'It was such a beautiful hike... perfect weather and beautiful swimming hole at the top of the waterfalls!', 'nice trail with many shaded areas. we take the lower loop in and the upper loop out. platform overlooks the falls. bit of a drive to get there from greater Sacramento area but worth it.', 'Amazing. I was alone all the hike long. It was easy to follow the hike, and it was shady both upper and lower. It is one of the best waterfalls in USA.', "Hiked the lower trail first which kept us in the shade and in the creek at times. There was one tree on the trail we had to work around. Feather Falls itself was great with a nice, but very sunny platform. The lower trail had lots of benches along the way and there are benches near the viewing platform in the shade. We took the upper trail back, which was a little longer, easier to hike, but had much more sun. Also, there was another tree on the trail we had to work around. There's a second unnamed falls along the upper trail that's also nice. The only complaint was that the poison oak and blackberry bushes are starting to reach a little far into the trail.Overall it was a great hike. Took us 5 hrs with 1 hr spent at the falls (we're also slow hikers).", 'Great trail! Pay attention to the sigh that says go left/right. Somebody wrote “this sucks” going that direction. Do the sucky side 1st and it’ll be downhill instead of going uphill.', 'A hidden gem. Thankful for previous reviewers and tips. We went yesterday and took our time. We went to the upper, longer or trail to the right then went back down to the 3.5ish mile back. Note that the sign for the fork is gone. The hike going back is full of obstacles like a stream taking over the trail, a tree on the path and some parts overgrown, but it was worth it when we came upon the swim hole near the end and the lady bug colony on the bridge. Be wary of footing as some paths on the edge could give in. Don’t miss the butterfly area on the longer trail by the longer bridge. The loop has so many wonderful benches. Take time to sit and ponder. Also notice the sounds of the streams and how they change in every bend. Do bring lots of water and food so taking time won’t be a problem. We almost had the park to ourselves. If John Muir came, this place would be packed. No fee as well. Enjoy! (Some trash here and there so we picked some reachable ones. Help keep the trash out as it seems hardly maintained.)', 'Love this trail! Overall fairly challenging. You’ll work up a bit of a sweat during the steep parts before making it to the outlook by the gorgeous waterfall. Be prepared for some extra weight if you have children with you. We brought along a 3 yr. old, which made for a long trek up to the waterfall, but she was a trooper and did surprisingly well! The way back down though, she was pretty wiped and we had to take turns carrying her for more than half of the trail. Would definitely do it again.', 'Beautiful trail but make sure you’re prepared!', "Great hike. Plan well, though. Lots of water or a water filter and snacks. Once you start you'll come to a fork. The lower trail is harder with more changes in elevation and more rocky obstacles where the top trail still has some but not as much. About 3 miles in (we started on the lower trail) you come to a wooden sign that says falls. Follow it, obviously...lol you're about 0.5miles to your destination. At that sign the other trail is the other way out. Towards the end there's a railing. If you look to the right just as the railing turns and takes you to the left there's an unmarked but obvious trail up to the top of the water falls. It's about .25 mile but so worth it!", "A Jere's Jaunts hike. My brother and I set a good pace but Marty blew our doors off. I think he believes all hikes are a workout/competition.  Lots of switchbacks on this trail but a good mix of scenery and the falls itself is really nice, one of the larger in our area.", 'Excellent hike!  Fairly level with some up-and downs on the upper trail, more significant elevation changes on the lower. Lots of mosquitoes, so bring bug spray!  Outlook point at the end is 100% worth it, bring a lunch and enjoy it at the end with a great view.', 'Feather Falls is beautiful, sacred and majestic. The trail has spectacular views. Truly a spiritual journey.', 'Beautiful trail.', "Beautiful hike. Would recommend taking the left fork going in and the opposite side of the loop out for an easier route. Bring lots of bug spray for yourself and your dogs. There's a good amount of shade throughout the hike.", 'Right on! This is my favorite so far.', 'Love this hike gorgeous gorgeous waterfall worth the hike in.  Lots of mosquitos today glad we took repellant.  Always lots of friendly families with kids and dogs.  This is a great family hike.', 'Love this hike. The view is great, we went in January. I recommend the extended hike pass the overlook to get to the top of the waterfall. There were a few downed trees that we had to go over or under, along the path. I’ve done the lower trail back and forth as well as the upper trail back and forth. Lower has more streams and shade. Upper has a nice small waterfall.. we did not run into any bugs during January but I have heard that gnats can be a issue during later months as well as mosquitoes.', 'great hike, awesome waterfall.', 'Great trail hike the views are worth the hike. start to the trail on the left all down hill great photo ops, and on the way out go left nice easy gradual hike back out.', 'Solid.  You can make it tomorrow steep or easy and either way you see the falls and the top of the river.', 'Beautiful place to hike and see Gods creation. about 8 miles  of trail. easier and longer by 1/2 mile way to go on the right  but shorter and steeper  on the way is on the left.  recomend this hike if you will be in that area of Oroville.', 'Wicked Kool', 'This hike is absolutely amazing. It is pretty difficult though. I’m 20 and I’m pretty good shape and it had me and both my friends sweating. The whole loop is gorgeous. Tons of wildlife like the California newt, banana slugs, and all the lizards you could want to see. On my second visit did run into a couple tiny Alameda striped Racer snakes. It’s an amazing hike for all ages but it is definitely a workout. 100% is a must do while you are in the area. I try and go at least once a week because it is just so beautiful.', 'Be careful! Poison Oak on this trail!', 'Great hike with amazing scenery. The waterfall is worth the distance. It was pretty tough taking the lower trail to get back as it is mostly uphill.', 'it was a long hike but worth it at the end', "Amazing waterfall. Easy to navigate.   Takes a long time to achieve the waterfall, but it's worth it!", 'Great place to hike !! Trail was very well maintained and easy to navigate. And the views were worth every bit of aching feet and back. Met lots of friendly hikers and dogs. Only disappointment was the graffiti and the trash and empty water bottles people left behind.', 'One of my all time favorites! Stunning scenery! Upper trail is easy, if you want a  difficult loop, hike the upper trail in & lower trail out (almost entirely up hill). Amazing beauty the entire trail any time of year! Not easy for young kids.', 'Very Nice', 'I really like this trail. I have done the full loop once in the summer and the last time we hiked the eastern 4.5 mile both ways to add some extra mileage. The waterfall is beautiful albeit a little touristy for my taste. A mostly shaded hike with some great views and wildlife. We have seen orange salamanders both times on the trail summer and winter. Dog friendly!', 'Nice hike. Several ticks were trying to attach to do and and one attached to my leg. Be prepared and check yourself and animals well.', 'one of my all time favorite hikes. easy terrain, no steep grades, but still an engaging hike to a gorgeous view. we often camp 1 or 2 nights at the trail head.', 'Such an amazing and beautiful hike.', 'Hiked here 2 weekends ago with the pup and it was great! Picked up 2 ticks early on but didn’t see anymore for the rest of the trail. Great views, peaceful walk. Only busy part was the overlook to the waterfall other than that we barely saw anyone else. Parking is easy at the trailhead but the bathrooms are GROSS.', 'I didn’t complain at all after I got to the end', 'Awesome trail! Sun was out with blue sky and temps in the upper 50’s. Started out a little chill but soon the jacket was off and sweating. Took the upper trail to the falls and returned on the lower. I would probably do the opposite next time because you’re going uphill the whole way back when returning on the lower trail. Stay to the left when the trail forks near the beginning & then follow the loop trail GPS. Ended up being 8 miles. Went during the week and it was so peaceful and tranquil.', 'Nice scenic trail. Forks off in the beggining and I chose the high road. On the trail by 7am had it all to myself! So peaceful', 'Did not take the loop everyone talked about went out to the outlook and back. Started from the main parking area. The directions link on all trails will take you right into the parking area. (Sometimes I find the not all the direct links are good but this one was spot on) I’m in good shape and it took me 80 minutes each way. Really pretty views. A decent moderate as others said. On a scale of 1-10 in difficultly I️ would give it a 4. Saw individuals of all ages and abilities. Trail is dog friendly:) enough traffic that I️ wasn’t isolated but also isolated enough to be with nature I️ solitude.', "Great hike, my wife's first over nighter. We loved it. Not quite a day hike for us but we jade a great time.", 'Erosion has plagued most of the trail as there are deep cuts and downed trees. Some of the sections can get pretty narrow. There are multiple water crossings (3 bridges/4 small streams) and plenty of sights. Look for Bald Cap Dome (similar to Half Dome in Yosemite) on the upper trail and watch out for ticks in the lower loop’s vegetation. There is also an optional route to the actual top off the falls instead of the viewing platform. You can eat lunch in the shade next to the river for a great afternoon of adventure.', 'This is one of a amazing hike, I have enjoyed thoroughly as it is in the Riparian Habitat. After nearly 0.5 mile the trail bifurcates into 2 trails, the lower and the upper trail. There are no trail markings there though. The lower trail is close to 3.8 mile and the upper trail is 4 to 5 miles. The lower trail is steep and the upper trail is gradual. I took the lower trail to reach the falls and took the upper trail for the return. This way the hike is lot more easier. Spring and Fall would be the ideal time for the hike. On the path of upper trail  you will get to see a Half dome formation similar to Yosemite and pass through another small falls. there is water around the year in these falls.', "it's open , the fires didn't reach the campsites or trails, but alot of people lost their home on the road that leads up their . besides all the natural disasters it's one of the best dog friendly trails in the area.", 'Great trail! Definitely worth it, the falls are gorgeous. The trail is very well maintained, the grade is steep and long, but worth every step!', 'Currently closed due to fire', 'Awesome loop had a blast and view is great', '', 'Absolutely breath taking! Most of the trail is shaded by trees and pass through few creeks to cool down', "I was maybe a little unprepared for this hike. We had seen a couple and asked asked whether to take the 3.3 or the 4.5 trail to get to the falls they suggested the 4.5. This led us to 11 miles once we were done. Also didn't help we went on such a hot day it was over 100. Only because we weren't rewarded with a swimming hole that we could take a dip in. We did however stop at the first falls which was about 2 miles in. The actual Feather falls Waterfall was thriving and beautiful but there is lack of shade once you get to the look out point. Be very prepared with lots of water and aware of the no swimming holes to cool down in. Also that its a tad longer than what the site says depending on if you take the lower trails.", 'lots of water and make sure you start early', 'If you are going to go behind the falls, please be aware to not get in the water, and use your common senses. The lower trail is still in disrepair after this winter.', 'Very nice hike. We took the upper trail to the Falls and came back the same way. It is a little longer than the loop. Other reviewers mentioned the lower trail was in disrepair so we skipped it. Ended up being more like an 11 mile hike round trip. Not strenuous but a satisfying, lengthy hike with a beautiful view of Feather Falls.', 'I would suggest taking the 3.3 in and the 4.5 out.', "This is a nice moderate trail. If you want to complete the loop, I'd recommend going down on the Lower Trail and back up on the Upper Trail.  As others have pointed out, the Lower Trail is not only steeper (and shorter), but it is in disrepair. This means some scrambling is needed to navigate it. If you have little ones, you might want to stick to the Upper Trail. We went down on the Lower Trail and back out on the Upper Trail.  My three-star rating reflects the heavy erosion on the Lower Trail. If it were in better condition, I'd give this trail four stars.\n\nThe trail is mostly shaded, although the Upper Trail does have some spots with direct sun exposure. We were there in late May and it was pretty hot and humid, We also got a late start driving to the area from Sacramento.  I think the trail is probably best completed in late April/early May when the wildflowers are out and it's not too hot.  \n\nYou are rewarded with fabulous views of Feather Falls. The falls are exceptionally powerful this year (2017) after a much-needed long and wet winter.  The Lower and Upper Trails meet near the falls.  Once you get to the falls, you can hike down into the canyon for unobstructed views of the falls (the Overlook). This trail is pretty eroded right now, but it's worth getting a nice view (I posted the requisite picture with a rainbow).  You can also hike up and around the canyon to get to the top of the falls.  We did this after the Overlook and ate lunch at the top of the falls. It can get a little crowded with families, but it is a nice shady spot to take a break before hiking up and out of the canyon. \n\nI'd recommend bringing bug spray. I seemed to attract them the second I stop to take in the views and a drink of water.  Getting an early morning start would have alleviated having to deal with bugs.  Also, I recommend bringing sunblock. Even though the trail is pretty shaded, there are sections with sun exposure and you will likely need to reapply given the length of the hike.\n\nOverall, an excellent day hike for those living in the Sacramento area.  Get an early start and try this trail before the summer heat sets in.", 'This is a lovely, mostly shady and relatively flat hike if you take the "upper loop". The old oak and madrone trees are spectacular! I do not recommend the lower trail as it is deeply rutted and hikers are just making the erosion and damage worse. Hopefully the Forest Service will close it and make some much needed repairs.', 'The brush is growing into the trail and there are a few logs crossing the trail. It would be helpful to bring some clippers.', "Maybe my favorite hike ever! We went on a misty morning in April. Dogwoods in bloom. Moss everywhere. Newts crossing the path so frequently that you really need to watch out not to step on one. Absolutely gorgeous canopy and trail. A great shady hike into a magical forest. We went lower trail in, hooked left up to feather falls and then upper trail out. Pretty steep climb coming out, Make sure to bring enough water. We'll be going again in the fall and likely once every spring at least. Can't recommend this trail enough!", "Mother's Day hike yesterday, weather was perfect, not hot, still green with flowers and lots of water.  Went short in and long out, it was not easy but worth it", 'Enjoyed the hike with my family  & our dog! The lower trail does have a few washed out spots so be careful in those areas.', "WOW JUST WOW! First off I want to thank Steve and Chris for hiking and recording our event this morning. We started at 7:30AM and we were done by 11:00AM for a total of 9 miles. The main waterfall was a very beautiful site to see. We took the 4 1/2 mile route and it was very challenging coming back the other way. After the fall it was pretty much an up hill hike, so be prepare for a nice 2 1/2 up climb going back the parking area. There are about four awesome water area and you can even camp out there. Be aware of all the poison oak, it's everywhere. Overall this was one of my top 3 hikes. Do enjoy and be safe. God bless!", 'Love this hike! Beautiful scenery and being a loop hike makes it that much more enjoyable.', 'Moderate to hard hike with lots of hills. Bring lots of mosquito repellant! Amazing and beautiful!', 'Remember...what goes down most certainly comes back up at the end. Save your energy if you do the whole loop.', '♥️beauty all around', 'Beautiful hike, I had the trail and the waterfalls for myself in the morning, since I started early. I camped at the trail head: nice basic campground. The return hike around noon was much more crowded. With the exceptional rainfalls we had this year, every creek and fall was "at full capacity", and the nature was in full bloom. Beware of the newts that cross the trail: there was so many of them that you had to be careful not to step on them, especially in the cool, humid morning...', 'Have done this a couple times, most recent 2 weeks ago, lower trail eroded badly in spots, waterfall is gushing, beautiful.', 'Great hike!  We took the 3.3 mile section to the Falls and can back the 4.5 mile side.', 'Amazing    Took the left side (steep) in and other way out.  Extra mile to go to the top of the falls and back. Well worth it!', 'It was a great day lots and lots of hikers of all ages on the trail', "Just did this hike on Sunday, 4/23. It was beautiful and definitely worth the two hour drive from Sacramento. There was A LOT of poison oak. The trail is pretty well shaded. There's a fork in the trail right before you get to the falls overlook. There's a sign that says overlook left, but doesn't say what the right part leads to. We went that way and it takes you to the river right before the falls and a small group camping site for backpackers. We ended up setting up my hammock and taking a nap by the river for a couple hours. Even though the trail was pretty crowded on Sunday, we were the only ones in that area.", 'Beautiful trail, but arrive early (7-9 am) and spend the entire day here. I came with my family and everyone was able to finish the 8 mile loop trail and witness the beauty of the 410 ft Feather Falls. Bring lots of water (I would recommend 2 liters per person) and avoid the POISON OAK!!!', 'Took this hike yesterday with my gf and it was amazing...we did the loop starting with the short route in and long route out, we have not hiked since last summer and was a great start the year off trail. Trails are in pretty good condition considering all the rain we got. Only issue is lots of trash along the trail and took away from the beauty, we packed out twice more then what we hiked in with. PEOPLE PLS PACK OUT YOUR TRASH!! and even a little more it never hurts.', 'I definitely enjoyed this hike', 'beautiful wet easter hike.. plan for a full day. this is not an easy hike by any means. my wife and i spent almost 3 hours hiking in close to 4 miles and still never reached the falls. if we would have kept going and didnt turn back whg en we did we would have been stuck at the top of the mountain in the dark. we barely made it out before dark. alot of the trails were missing washed away from the rains so we had to improvise but over all it was nice. its not an easy ', 'Went backpacking with the family.  Camped about 1/2 mile past the falls.  Saw very little wildlife,  Trail was quite on Friday and fairly busy on Saturday.  Lots of water, several times we had to cross or walk along water flowing on the trails.  Beautiful hike.', 'Fantastic falls!  Been wanting to see these 7th highest falls in US for a long while and we finally got to!  IMPORTANT NOTE:  if you are set on doing the loop, our family highly recommends you take the shorter 3.3 mile trek (to the left at fork) FIRST/down the canyon and return after you see the falls on the longer 4.5 mile trek.  While 4.5 miles is longer, it is very flat (see topo maps here) while the 3.3 leg is steep down, it is so super difficult coming back up on the return, especially with kids and slightly out-of-shape adults.   Have fun!!!!  And oh yeah, if you take dogs, watch for:1. Low poison oak along trail in Spring, and 2.  Ticks.   Our daughter found 3 during, and 4 after the hike.', 'Best season to hike.  Few people for a popular trail.  Fall are running at full force.  Weather mild.  BEWARE trails have been damaged from spring run off, recommend water resistant shoes/boots and bring a hiking pole.  It is beautiful.', "Beautiful but in all we walked about 11.5 miles. We stayed to the left and that definitely seemed to be the best route. The water all around was amazing and the trails were well maintained if not washed out from the rains. There are ways around though, or even through. Wild flowers, banana slugs and salamanders were everywhere it was bordering on magical. The Feather Falls were spectacular. Note: tons of ticks, I've never seen so many", 'The pain is totally worth the gain. I will definitely be back.', 'great trail!', 'Awesome hike today. The 4.5 mile route was great but the 3.3 mile route had a few obstacles. Totally worth it though:)', 'Very alive and beautiful. Many greens and streams to feast your eyes on. Have me a good sweat on the way back to the parking lot. Highly recommend!', 'Tough but worth the hike.', "Great trail!  Start your trek early in the AM to avoid the crowds. When you reach the fork on the trial, take your pick;The right turn has a light descent with a nice smaller waterfall and swimming hole on the way. The left turn is a shorter trail but... much steeper descending and ascending hills. There are a couple good swimming spots this way also. Take caution, there are a few large size wash-outs along the way. Great views on this route as well.  Either way, you will end up at the falls and you won't be disappointed!Personally, I like the up better than down so I prefer to take the right trail in and do the other trail out. You really should make the loop, it's worth it! PACK YOUR TRASH!! Keep NorCal clean", "Beautiful!!! We took our jogging stroller and went for it! We didn't do the loop due to flooding but we went 4.5 miles in and 4.5 miles out! The water was breath taking and the forest was perfect. Out feet got wet which made for a rough hike but enjoyable nonetheless! Will be doing it again very soon!", 'Great work out, it was raining when we went here last Saturday but definitely worth it. Waterfall was amazing specially after that heavy rain. We took the feather loop trail clock wise route & I will definitely suggest this. U will see another waterfalls, more miles (9 miles total) and scenic view.', 'Definitely a good workout! The waterfall is beautiful.', 'Loved It!', 'LOVE this trail! Just did it yesterday. We knew it was going to rain and decided to do it anyways. Beautiful scenery. It is a difficult hike so keep that in mind when going.', "Beautiful hike, I've done this loop three times, it never gets old.", "The falls were well worth the hike but there are some things to keep in mind. It is not the season for this trail so there were lots of overgrown bushes and fallen trees right on the trail. Had to go off trail to go around these obstacles. Also due to all the rain, part of the trail has turned into a little stream, so your feet will definitely get wet. TONS of poison oak, so wear protective clothing and be mindful. Also when I was going to make the loop around there trail was not well marked (at this time of year/ or for me at least) so I turned around and went back the way I came. I took the 3.5 mile section. A LOT OF STEEP UPHILL, SO keep that in mind. Not sure how the other side is. All in all, it was a good hike but I'll probably go back between March and November like is recommended. :)", 'Great hike. Beautiful creeks and the falls were worth the hike.', 'Started with the 3.5 mile section and came back on the 4.5 mile section.3.5 mile section is mainly alot down hill with an increase in elevation around the 2.5 mile mark.The 4.5 mile section is a more gradual increase in elevation back to the parking lot.Only complaint was the garbage that we saw off the sides of the trails.If you pack it in, pack it back out !!!!', 'Lovely hike, mostly shaded, great surface. Needs a bit better signage.', 'little hard, but totally worth it.', 'nice view at the water fall', 'Not , a good time when it starts raining .. But , well worth it ..', 'Awesome views. Bring plenty of water. The end was a little steep. Great hike!', 'Bring bug spray, excellent hike, falls are beautiful, defiantly     a moderate hike, the "loop" consists of following either trail, go to the overlook, then back to the tree with the bench, then go your opposite direction ( yeah we missed that part) the steps up from the overlook take you to the top of the falls, but then come back down the same direction, in shape, went thru 66 oz of water..... Start early it gets hot ..... 8/27/16....', "This was a good hike. We took a trail along the stream that eventually took us to the lower Falls and then when we went to the Upper Falls. Make sure you get there early in the morning because there's not a lot of shade and it can get really hot.", 'Love it ! Beautiful waterfall and very scenic :) hike was hard on the way back due to steep slopes.', "always a fun hike. There's water in the falls which is nice. Definitely go beyond the overlook to the river, the water is not too cold. We dipped in it for several minutes and it helped keep us cool on the way back. I've done the 4.5 in and 3.3 out several times (it's more of a workout), but this time did 3.3 in and 4.5 out and still moderate but not as exhausting. Take plenty of water, and bug spray. The plus was no rattlers this time (yes they do exist in this area), but we did see a lovely black and yellow long snake- so keep your eyes open on the trail.", 'Decent hike, moderate. For a challenge not only hike counter clockwise but go to top of falls. Counter clockwise gives you switch back climb on last leg of hike.', "We hiked this trail the first weekend in June and It was the first time we hiked it. Just at the info. suggests, it is moderately trafficked trail and the difficultly level is also moderate. It was great weather for this hike, but make sure to take plenty of water! I suggest taking bug spray since I was bit almost every time I stopped on the trail. Since we started late (11:30 am), we decided to start the loop by going right, because we didn't want to run into a lot of people. This was a good decision that worked for us. We only ran into a few groups on this side of the trail. The views were amazing and hanging out by the waterfall to cool off  was worth the hike! We rested for about 30 mins at the waterfall before deciding to head back out on the other trail, to complete the loop. We ran into fewer people on our way out and saw millions of ladybugs! It was great! We also brought our two dogs with us. They loved this trail was much as we did. Just be aware of ticks. After getting home, we found a tick on each dog.", 'Have done this hike with my teen age boys many times. taking my Daughter for the first time today.', "This was a beautiful hike, the falls were amazing. This was a difficult hike for us on the way back. We are new to hiking and fluffy, had a difficult time walking back up to the top. Still a great experience all the hikers we crossed were very nice and supportive once they found out this was our first hike. We made a goal to go back and make it to the top of the falls (didn't quite get there on this trip). Bring bug repellant the mosquitos are bad especially, if you stop to rest they just swarm you. All in all a great experience and we will be back!", "Took my younger siblings and it was not a good idea.  Two were crying, it was just too much for them. Even for myself it was tough.  I would do it again though.  Also bring lots of repellent, mosquitos are out for blood! My wife's back is covered in bites even though we sprayed before staring the hike.", 'Took this hike using the longer more gradual trail down to the falls and back which was good for our mixed level hikers. The trail is clean and wide with almost no difficult areas to navigate. The falls are beauuuuuutiful and the path worth the extra miles. This was a long but not difficult climb, would like to try the shorter more difficult trail at some point.', "Awesome trail! Did the 4.5 up then 3.3 back. If you're looking for a workout, do the 3.3 back. All uphill! The falls itself is awesome, great view.", "Great hike. I had read an article that suggested to hike the 4.5 mile hike to the falls and the 3.3 mile hike back so that it would be one less mile coming back up the hill. After taking this route I would not recommend it. The 3.3 miles back up is very steep and there's really not much to see on that trail. If you want to do the entire loop I recommend taking the 3.3 to the falls and the 4.5 back because even though it's longer on the way back it's a gradual climb and there's so much more to see on this trail. If we were to go again we would just hike the 4.5 both ways. This trail also has a beautiful smaller waterfall and a bridge about 2 miles in which is a great place to rest on your way back up the hill. Lots of overgrown areas after the 2 mile marker and lots of insects!  Feather Falls itself is absolutely beautiful:)", "Great hike! Just under 7 miles. We took the trail on the left and came back the same way. Water is really flowing! Bring insect repellent as you can't sit for too long before getting swarmed. Highly recommended!", 'awesome hike', 'Have done this hike many times and it never fails to please! The falls are spectacular.  Neither trail leading to the falls is killer strenuous either direction for anyone who hikes or walks regularly.  Last time I went on a Monday and noticed litter (and t.p.) left over by weekend hikers >:-(  Why do people do this?! Otherwise the trails themselves are very well maintained.', 'Weekends are heavily trafficked but still a fun fun hike! This was the best wild flower hike in a long time! The falls are a 10 of 10 and the trail is well shaded for summer hiking!  For new hikers we suggest taking the 3.3 leg first and return on the 4.5 leg.  We picked up a little trash left behind from insensitive hikers.', "Please all trails label this as dogs on leash because we were looking for a dog friendly trail and this one is :-) I even called the wild life head quarter and asked. Also there is free camping. If you take the lower loop back from the falls it is all up hill but it's still a pretty easy hike for the regularly active. Took the upper loop in and the lower loop back, only took about 4.5 hours and we weren't running. The over look is beautiful but it's also fun to go stand at the top of the falls themselves. Definitely worth it.", 'great hike!', 'Great hike.  Well maintained trail.', "It was amazing! I've lived in the area most of my life and this is the first time I've hiked this. The madrone trees were massive. The water fall was flowing great with all the rain we have had this winter. Recommended hike for sure!", 'Awesome hike!', 'Not as easy as rated!!!!', 'It was good minus the bad weather! We were soaking wet from the rain! Great location! Beautiful scenery!', 'Beautiful trail, Great time to go right now with the water flowing strong.', 'Great trail... Not as easy as rated. Going in was easy... Coming back was hard. Over all. It was a great beautiful trail.', "Awesome trail! We took the higher trail on the way in and the lower trail on the way back. The lower trail on the way back walks definitely challenging! On the way in, we stopped to take pics at a small fall that goes under a bridge. It was a great spot! We continued up to the lookout and saw Feather Falls. Since we've had some recent rain it was raging!! We decided to go to the top of the fall so we took the trail that goes up to the top, and hung out for a bit. Then we hiked back via the lower trail. Lots of fun! Get there early as it is pretty popular place! All in all sweet hike!!!", 'Great place to hike/run. Very scenic, love it everytime!', "Excellent trail with a very beautiful waterfall for your reward. I was quite happy to be the first on the trail in 2016, so I had it all to myself on the way in. Saw a bear on the way in. As soon as he saw me he took off running in the other direction. My GPS recorded 8.5 miles and 1720 vertical feet. Don't pass up a chance to do this trail. The fall are gorgeous!", "Although it rained will I was backpacking here it was an incredible experience and beautiful view. If you can find your was to this trail I would highly recommend it. But just know it isn't well maintained, there is a bit of trash along the way. So if you go bring a trash bag to pick up the trash you see to keep this amazing place clean and eco friendly. Other that the trash you can almost compare it to a more forest version of Yosemite", "I was racing sunlight so I couldn't make it up the falls trail, however I did do the loop in a little over 2 hours. I took the longer trail down, and came up the shorter- yet steeper- side. I consider myself to be an average hiker, and this climb gets you sweating... I wouldn't rate it as easy. Beautiful hike, but give yourself plenty of time to do it. I ended up running the first half of it just to make sure I made it back by sun down. My device tracked a little over 9 miles. Cheers!", 'I always love doing this hike! I would recommend doing the 3.3 miles in and the 4.5 miles out. The shorter trail is pretty much downhill the first couple of miles, so going back up that way would be exhausting. The perfect time to go is spring and fall. Summer is just excruciating and not as enjoyable. There are different scenic points where you get some amazing views. You can also go down to the deck or hike another half a mile up and go to the top of the waterfall. Bring a ton of water and snacks to enjoy a picnic when you get to the waterfall.', 'Did not like this hike.  It was long, waaay to hot and very little payoff at the end.  The falls were a trickle, there were hornets and yellowjackets everywhere.  Not worth it.  Maybe a better hike in very early summer or late spring.', "1. It's not 8 miles of you want to see the waterfall. (And who doesn't?) My phone logged 10+miles. With a quick lunch & a couple rests, it took us almost 4 hours. (And we ran part of the trail & were passing people.)\n2. DO NOT TAKE THE LONG TRAIL FIRST thinking you'll have it easier on the way back!!! We made that mistake. Taking the short trail back means you have a HUGE climb up for the last 2 miles. It sucked.\n3. The trail is clearly marked the whole way, but it's not always a cleared pathway. There are some challenges. We climbed over a couple downed tress & hopped a few streams. It's not a nature walk. It's a hike, for sure. \n4. There's seriously bears. Know what to do. Have something to defend yourself. Be alert. \n\nI don't know if I'd do this one again, but it's a pretty cool hike.", 'Good hike.  My 11yr old went with me and had no problem.  Beautiful single track that opens up to see the falls.  We missed seeing the ladybug hibernation but suspect that would make the trip a 5 star event.\n\nThe parking lot felt a little sketchy so we hid everything really well.  Another hiker saw a bear we did not.  However, encountered an unwelcoming group of hikers with mean dogs off leash, was pretty intense.  I would not hike this trail alone.', 'Long hike. One of my favorite falls! Can hike to the top and look down. Awesome view! And scary!', 'Really nice hike. Our favorite time to go is March. It is not too hot and the falls have more water. Be careful about bears. There are a lot up there and we have seen a couple when we have gone up really early (just after sunrise). This one is good for dogs too, not to hard and a lot of shady areas.', "Fun hike to get the heart beating and the sweat dripping! We took the short trail in and the longer trail back out. The extra little part up above the falls is definitely worth it. On a hot day, I bet the water would feel great. On a hot day, you'll definitely want lots of water. Can see a lot of wildlife (ladybugs, lizards, birds, snakes, slugs...) and very pretty wildflowers.", 'two trails to the falls. the hike winds you through the pines and wild flowers. one trail takes you past a small water fall; perfect for your best for legged friend to take a dip in. the hike gets slightly steep towards the last stretch. when you catch the view of the sixth tallest waterfall in the u.s. it makes it worth it. hike the shorter trail on your way out to get a glimpse of some old native grind stones', "Easy trail. Did the loop.  (about 9miles) Took a star off because of the mosquitoes. Can't catch a break longer then 2 minutes without getting attacked. The fall is amazing. They have a look out patio with a great view of the fall and canyons. You can also hike to the top of the fall itself. They have a fence because someone fell from the top of the Water fall and died.", 'Took the upper loop to falls and lower loop back to trailhead. most people were doing it the other way saying it was easier..\n\nThe trail scenery was meh..the reward for a semi-monotonous hike is really the falls. Definitely worth it.  The wildflowers blooming this time of year also added enjoyment to the trail. Bald rock dome was also an interesting feature. Some tagging/vandalism noted...what a shame.', "I loved this hike. pack plenty of water. had a snack at the overlook, and added the extra mile to go to the top of the falls, well worth it! beautiful up there! Hike the short one in, it's tough but the long way out is nice when your tired. or if you don't want to do the loop long both ways. I've always been an active person and am out of shape and over weight at the moment, but found the hike, moderate with a few easy places.", "worth doing! best time is winter for temperature. waterfall incredible especially in spring. have done it about 3 times, bit of a drive. fun with a group, picnic lunch to enjoy out on platform overlook. hike itself isn't anything to write home about with all our varieties in Sierra but destination is fabulous! prefer walking clockwise at the loop due to hills, if you need it easy, go in and out in same direction as opposed to making loop, fork to right whichi is gradual whole distance. fork at left is up and down with few steep sections", "Awesome hike, my husband and I will be sore tomorrow, but worth the hike. Bring plenty of water, maybe a couple ibuprofen if you're doing the whole loop, your muscles will thank you.", "I have been on this hike twice now and it is a good hike and even better workout.  The waterfall is awesome and the platform is perfect for viewing.  I even got top gunned by someone in an air force jet.  You know the scene where Maverick dose the fly by and the General spills his coffee.  I didn't spill my coffee, but that jerk had to be messing with me, he couldn't of been more than 100 feet overhead.", "I went on this hike with my best friend Getlin. We decided to take the easier path to make the hike last a little longer however nothing went as planned. To start, the trail is great but horribly marked! We found plenty of plaques and signs about the wild life and about the area however vary few to none about the falls look out spot. If only someone had told us the trail was behind an unmarked bench then we would have explored those little trails but once again there is no sign or anything to imply that there was a look out! We ended up walking the easy trail down at 4.3 miles long and the harder trail back which was 3.3 miles up hill lol. In the end we where exhausted however we felt like we achieved something so we will be doing this trail again and I'm bringing some bright ribbon to at least mark the trail a little. We completed the trail in 3 hours with three 5 minute breaks!", "Overall, this is a great hike.  You can either do the loop or just do a simple out and back on one leg.  Getting there around 9am was awesome.  There was no one around till much later (11am-1pm)  The hiking is from easy to moderate.  Currently the falls are awesome!  I highly recommend spending the time to drive out there and do the hike.  Based on a review I expected to see a bunch of trash but didn't see any.  Also as of 24 Jan 15, the lower loop bridge is open.  Have fun!  \n\np.s. Stopping for lunch for about 30 minutes at the falls and moving at a moderate speed with little breaks, my wife and I completed this in 4:15 hours total.", 'I went in the Winter after a decent rain. The falls were magnificent. Well worth the effort.', "This get three stars because it is a cool area and the falls are great and the deck by the falls is a nice mid-hike break. BUT, I was reluctant to give it that many stars because this was literally the most trashed trail I've ever seen in California. It was so bad I suspect it might be deliberate. Dog crap on the trails. Water bottles all over the place. Cans crunched and thrown into weeds. Switchbacks all scraped off from cutting corners, one of which I actually saw a hillbilly-as-style-choice in motorcycle boots ski down, soil spilling everywhere. The bridges are busted and spray tagged. Cigarette butts EVERYWHERE. There were wrappers and tissues scattered about. The signs were tagged with markers. The bathrooms looked like crime scenes. It's a dirty shame that a trail with this much potential has to be ruined by trashy people.", 'on august 30 2014 myself my dog and my friends family of 4 a 4 year old girl and a 10 year old boy and his wife we hiked the trail in 6 hours round trip long way in and out due to the mistaken belief that the bridge was out on the shorter route with 30 min for lunch at the overlook . was a beautiful hike started at 8:15 am the gnats were terrible on the way in but gone on the way out (thank the lord) took 2 24 ounce bottles of water for myself and 3 small bottles of water for my dog ran outta water 5 minutes from parking lot so a little more water would have been nice but overall the hike was completely awsome the falls were low but still beautiful the only problems were poison oak (everywhere) the prolific swarms of gnats in the morning and the turnoff to the overlook was not indicated on a sign so we got about .5 extra miles b4 another hiker straightend us out but awsome and I will be doing it again enjoy!!', "3 Hours?roundtrip I don't know how that is possible, well maybe for trail running.\nStarted at 1:30pm,....got to the fall at 3pm..took a hour break at the overlook & Waterfall spot.\nstarted walking around 4pm at 4 mile left water running empty less than 10oz of water.\nmade it back by 6pm 92degree 68% humidity. becareful, bring water in summer time.\n\nThe Waterfall itself is a bit low...not as amazing.\n4th time on this trail. summer time is alot harder when its hot.", 'We did this hike with a 13 year old and a 7 year old.  It was a beautiful and fun hike.  We hiked the 4.5 mile rout both to and from.  It was a bit long for the kids, but fun all the same.  The falls are breathtaking- especially if you hike over to the top.  A highly recommended hike- take plenty of water...', 'I hiked this trail twice. Both short and long routes & went up to the top of the falls. A good part of the trail is shady, but lots of mosquitoes. My friends and I were covered in mosquito bites. Bug spray the second time kept the bug bites to a minimum.', "I think the people commenting on here are superhuman.  We took the shorter route to the falls and the longer route back out.  I think the signs say  3.5 in on the short route and 4.5 miles out on the long route.   On the way in we stopped at the bridge and splashed some water on ourselves.  At the falls we spent maybe 20-30 minutes.  On the way out we stopped and splashed more water on ourselves.  Parked at 1200 and returned to the parking lot at 1900.  Without taking breaks I would guess over 5 and a half hours.   The mosquito's are horrible and the poison oak is everywhere.  TAKE PLENTY OF WATER!!! We ran out of water with 3 miles left.", "Nice hike, but long be prepared. I took my dog so I had him carry all the stuff I brought. Beware of ticks! My dog never got any due to the Frontline but guess who did? Yep me! Waterfall isn't as spectacular as I would have liked but if you want to be in nature its a nice hike. Went in the spring and there were too many bugs for my liking but could have just been a bad day.", 'Very nice hike. We took the lower loop trail into the falls and the upper loop back to the parking area. The lower loop is mostly downhill for the first 2+ miles, and the last 1+ mile is uphill. The upper loop on the way out was fairly flat for the first 1 1/2 mi. Then mostly uphill for the next 3 mi. The falls and scenery were very nice. Start early and pack a lot of water and snacks. With breaks and time at the falls plan on 4 to 4 1/2 hrs.', "St. Patty's day walk was fun. 8.4 miles total round trip. 3.3 miles on the lower loop to the head of the falls trail, then 4.5 back on the upper loop returning to the parking area. The shorter loop descends for approximately 2.2 miles and then ascends the last 1.1 mile. The upper and lower loops come together where the trail to the falls is located which is about 0.6 miles round trip. The upper loop is longer but the altitude change is not as dramatic as the lower loop and in turn is a much easier hike. I recommend hiking the lower loop to the falls and the upper loop back to the parking area to avoid the 2 mile ascent of the lower loop. Though the overall hike would be quicker it would also be significantly harder. Also, the lower loop is not very difficult but the trail itself is not as wide or as easy to hike as the upper loop is. There is an old broken bridge on the lower loop which may be hard for small kids but average adults should be able to cross it easily. The upper loop is overall a safer route for kids or those concerned with ability. Total time with 10 min at the falls and 15 minute break at the scenic bridge on the upper trail on the way back was 3 hours 15 min for 8.4 miles. Good hike to inspire more adventures and build confidence.", 'Ive hiked this twice now and each time notice more and more details. Today, it was the millions of ladybugs migrating that I was able to capture. They are found @ Frey Creek along the shorter trail. What a sight they were to see! I have uploaded a few photos from the hike today. Took the long path out and the shorter one back...came out to 9.4 miles (verified via Jawbone Up). The weather was an amazing 72 deg. I recommend this to anyone before it gets any colder. 4.5hrs with a 4 year old and a pair of teenagers! Pack a lunch and some H2O!', "This was a great hike.Take the upper trail (longer) to the Falls and then the lower (shorter) trail home. They say the lower trail is closed but it really isn't. The path is in great condition with the only problem being a bridge that is broken but it is easy to navigate and most people take that trail. There is a upper/lower trail split about a half mile into the hike. There is a lot of poison oak so wear long pants. The paths are in excellent condition. We were surprised at how much water was still flowing over the falls this late in the season. Heat was definitely a factor so start early. Although the trail is 80% deeply shaded, it still gets hot as the day progresses. When we arrived back at the car at 1pm it was 95° and the last mile (+) is all switchbacks up hill.", "One of my favorite hikes. Go up the longer but easier route and come back the shorter but a lot more taxing route. It's beautiful, it's a workout. The viewing deck is nice to see the falls straight on but gets crowded and hot. Hike a further 0.5miles or so to get to area before the falls.........it's beautiful and quiet. You can get into the river and cool down (don't do this in the moving part or close to the falls, people have died here), have snacks, nap etc.\nRattlers come out in the warm months so be careful. \nDefinitely not to be missed.\n\nDid it for 3rd time, still strenuous but wonderful. No rattlers in early March", "The hike was beautiful this past weekend. The lower trail (3.3 mile) was closed and the upper trail (4.5 miles) is in great shape. Trail was lined with wild flowers and A LOT of poison oak right now so be aware. The falls were spectacular and the viewing deck was quite busy by noon. It was about 90 degrees on Saturday and while the viewing deck doesn't have any shade there are benches in the shade just before the deck.  Used more water than anticipated, recommend two bottle for each hiker minimum. Sunscreen as well. Enjoy the falls and prepare for the moderate grind back to the parking lot. You'll know you've done something by the time you're done.", "I have been waiting to go check out the falls for the last couple years but I wasn't in as good of shape as I am now; my husband and I finally made it! The first 4 miles are generally easy/moderate; generally smooth and wide with some minor rocky spots. Lots of ups and downs. The last mile is where the strenuous comes in.  Steeper inclines and lots of rocks and to get to the final falls viewing platform. Lots of people eat lunch in that final platform but there is no shade so keep that in mind. Overall a great hike; took us about five hours and we went the longer way  both directions so we traveled about 9 1/2 miles. Make sure you wear cool clothing, bring sunscreen, and plenty of water. ", 'Great hike, but I hate the down and in/up and out hikes :-)  The falls are spectacular, however we went last year right after a student from CSU Chico went over the falls making the mood somber.', "The hike itself is just beautiful but the reward at the end is breathtaking!  I hiked this on a beautiful spring day and the flow of the falls is quite voluminous!  I took the upper trail to the falls and the lower trail back.  The lower trail had a few spots that were a bit tricky.  If you hike in on the lower trail, watch out for the first bridge.  There's a gap between the beginning of the bridge and the trail that would be easy to get your foot caught in.  The hike to the falls on the upper trail was a breeze.  The hike back on the lower trail really kicked my behind.  We got started at 8:30 am and there was hardly a soul.  When we finished at 12pm, the parking lot was packed.  Get an early start!  Great hike!  \n\nOh and one more thing - be super vigilant for poison oak!  That stuff was EVERYWHERE.  As long as you keep your arms and legs either covered or well away from the edges of the trail, you will be ok.", 'Excellent trail!  You wont be disappointed!! Everyone says take the lower trail first then loop back from the upper but found it much easier the opposite direction.  There are signs posted that the lower fall bridge is out, while the bridge is damaged its very easily passable and worth the hike!', "There is a large free parking lot at the trail head that also features some campgrounds and a toilet that doesn't seem to be cleaned or stocked much.   Dogs are permitted.   Mountain bikes are permitted. \n\nThe shorter, lower trail is closed as a bridge is out.  \nThe longer upper trail is in good condition with some trees across the trail in places, all easily passable.  There is no rock climbing or such on this trail, it is well groomed.  It is a lovely hike with nice views of the forest, the canyon and a nice creek crossing.  At the Feather Falls overlook, there is a nice platform were one can sit and enjoy the view of the waterfall and down the canyon.  One can go a little bit further and be at the top of the falls themselves!  \n\nAt the place where the upper and lower trails come together near the falls, the sign post says it is 4.5 miles back to the parking area.  I think this hike is actually close to 10 miles round trip.  \n\n\n", 'A well worth hike to go on. The trail was well maintained & the scenery was beautiful to look at. We hiked up and down the 4.5 trail to the falls because the bridge is down for the 3.5 trail. 10 miles was def a long stretch but seeing the sights was amazing.', 'Beautiful trail, strenuous in parts, buts its the sheer length 9miles round trip that is the challenge.  Amazing views, well kept trail, not busy at all.  Bring water as there is no potable source.  ', 'Loved it! Beautiful. The falls were cool we ate lunch next to the cascading water.  Will do it again for sure. ', 'This trail is rated moderate??  Well for this 64 year old grandmother it was definitely strenuous.  A beautiful hike though.  Our GPS said total mileage was 9.6 all the way to the Falls overlook and back.  This was for the upper trail as the lower trail was closed.  The last half mile to the falls and the last 2 miles back to the parking lot were pretty strenuous.  Even in mid-autumn the Falls were spectacular.  \n\nBe sure to take water and use the restroom in the parking lot as there are no other bathroom facilities.', 'What a great little hike.  4 miles one way. The upper-longer trail is easier than the lower-shorter trail. Pretty moderate hike, a few challenging hills but the falls is well worth the trip. There is a really nice viewing platform for great pictures. If you wish to swim in the falls river, you must go past the  platform and past the fenced cliff overhang. Once up river there are a few nice campsites for small groups.', 'This is a wonderful trail to hike, just be sure you give yourself enough time to make it to the falls and back before sundown. My mistake for hiking this trail later in the day. I took the long route up and the short route back. Short route was a little more strenuous than the the long meandering route. But both were equally pretty. At the falls there is a nice observation deck to enjoy the view and maybe have a light lunch before heading back down. I hope to do this hike again soon.', 'One of my favorite hikes. A bit of a long hike, but not too challenging at all. I took my mini Dachshund and she had no trouble keeping up on hike. The waterfall is very beautiful! ', 'A peaceful trip. Great for dogs. My dog enjoyed tromping around the countryside.', 'Did this hike twice, the last time about a year ago when the lower part of the loop was closed for repair. Great hike. ', 'Great hike! Took long route in and out. The Falls are so worth the hike. ', 'This was my real first Mountain Bike run.  I took the longer trail in and the shorter trail back.  I had to carry the bike for a lot of the way back up.  There are some serious drop offs and gaps on the short trail.  It is around 1200 ft elevation change each way.  I had a blast and would love too ride it again.  Especially with my new bike!', 'Hiked above the falls and camped along the river. \nThere are several improved sites with log benches, fire pits and plenty of fire wood. \nHad light snow at 2:00 A.M. and rain on the way out. ', 'The hike is worth the beauty of the falls.  Be cautious if you bring your dog, and bring plennty of water for them! Great trail for dog, bikes, and even kids.  Bring a lunch and enjoy the view of the falls.  The last 0.5 mile is a steep uphill climb, so save energy for the end. If you go early you will have to trail to your self, but on the way down be prepared to see a line of people!', 'Nice hike, very remote...', "It was exhilarating to run this trail all the way to the edge of the falls. There was a fair amount of people but most didn't make it all the way out to the top of falls. The uphill is very uphilly. Bring lots of water.", 'Wonderful hike. A small portion of the area burned a few years back. Not enough to put a dent in the beauty of this hike. Agreed, bugs are a little bad. Only negative I have: if you have problems like COPD, etc, use caution. The uphill hike out really lowered my oxygen levels. May be my last hike in, but highly advise peeps to check this area out.', "This hike is awesome.  It is not for the weak at heart, really.  You can really get a workout.  If you take the 4.5 trail in and the 3.3 trail out it is an awesome trek.  Lots of people, during the spring when it isn't yet hot.\nDont forget the bug spray!  Lots of woods, wildflowers, bugs, interesting hike.  Creeks, bridges, places to sit if you get tired, which you will.  I recommend this to anyone that is looking to a smart start to a nice cool day.", "this was a pretty easy trail. Why four stars than right? well its a great starter trail for those whose newbie to hiking. you'll see great scenery and most of all the reward at the end is great.. nice deck to see over the water fall.... ", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Granite Lake & Maggie's Peaks - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'hiking', 'trail running', 'lake', 'views', 'rocky']
hike_description: Granite Lake & Maggie's Peaks is a 3.6 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Tahoma, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking and trail running and is best used from March until November. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
