user_texts:
["there is a massive hill u walk down that winds down to a area that leads down to where they have the cutest somewhat underground cabins.  the trail is super easy. the areas with the trail with the cabins looks like something you would see out of a movie. it was a small trickle of a waterfall. technically not even a waterfall. it's like only a run of water down the side of the rockwall. prepare yourself for that hill back up. you will def be huffing and puffing..", 'The hike down and up were wonderful! Less trafficked compared to Sturtevant Falls. The one draw back was the amount of gravity found in the area.... Heavily graffitied especially at the boulders where the water falls!', 'Disappointing amount of graffiti at Hermit Falls. Well trafficked trail. Nice once you get off pavement. Can take the leg off to sturtevant falls loop back on the paved trail to add another 2.5 miles or so.', 'Virtual Hike: https://youtu.be/Ufi15b3pKlI

What a fun and short hike!  I arrived to Chantry Flats around 3PM, and there was plenty of parking available.  (The drive up to Chantry Flats is quite enjoyable as well.  The trail starts just down the stairs from the restroom.  The trail at first is a paved road, but after less than 1/8 mile there is a sign that leads onto a real trail.  You can’t miss it.  The trail switches back and forth to the bottom of the canyon, where there are a few cabins, follow the trail down the canyon past more cabins and continue up a trail along the right side of the canyon.  Within a few minutes you will reach a bunch of large boulders cut by the water.  This time of year there isn’t as much water, but I was surprised to see as much as I did.  There is an easy area of the falls to get to and hang out, but to see the main waterfall, you must climb down a set of rocks.  Don’t worry, there are ropes with loops to make this easier.  Once down to the waterfall, there is a nice pool of water that you can take a dip in.  I was taken aback by how much graffiti and left over beer cans there are down there.  Still enjoyable nonetheless.  I saw a handful of people at the falls, just hanging out, and made some friends!  Once done chillin’ at the falls, there is a significant climb back up the trail to Chantry Flats.  Make sure you don’t waste all your energy at the falls because you’ll need it for the ascent.  700 feet in 1.5 miles ain’t a joke, but certainly a great workout, that on the last heatwave of the summer months leading into fall will have you sweating in no time!

All in all a wonderful hike and a great way to spend an afternoon!

Hope you enjoy!

Playlist for the trail: https://tinyurl.com/y9appm2e', 'Went hiking here on a Thursday morning so parking was Not a issue. after the short walk to the trailhead we walk on a dusty path until we got deeper into the forest then you see how green and pretty it is. the water flow is  a trickle, but I've been here before after the rain and it was flowing and beautiful. Right now  it is like "hard mud" the insects are buzzing  around the mud and water, you might want to bring bug repellant. I think I swallowed a bug ha ha. it's a easy hike to the falls, please be careful the rocks are huge and smooth. I have very good hiking boots and theres no grip, so slipping is possible and the  water is low. I know this is a "cliff jumping" spot but looking at the low water and seeing the rocks I can't believe people jump off this. i think if they saw what's down there when the water is low they would think twice. So easy, good hike. Wish there wasn't so much trash and graffiti but you can still see the beauty in nature. #mountaingirl', 'very nice trail. lots of shade, water was very dirty bcus of no water flow. other than that very peaceful trail', 'Short hike down on steep, cliff hugging trail but plenty of shade. Great for year-round hiking and especially in the spring time. Check out the diving pools near the end!', 'Nice place! Really recommend it', 'The hike is fairly easy and short but get there early because it shares a parking lot with a bunch of other hikes (including Mt. Wilson) and it will be full by 7am. The falls themselves aren’t really that special and they get crowded  I didn’t really care for all the graffiti. Kids will be cliff jumping, which I don’t recommend. Not my favorite waterfall hike in the area but if you’re into jumping off of cliffs, it’s an option.', '6-10 hike for', "The trail down to the waterfall is nice. Went on a weekday and there were a good amount of people just hanging out near the falls. I don't know how people cliff dive here, looks terrifying! To get down to the pool is pretty hard although there is a rope provided. The fall in itself is nice aside from all the tagging ):", 'It was beautiful, except the graffiti. Waterfalls were amazing.', 'Great trail!', "Fun to get to! Has a tricky ladder at the end that you have to go down. The forest that you go through is beautiful. I just didn't like the graffiti tags on the rocks and not much to really see at the end. But in the end I would hike it again for sure.", 'nice place .', "the trail is a lot of fun and Lush scenery unfortunately taggers got in there and ruined some of the beauty of the scenery still worth the trip but the last 50 or 75 yards to hermit Falls is very difficult and we didn't attempt it", 'Nice easy hike down to riverbed then along it to the pools.  Id call it hermit pools.  Saw cliff jumping into the pools while there.  Amaaazing lushness around the river.  3 stream crossings.', 'Very sad to say this place has been ruined over the past 10 years or so by an influx of graffiti, trash and degradative gang culture using it as a hangout to drink and play loud (terrible) music. What a shame.', 'I’ve been here back in 2012 and again recently and it looked so different I almost didn’t recognize it. There was sooo much graffiti and trash! Very crowded with lots of young adults playing their loud music and drinking beers and trashing the place. I cliff jumped into the water last time but not this time around, too many rude people and it made me feel uncomfortable. If you do decide to do this hike, please bring a bag with you to pick up trash. It’s a small effort that could really make a difference and it doesn’t hurt anyone.', 'Fun hike, but so much graffiti and trash! Parking is difficult, suggestion use Uber.', 'great little hike to start on. narrow trails, that take you on gradual slopes. when you arrive its a little anti climatic as you are approaching from the top of the falls, but a quick scramble down the rocks can lead to great photos. dogs may haveca hard time after the falls as drops down the boulders are a few feet or more. great hike to do in conjuction with sturtvant as you can follor the right side of the river to the bridge and connect with the more popular trail.', 'Great place, my legs were hurting by the end of the day. I will be returning. parking permit are only needed at the starting trail, when you see the  sign that says permits are sold at the store. they only take cash.', 'Too much graffiti on the rocks. People need to respect nature.', 'Late review about a month. My friend and I were quite surprised at how easy of a hike this was. Getting to the falls was no problem. it was the falls that was the problem. There were none. There were only stagnant pools of water that people enjoyed jumping into. Coming back, we realized why the hike was so easy. we were going down. Going up was pretty inclined and strenuous because my friend and I were not very fit.', 'Great Trail', 'By far the most scenic hike at chantry flats and has less traffic than Sturtevant Falls. However the waterfall at Sturtevant is bigger and more captivating.', "It's beautiful and fun. Getting there is easy and all down hill but the way back is uphill so you might need a couple breaks. Overall it's not too hard and is very enjoyable. Make sure to get your pass or bring $$ for parking.", 'Challenging for beginners but very do-able. Lots of shade. Unfortunately we went when the water was running low, but still a beautiful trail. The waterfall is good except for the graffiti every where around the rocks, took away from the natural beauty. Recommend jumping into the water if you can.', 'Nice trail with lots of shade and follows riverhowever, way too much graffiti and trash. so sad.', 'Nice trail. Drive all the way to the hill with nice scenery. First part of the hike is on the pavement going downhill, then on dirt road with nice shade all the way to waterfall. Love it! Great view and shades!', 'cliff jumping ', 'First things first..... bring $5 CASH for parking! There are several small trails when you go to hermit falls. I went on the Sturtevant trail which ended with a waterfall. It’s beautiful... possible engagement photo shoot location for folks. Along the trail you will see small cabins and a few creeks. Great lower body workout', 'Not bad, all of the graffiti on the rocks was disappointing.', '7 years ago', 'Short trail but with some great swimming holes', 'It’s easy to walk in beautiful to see', 'Amazing view ', 'The hike is great but once you get to the falls it’s garbage it’s sad that people love to make Mother Nature look like the city. Please stop making mother look like the dead city’s', "Great hike with my 6 & 7 year old boys. Some of the trails were narrow and sketchy. If you slipped off you would probably done for. There wasn't much of a waterfall at the end but the pool was deep enough for cliff jumping. I did the big cliff jump and didn't have any difficulties except trying to climb back up the side of the cliff. Overall it was a great experience, if I did it again I would probably secure my kids to me with rope so if they slipped I would be able to pull them up the steep cliffs. I read that a high school senior in June slipped off the trail and fell a 100ft to his death...be careful out there and enjoy!!", 'this time of year weather wasnt bad, 78 degrees. plenty of shade and benches in the beginning of hike. signs for hermit falls are a bit unclear but if you take the main walkway down and go to the right- its a straight shot from there. water is only 3 feet, good to just lounge around. saw a baby rattlesnake so be cautious! this hike has a lot of hills and uneven walkways definetly not a good match for someone clumsy or elderly.', "The trail has decent scenery and is well kept, and there is plenty of shade once you get going. It wasn't extremely crowded but it was a rough crowd. Hikers were blaring music from speakers on the trail and at the falls and  more than 30 college aged kids were drinking and smashing bottles. A drunk boy fell and dislocated his shoulder. Some of the hikers were friendly and even helped my kids safely use the rock slides. the water felt amazing and the area was beautiful but the crowd will prevent me going back.", 'went about 8am in the morning. lovely trail with plenty of green and a nice river flowing by. there is a really nice, clean pool of water, that I think I'll dip into next time I go, just before the "waterfall" at the end. It was anticlimactic. Extremely dirty. cans, bottles, socks, shirts, tagging. but the trail itself was a breath of fresh air and relaxing, it's the journey after all, not the destination, I suppose. If you go early, you get serene sounds of birds and crickets playing in tandem and squirrels dancing around the trees. I would suggest some bug repellent.', 'Narrow pathways, there is no more waterfall, and the pool of water at the end of this trail, is dirty looking. The trail itself was moderate. Coming back up was a serious workout. I would not recommend taking dogs. Walkway is too narrow. About a 2 hour hike.', 'Minimal waterfall, but two pools of water deep enough for cliff diving and a rock slide', 'So fun! Easy hike and there is still water at the fall.', 'EXCELENTE LUGAR PARA ENVOLVERCE CON LA NATURALEZA', 'We started our hike at 5:30 pm all shaded it was nice but the waterfall was disgusting dirty and rocks all tagged up.', 'Great hike, short finished it in 2.5 hours. Easy going down, brutal coming back up. Overall though, would do again. Only down side is the over abundance over trash and graffiti at the actual falls.', "Easy hike down to the ponds. You'll come across shaded and sunny areas. Narrow trails. Pond still had water. Crowded today. The hike back is were you'll get a moderate work out. Overall fun especially if you jump in the water.", 'Easy, short hike. Fun cliff jumps. Relaxing, family oriented fun', 'The view was nice, water was super cold, very narrow trail at times, lots of people, be careful with rocks on the trail path and wires. We were expecting a big waterfall, but instead it was little ponds and bigger ones where you can literally jump in.', "tranquillity at it's finest. Lots of coverage from trees .", 'Very beautiful and a great workout on the way back up.', "Graffiti kinda ruins things.  It's fun to take the alternate route back that meets at the foot bridge (except for that climb back to the parking lot)... maybe going counter-clockwise would be better?", 'hiked on a memorial day, and finding parking was killer (possibly even more than the hike itself). the hike to the falls was simple - mostly downhill getting to the falls (which by the way, has cliff jumping on certain conditions) and uphill coming back.', 'Loved it.. Very pretty down below.. Dirty at the falls pick up your trash!!', "Really good hike with switch backs through the river. Lots of green and heavily shaded areas with a great ending in reaching the water pools and rock area. Bring food and snacks for a break there. It's about a 2 hour round trip.", "Easy trail that's half shaded and half sunny. Short hike but I always love the waterfall at the end. A shame there's trash and graffiti, but there's some good spots to jump off the cliff into the deep pool below! A little sketchy when going down to the bottom to look up. Would also recommend doing Sturtavent Falls (another short but beautiful hike right down the road)", 'Fun cliff jumping, extremely cold water', "Yesterday I went on what I would consider a beautiful hike that I was totally loving until I got to the waterfall at the end. What should've been a beautiful natural site ended up being a dump. Trash EVERYWHERE--a dirty diaper, bottles, multiple socks, cigarette butts, wrappers-- and tagging and graffiti all along the rocks of the waterfall and pools. Not to mention beer and other bottles and garbage along parts of the trail. There was a box full of empty bottles someone didn't pack out. I was so upset. Would have given this a 4/5 if it weren't for the garbage and graffiti.", 'Great scenic trail', 'Great trail, kinda short and super cold water but over all really fun', 'Awesome trail! Very diverse scenery. The top of the hike is mostly open air and is hot on sunny days. Once you get down some switch backs you arrive in a heavily wooded area that is green all year round. There is flowing water almost the whole way down the trail to the falls. The waterfall is beautiful and very nice to swim in, but also VERY cold. Bring a towel.', "Don't go off the trail and don't do this hike if you are new to hiking.Toned my body pretty fast!", 'Short but good singletrack and nature life', 'Cliff jumping at the end', 'Awesome hike if you are trying to get away for a day of exploring.', 'Beautiful Hike', 'Pretty easy getting there ... Good morning hike ⛰', 'Love jumping in at the end!!! Such a fun hike for everyone', 'nice trail could see the fall due to my dog not being able to go down the cliff but definitely will go again.', "I enjoy this hike. It's a popular one amongst younger ppl so be aware that a lot of them hike here which is the reason there's graffiti on a few of the rocks. There is a huge cliff jump which is pretty dangerous if you don't know what you're doing. I've seen friends do it so it's not impossible you just have to jump right. I really enjoy this hike.", "Easy trail. Some narrow paths. Nice and short; did this trail first and went back to do Sturtevantfalls too. Nice and shady. Can be a little harder on the way back because of the incline. My8year old loved it, too! Tried to go to all the way down but it seems like the path either collapsed or I just couldn't find it.  There was though, a path in between the rocks but too steep and couldn't get my son up/down from it so we just stayed in the area of the first falls. Water was freezing!", "It's not bad, but can be overcrowded. I found a lot of trash on the trail and the graffiti really takes away from the awe of nature.", "We took the long way to get there which made it a better hike, but it was nice that there was water there even with the drought! I'm sure it's awesome after some rain, and would be fun to jump in during the summer! The graffiti and trash at the bottom was not cool though.", 'Loved this hike, Beautiful trails and scenery but I really hated all the graffiti all over the place. Its sad to see such a gorgeous place all tagged up. Who tags on plants!? An aloe plant had been scrawled on along with the rocks, trees, and anything else within reach. Other than the tagging this place is great. We encountered a few people but not that many. Will definitely go back again', 'Short but worth the trip.', 'perfect.', 'Wildlife is definitely here. I almost always manage to spot a snake or two, and plenty of lizards. Weekends and holidays are always packed with hikers. Pretty easy hike.', 'Really cool to go to the jumps the shit ', 'loved it!!! the falls are barely trickling right now but the views on the way down the mountain are amazing. Me and my children had a great day!!!', 'maravilloso', "So pretty and your able to jump in the falls it's about 5 feet deep", 'Great morning hike with friends! Almost all downhill, so the hike back to the car was a little challenge, but nothing too bad! Definitely plan on going back!', 'So we got lost at first. So here are a few tips so u don't do the same : 1) when you get to the parking lot go down onto the pavement road behind the bathrooms 2) a couple of minutes later ( depending on how fast you go) your going to see a sign on the right hand side of the road that says "hermit falls", and it leads to a narrow dirt path, follow it!! 3) your gunna go down it and then you'll reach a water base and when you reach that go right, after that just follow the trail and have fun jumping off ', "If you're looking for scenery look no further, this place is beautiful! Hiked to sturtevant falls then hermit falls took me about 4 hours stopping at both falls. Definitely recommend this hike", 'Very enjoyable hike! I parked at the top, walked down and started the hike from the bottom, pretty crowded at the falls but nice, then I returned using the upper trail that takes you back to the top parking area!', 'It was great! The trail is easy to navigate through and the tiny lake at the bottom made for some fun hangouts with other hikers. Very fun trail.', 'Very narrow trail, got to the bottom very pack with a bunch of teenagers jumping into the water off the cliff recommend not going on the weekend.', 'Really enjoyed the hike. I would consider it a moderate to easy hike. I loved the scenery. I recommend that people use plenty of bug spray. The mosquitoes and flies were relentless.', 'I have been coming here for a few years. I start with the Sturtevant Falls trail and then on to Hermit falls. Starting from the bottom near the bridge along the Sturtevant falls trail is where you can start. The trail today was overgrown a bit and I was not clear on the path on the first part but keeping going. You will pass over three water streams along the way. The water is not deep and it is easy to pass over. I encountered a neat looking gecko. Bring some swimming clothes if you want a thrill and jump from the cliffs into the water. Or you can watch :)  You might also want to bring a bag to help pick up the trash and bottles around the falls. We can all do our part in making this a better place :)', 'definitely a really good hike', "Too bad it's a lot of graffiti and trash all over the place", 'Amazing experience, waterfall was a tad disappointing but besides that everything was gorgeous.', 'Been coming here for years, parking sucks come early. Beautiful  scenery I love the crisp air, be careful if you decide to jump into the pools, many have died here sadly.', 'For the average hiker, Hermit Falls Trail should be a pretty easy/moderate hike. Please make sure you stay on the trail and don’t cut because it appears to be a quicker route. We watched this lady try to cut up a steep incline with her dog to save some time. She really struggled and almost went down the hillside. The trailhead is clearly marked. It proceeds to a series of switch backs down the mountain to the valley below. Once at the bottom, follow the river down the mountain some ways. It’ll lead you to the falls. Hermit Falls a smaller set of falls compared to the Sturtevant Falls just up the mountain some ways. After a few days of rain, the pool bellow is deep enough to swim in to. Be careful though, it is difficult to get down to the bottom. My friend and I did both Hermit Falls and Sturtevant Falls in the same day. Total time was about five to six hours if you leisurely walk it and hang out at both falls.  Be safe and enjoy!', "perfect for hiking! if you're trying to find the waterfall, it could be difficult to find. there's not to many signs that lead to it. you just have to explore (:", 'I loved this hike! A lot of trash on the ground but everything was so lush. The falls were flowing nicely as well.', 'Beautiful, once you get into the shady area there are creeks and waterfalls. Unfortunately, some of the scenery is ruined by quite a lot of graffiti. At the end of the trail you can jump into the waterfall theres a 30 & 50ft drop. Be very careful how and where you land if you plan to do it. P.S. The hike down is easy, the difficult part is going back up. Slight incline.', 'It was a great,for my first hike.', 'Had a great experience, there were many trails to choose from to hike. Not too difficult, some inclines but the best part is the shaded areas throughout the different trails.', 'Amazing spot to end a short hike !!', "Simply beautiful! Only downfall is the graffiti. I'm a fan of graffiti art, but some of the graffiti is not. The way down is easy, pretty steep with narrow switchbacks on the way up. Bring shoes with good traction and plenty of water!", 'Short but decent', "I don't know if the locals have the same appreciation but these trails I'm the San Gabriel are amazing.  I surely look forward to coming back", 'Nice beautiful hike, dog friendly, coming back is a little bit of a work out. Definitely come early parking is a bitch.', 'Short, but packs a punch.. Beautiful views.. Parking can be challenging so go early . Will definitely do again.', 'Short, easy but very intense hike! Loved it..got a work out going down and up on this trial...and the views with the sound of the water flowing is priceless!!! Very pleased..', 'Great hike with some really sweet views of the Angeles National Forest. Deffinetely worth the rock climbing to get down to the fall.', '$5 to park nice falls at bottom of trail. well maintained trail. down hill to falls then uphill to return.', 'Easy hike, even for the less experienced hiker. not much gain or loss but a nice walk through nature.', "The way there is downhill so be prepared for a moderate incline on the way back. It starts out without shade then as you make your way down you have the trees shade. I thought the water looked gross. There was trash at the bottom of the pools & even along the trail. There's also graffiti on the rocks which made the spot less beautiful. People were jumping off rocks into the pools. I left when a family came and took over the spot I was hanging out at. As in they literally put their stuff on top of mine & complained my dog scared their child. Please be respectful wherever you go hiking. If you didn't get there first, sucks but move along. I'm all for sharing but not being uncomfortable like that.", 'This hike is easy on the way to the falls but the way back is inclined. Cliff jumping is a must at the falls. There are 3 levels and whoever is really brave can do the highest. The water is quite refreshing.', 'I like to run this trail...good work out.', "This short trail packs a strong punch. It's a good workout & a lot of fun.", 'It was a good hike and the water fall was great, the water was fresh well i bit cold but worth it because it was a hot day.  Their was plenty of youngters. The way back was a little tiring.', "Too many people and dirty now. Used to be a nice one but seen it once, won't go back.", 'great workout and family friendly trail.
There are some small pond crossings and logs to balance across.
Stones to hop keep the children challenged.  Bring Water shoes to enjoy the base of the waterfall.
Please be considerate with your dogs on leashes.  If you have a dog that likes to bark at others, plan to entertain your dog so that the rest of us can enjoy the fruits of our accomplishments.
purchase parking pass at the liquor store near the 210 fwy exit on Santa Anita before you head up the mountain road.', 'Hermit Falls is the perfect place for walking/hiking any day of the week; however, it is crowded on the weekend. My pup and I enjoyed ourselves, and had a great time conversing with fellow hikers and dogs. People are friendly and are courteous when there is foot traffic. Unfortunately, the trail is a little messy with leftover rubbish so, you must be  cautious for yourself and your pup.', 'Great trail for the family', 'ok', "Nice short hike. It was actually just about 2 miles RT. Easy hike. As soon as you get to the bottom, you're in an enchanted forest!!  parking was rough this weekend since I was there a week ago for the other trail.", "The incline on the way back isn't too bad if you pace yourself but there is very little shade towards the top so bring sunscreen and lots of water. The falls are extremely beautiful with some fantastic rock pools you can swim in (there are lots of leaves at the bottom so you might need Keens or other water shoes) Some people cliff dive off the pool at the bottom but do so carefully. The rocks here at the Rock pools are super slippery so stay low or you WILL slide into the water. It's a little sad that there is so much trash at the bottom--I'll definitely be going back with friends to cliff dive but this time I'll remember to bring a trash bag to bring some of that out!", "Used to be such a great hike, now it's covered w graffiti and garbage! So sad, last time I went there, there were a bunch of teenagers tripping on drugs! Thanks for ruining nature! Ugh!", 'LOT of people on these trails. You will not be able to let your dog run around without a leash. But that said it is a nice trail, we picked the Hermit Falls trail that is about 1.5 miles long with water and narrow paths..', "This is a great hike, but honestly the amount of trash that's thrown around near the falls and all the grafitti on the rocks/boulders takes away from the beauty of this trail. It's heartbreaking. Also, there have been so many injuries reported from people who go cliff diving here... probably not such a good idea.", 'A hike to Hermit Falls. This is a great hike in the summer time and you are able to cliff dive, but do it with extreme caution since people have died from Cliff Diving. Make sure you take extra water during the hot months since this is a backwards hike. You start from the top and work your way down to the falls. It is all incline on the way back and make sure you give yourself extra time going back. Parking is always a issue here since it is where you also park for the Popular Sturtevant Falls. Make sure you get there early and $5 parking fee can be purchased at REI or Sport Chalet. I always notice that most cars do not have a Adventure Pass. If you do get a ticket from the Rangers, you can always buy the pass and mail it it. I always take My $30 year long adventure pass. Be safe and I am not responsible if you get hurt.

Video is from 2011 and upscaled to 720p.

Hermit Falls - Video
www.youtube.com/watch?v=CS3ivFuqavE

Distance 2.6 Miles Round Trip
Elevation Gain:	600 feet
Hike Time : 2 hours
Type:	Out and back
Difficulty: Moderate (Backwards hike)
Trail Condition: OK, but a few difficult spots
Animals:	Dog Friendly
Parking Fee: Adventure Pass $5
Activities: Hiking, Running & Swimming ( Caution on Cliff Diving)', "This was a great hike for my husband and I ... We are new to hiking and didn't want to get on anything too long or steep... My husband hikes with our son on his back ... This was a great hike even though the stream and falls were pretty dried up, there was still plenty of water at the bottom for the enthusiasts to cliff jump into from the 50 ft cliff... The views were amazing as well even without the water... The actual hike is pretty level in most places however it is very high up and steep drop offs so could be dangerous for rambunctious kids that aren't attached to you in one way or another...the hike is in a park so there are several other hikes as well .it is a beautiful drive up so that adds a star . :)", "I went here today with some friends for the first time. The trail itself doesn't really deserve 4 stars, but the entire experience I had did. If you're going to be doing this hike you should remember to bring a lot of water! There's shade, but you'll be asking for water with the incline this hike gives you. The trail/road is really narrow, so BE CAREFUL and go at your own pace. On the way over was really pleasant, but once you reach the falls there's tons of graffiti. IF YOU PLAN ON JUMPING THE 50ft, it's not too bad just make sure you pencil dive. The water was lower because of the drought and dryness but everyone in my group who jumped made it out alive. Its scary, but doing it is a good experience; you feel so victorious!Please, please clean up after yourselves. My friend scraped her arm on an empty bottle in one of the pools and another stepped on glass and had to go to the hospital.", "I'll start with this YES ! it's really trashed around the hrom waterbottles being thrown every which way and the boulder jumping activities into the water when you reach your destination are Extremely dangerous PLEASE DO NOT GET CLOSE TO THE EDGE WITHOUT SITTING ON YOU BUTT YOU WILL SLIO", 'Went again up to Hermit Falls yesterday and had a great time.  Sure there were a few other hikers and dogs on the trail but everyone was friendly and great having a great time.  Water flow was higher than I would have expected especially in light of the very little precipitation that we have had until recently.  Many rock jumpers as is expected here.', 'This is a great little side trip to your hike up in this trail system .  It is so beautiful. There was a lot of water because of the recent rains', 'Easy fun hike again. Not such a workout just for scenery', 'Fun hike, could have done w o all the teenagers blasting techno and getting drunk and high. ', "Fun hike to get to the destination where people are jumping off that 35 ft. cliff into the water. Loved the scenery and I felt it was great exercise. Short, but lots of terrain and incline coming back. I feel bad for those who didn't get a wholesome experience because of the crowds or the trash. Today was perfect, not that many people, didn't see too much trash, and parking was free. 
I would suggest researching a time to go where there is not that many people. Good spot in my opinion.", 'I would have to say the trash on the trail and at the falls was sad. I enjoyed the hike otherwise, it was brutal coming back up for me. A very good workout.', "this place deserves five stars, but the people who show up and litter and graffiti are worth -5 stars. They will close this trail if we don't do or part to take care of mother nature", "This trail is narrow and covered with trash. Other reviews have mentioned the trash problem, but I'm talking dozens of empty beer and wattle bottles, clothes, potato chip bags strewn about the trail, and stacked especially high at the falls. Hermit Falls is the flytrap for irresponsible, selfish hikers.", "It's easy hiking down and the trail is beautiful, quiet and the forest is like in slumber. You'll see a couple of private cabins down there and honest to say, the cabins made the trail look like a themed Disneyland ride. You'll hear water which is pretty soothing especially when it's not crowded. I went on a Thursday and there was a moderate crowd. Since everyone's going to the pools, expect a lot of people. The hike back up was grueling and hot. There was way too many bud light cans around though.", 'Good hike,but narrow trail...', '1 Star for this beautiful hike?! What's wrong with me right?! In actuality, it's more like what's wrong with everybody else. The hike itself is nice. Wooded, shaded, good scenery and such. The problem, and it pains me to say this, is the destination. Ok let me re-phrase, the problem, is the people at the destination. First sign this wasn't going to go as expected, we have to park a mile or so down the road from the parking lot. our fault, it was sunday afternoon, no biggie. , but after the nice relaxing hike, we get there, and there are 50-60 people hanging onto every possible place to sit or stand. These are not your everyday hikers though. I'm no yuppie but I can honestly say this place was straight Ghetto. We walk past a number of groups of "gangster" types, complete with pissed off stares in our direction (apparently we didn't pay attention to all the graffiti clearly marking this as their territory). 17 year olds with 40's and boomboxes bumping the best of todays rap. OG's walking their chihuahas around, joints in mouth, as the little dogs peed on other peoples backpacks. Now don't get me wrong, I like beer, Hip-Hop, and joints. And we may or may not have had all of the above with us as well... but seriously... have some class people. Oh well we think... big cliffs to jump off, a little waterslide. this could still be fun. So we sit down, crack open a beer, and look to our left. There is literally a pile of trash a foot deep. Beer cans, bottles, rotting food, dirty clothes, you name it. I gagged. The water must be cleaner! Not really... everywhere that trash can collect, it did. Disgusting. We brought two bags for trash and filled them, but we needed at least 8 full sized garbage bags to finish the job. We couldn't stand it. We continued along on an offshoot of a trail and continued to take the road less traveled. This is where the experience changed. We walked and walked and walked, Saw frogs, deer tracks, a cool spot to rockclimb, saw the water disappear underground, then come back fresh and clean as if it hadn't be polluted upstream by the masses. Beautiful. Eventually we made it to the Santa Anita Dam. It felt like out own private lake. It was awesome. Two paths diverged in a wood, and we - we took the one less traveled by. And that made all the difference.', "First and foremost, buy the parking pass for $5 and save yourself a ticket. Available at the store up top or REI before the 210FW(opens at 10am) the hike is one of 3 routes you can decide. This being the easiest of them all. It's a short hike that's easy for children and pets. It was clean the day I went so plz keep it that way for others. The way down is easy the way up not as much. The scenery is amazing and the shade helps a lot also, you cross the stream jumping a few rocks a couple times and then the fun begins... You have your choice of 3 jumps, 45ft-35ft--25ft. I jumped all three and trust me they're more about will power than anything. The climb back up is a bit tough but doable, watch your step and enjoy!", "Great hike, short and scenic. Nothing beats a hike in a forested mountain. From Chantry Flats trailhead, head down the paved road, do not go all the way down, you'll see a bench to the right at a bend in the road, that's where the trail to Hermit Falls is. After crossing the stream next to the dam, make a right. Straight forward from there", "I enjoyed this trail. After having done Sturtevant and Mt. Wilson, I wanted to do this. I took my dog on a rainy day. The trail in was nice. Very quiet and i passed no one else on the trail this day. Most go to the large falls. Because the river was swollen, I did have to cross the stream as the trail was washed out. The falls aren't as impressive as Sturtevant. But was a nice place to be alone and enjoy nature. The falls are tiered and run through granite rocks. Climbers have left gear to rappel down the falls to the pools below. But beware, the trek back up is not fun. It's a great workout but remember, it's all downhill in...so it's all uphill going back to your car. ", 'This was my second trail from Chantry Flats.  For my tips on parking and directions, please see my review of Sturtevent Falls.

First off, there  are no signs for this trail at the beginning of the trailhead, but it is quite easy to find.

Start by heading down the fire road towards Roberts Camp, but shortly after you begin your descent, there is a flat area and a bench where there is a sign leading you towards First Water and Hermit Falls.

It is a windy, yet consistent descent to First Water.  Once there, you cross the stream and head to the right.  There is a trail that heads left, but it joins up with the Sturtevent Falls trail.  The rest of the way is pretty flat to the falls.

Hermit Falls itself was quite pretty and a unique sight to see.  There were some teenagers jumping off the cliff into the water pool below.  Judging from the screams, I am assuming the water was as cold as it appeared in early February.

The biggest disappointment of the hike was the trash and graffiti.  It really was a little heartbreaking to see the trail and falls so abused.

The way back was pretty easy.  The first incline right after First Water is the worst of it, but it is steady for awhile.  The final push up the Fire road (the top of "Cardiac Hill") is steep but pretty brief.', 'The scenery was beautiful but we made the mistake of taking the longest trail as our first hike.  The trail seemed endless and it got very narrow near the top, but it was a great workout and I would definitely go again. We arrived at 6am so parking was a breeze.', "One of my most favorite hiking trails. Its only downfalls are 1) its crowded during the summer 2) all the trash and graffiti near the water falls and pools. Sometimes  it's crowded especially during the summer when its filled with tourists and teenagers hanging out at the waterfalls. But if you go early and during the off seasons this a beautiful and tranquil trail. If your looking for that breath taking , escape from LA , bond with nature experience , I highly recommend this trail. It's at it's must stunning beauty right after a long rain storm, when everything is lush, green, clean and the falls are flowing. Just remember to buy your Forrest Access Pass BEFORE you get there !!! There is a liqueur store on Santa Anita not far from the start of the road that takes you up the mountain that sells passes for $5. ", 'The falls is part of a bigger trail-head called Chantry Flats that splits up into many different trails. There is a 5 dollar fee unless you have the California Adventure Parking Pass. This fills up very early. The Trail is guided by signs and once we got to the stream it was covered in trees. There are cool cabins that line the first part of the hike downstream, some are occasionally occupied, some are damaged.  There are a few man-made dams up and down the stream. There are two pools to jump into at the end of the hike. The first had various heights to jump from  and was plenty deep. You can also slide down the natural rock-water slide into this pool as well. The lower falls is much bigger and much shallower. You were pretty much guaranteed to touch the bottom if you jumped from the top. There is a rope to assist you on the climb back up to the top of the falls. There was some graffiti and trash, but it was obvious that they tend to the trail pretty well.  The hike up can be tough once you escape the shade of the trees. All uphill on the way back.', "this was an easy trail/hike.  can't believe there's graffiti on the rocks!  not good. ", 'Easy hike combined with other trail en route.  Too crowded.  Will return to do early morning.', '#1 Rule: Arrive EARLY, mostly for parking. By 7:30am parking lot is full and will have to park down the mountain road. 

TIPS: Bring lots of water, sunscreen, bugspray and PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, pick up after yourself!

*2nd time going to Hermit Falls. I love it. The trail zig zags for the first 1/2 mile and is mostly open, the trail is pretty narrow (one person) so tread carefully.  After that is all forestry and full shade. Beautiful scenery.  Once you arrive to the falls, there are 3 pools. Many people jump from the cliffs into the pools which is a lot of fun! However, the rocks are very slippery so be careful. Water is clean but will get clogged due to litter or debris. I usually remove as much debris/litter as possible to help the stream flow smoothly and clear out the water pools.

Downfalls: The amount of grafitti on the rocks and litter of beer cans is just..... upsetting and disturbing.', 'This is a moderate hike, At points it can feel steep, This place has too many Liters, people Please take ur trash with you :P
Also if your gonna jump into the water hole make sure the water is about 8 feet you can get hurt if the water is shallow.. ', "I enjoyed the trail and jumping from the waterfall was the most exciting! Yes there is graffiti which ruins the scenery but we can't do much about that... however we can do something about the trash! Let's keep the place clean by cleaning up after ourselves :D ", 'first of all have your adventure parking pass before hand . second get there early by 8 am because parking becomes almost impossible by 10 am. as far as the trail I enjoyed it very much. The trail is mainly down hill so expect to walk back up on the return . the scenery was nice with brushy sunny switch backs and shaded walks through the creek. The falls were very popular with many jumping into the pools .  jumps of heights of 12, 25, and 55 feet.  ', "You MUST get there EXTREMELY early to find good parking. My group got there around 1030-11 in the morning and parking was HORRENDOUS. You need to have an adventure pass ($5/day) or if you have an annual pass you're good. The hike is a lot of fun! We had a group of 5 people including myself and I took my miniature Dachshund who weighs 17 lbs. and is 4 1/2 years old. It was about 80 degrees or so when we went. It was a Saturday (hence the reason why the parking was out of control). My Dachshund did extremely well on this hike. There are two small creek crossings which she did fine with. It's a heavily used trail and we did see one rattlesnake so if you are hiking in the summertime please be careful! The cliff jumps are pretty awesome. 4 of our group members did the higher one. I didn't do it because I was way too chicken and I had to watch my dog. There is quite a bit of trash near the falls and graffiti, but it is still an amazing place to see in my opinion. We all loved it and hope to return someday again. My main take home points would be 1) Get parking EARLY!!! 2) Beware of wilderness when you are hiking. Perhaps even bring emergency kits just in case. 3) It is a heavily used trail so please don't bring any dogs that may not get along with other people, kids, or dogs.", 'I gave this trail three stars because there was a lot of trash around the waterfall and there was quite a bit of graffiti on the rocks too.  We went on a Friday and arrived at 8am, parking was almost full at the Chantry Flat parking lot (you need an Adventure Pass to park here).  We headed down a steep paved road from the lot.  There are several signs along the way pointing you towards the different trails.  We chose to take the trail for Hermit Falls because it got us off the paved road and because it looked like it had a lot of greenery.  The dirt trail is well maintained, although it gets narrow in some areas.  A couple of times we had to cross the stream stepping on the rocks.  My friend brought her small dog and she had to carry the dog across the stream, but it is doable.  When you reach the waterfall it is surrounded by huge boulders.  The waterfall is nothing spectacular, but the view around is quite beautiful and relaxing.  Actually the best part of the trail was the scenery along the way.  The forest was breathtaking.  Coming back up the sun had come out and it was getting very hot!  So the steep hills took more effort to hike up (sunscreen and hats are helpful).  The steep uphill paved road back up to the parking lot was tough, but considering how beautiful the entire hike was overall, I think it was well worth it.  We plan to go back and explore other trails without the dog which should make it easier.  I would recommend this hike mostly for the beauty of the trail.', "The water is dirty and there's way too much trash.  I don't understand how so many people can just throw there water bottles and plastic bags out into the river or into the forest.  Usually when I see trash out hiking I'll pick it up but on this trail there's just way too much its disgusting.  Instead of going out and enjoying nature you're stuck contemplating how terrible human beings can be to our planet.  I guess it should be expected being this close to LA, but seriously tits the dirties trail I've ever been on.  ", "Lovely hike. You go down down down first, which can be a little bit of a pain when you're on the way back up and tired out. When you get to the creek make sure you go to the right and follow the trail to the falls (you'll see a sign next to the creek a little later after turning right). As others said, lots of trash, so I brought a bag and picked some of it up to toss when I got back to the lot. :-)", "Beautiful... Amazing greenery 3/4 of the trail is completely shaded with a great breeze. Good anytime hike. After the rains is ideal due to the water levels. My 3 & 12 year old enjoy jumping off the cliffs into the refreshing water. The trail is not congested with hikers so it's serene & enjoyable.  By far my favorite ", "Low life city, the falls are great but the trash should be thorn-out  with the bottles and cans. I'm glad that at least i,m not going home with thees losers ! ", 'Hike was great, but toooooo crowded when you reach the water fall, beer cans every where and lots of graffiti. had to go on a day where someone got hurt. women broke her ribs from jumping the 50ft area

http://sierramadre.patch.com/articles/injured-hiker-reported-near-hermit-falls', "Would give it 5 stars, but for the rowdy bunch at the falls.  Given, it was a holiday weekend.  Unfortunately, instead of a beautiful, serene environment to complement the picturesque natural setting, there were dozens drinking, shouting, using foul language, accompanied by the smell of marijuana.  Kinda sad that such a pretty place ends up with this kind of review.   In the future, I'll try a weekday to avoid the party atmosphere.", 'Enjoyable hike - more strenuous than Sturtevant Falls with some switchbacks.  But overall, a really enjoyable hike.  ', 'Fun hike with beautiful riparian scenes. Great swimming hole too', 'Great falls for jumping:)', 'Nice hike but a bit narrow path. Lots of young people jumping off the rocks into the water. Please clean up after yourselves, saw lots of empty water bottles and beer cans at the falls. It was a shame to see all the litter in such a beautiful place.', 'Well woth it. Hike is a little strenous, but over all good show. ', 'The hike was nice but the path was very narrow kinda scary but when reach to the fall was kinda disappointed it was more of a man made fall there were also cabins there kinda freaky the hike back up omg almost killed me lol ', 'this was a really nice hike because most of the croud goes up stream to sturtvent falls, so there was no one ther but the small group i went with . nice warm day with plenty of trees to shade and keep cool. the falls were running full force we had to yell just to hear eachother. had lunch and hung out for an hour. the hike back up the hill kinda sucked, but this was a really nice hike.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Pyles Peak Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'over grown']
hike_description: Pyles Peak Trail is a 5.3 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near San Diego, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from October until June. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['This trail is an extension to Cowl’s Mountain. Tough hike due to the incline. Definitely a good workout!', 'awesome views especially at the top will do it again after the rains stop in spring.', 'A pretty good workout hike', 'Amazing views', 'Loved this hike. Just great.', 'Want something more exciting than cowls mountain this is a butt kicker. You will fill it in your calves and it’s not going out that’ll get you. The way Back feels never ending.It may be a short hike but it sure feels long. And once you get back the end of piles you have to go back down cowls but that’s easy. All for all it’s a great hike for intermediate hikers and adventurous people I like. Remember to take adamant water.', 'It was well kept and not highly trafficked.', 'Super fun! I lived it', 'I have done all the mission trails. Ok for an afternoon or morning walk', 'Pretty good hiking trail', 'Probably the best mission trails hike', '', 'You hike up Cowls Mountains and off to the side at the top you proceed to Pyles.  Take plenty of water.  Get there early because parking can be limited and turn wheels to curb.  It took 2 hours and 23 minutes to do both hikes.', 'Great workout and a challenging hike. Will do this one again.', 'Loved this trail!  One of 5 of the 5 peak challenge and my favorite. Views are great, not as crowded, challenging, great workout!', 'Great trail for a quick hike and a great view of San Diego. Bring water, it’s hot.', 'My favorite of the 5 Peaks!', "You can get solitude here even though it's next to one of the most popular hikes in SD. Lots of greenery that you feel like you're not in the neighborhood.", 'The two interesting things about this climb for me were the view of the city, and the interface of Park land with the surrounding development.  I encountered a handful of mountain bikers which is fine, but one just needs to be aware they are coming pretty fast.', 'The last part is the best.', 'After passing Cowles Mountain I really enjoyed this hike!! Cowles is good and all but way too many people.  The views are great and the trail is less busy. Probably ran into 2 other groups at the peak but only one other person on the trail. The last .25 miles of this trail was the most challenging, but it was a great climb! Will definitely do again.', 'Very busy and a lot of rock hopping', 'Amazing trail! Once you get passed the overcrowded cowels mountain trail, you pretty much have the whole trail to yourself. I barely ran into 4 people all together. Great inclines and declines. The last .25 mile to the peak is a nice challenge for any hiker. Absolutely loved this trail- definitely coming back!', '5 Peak challenge completed', 'finished 5 peak challenge with this peak. to me it was the most diffucult', 'Disappointed at first because it was a Tuesday and surprisingly busy. The moment I hit the pyles peak trail I crossed paths with one person and had the rest to myself!!! I found my zen and was ready to head back. My Apple Watch gave me 6.15 miles', "I got to Pyles Peak by taking a trail leading to Cowles. If it wasn't for the 5 peak challenge, I would have avoided Cowles all together because it is so crowded, even at 630am. Pyles Peak trail is so quiet and beautiful! The last stretch is a nice climb but well worth the view!! We ended up having the summit to ourselves and only passed a hand full of people along the trail. I plan on coming back but taking the backside trail that avoids Cowles. Not a ton of shade so arrive early.", 'Great Trail! Almost no people.', 'Good hike  and away from the crowds at Cowles. Moderate hike and highly recommend. Just over 2 hours from start to finish.', 'Went on to Pyles Peak from Cowles and loved this section so much!  I heard my first rattlesnakes!! It took me a second for it to sink in what I was hearing.  Never saw them thank goodness they were off in the brush.  Beautiful views and not many people along the trail.  Easy to navigate.', 'Great hike to Pyles Peak even if it rains on you.', 'You have to go upCowles to make it to Pyles!!! 5hrs Hike', 'This was a great hike and nice way to add some more distance / challenge to Cowells Mountain. The Hardest part for me was the climb back to Cowells Mountain from Pyles Peak, it was right when my legs started to get really tired! Make sure to plan accordingly on a hot day this hike would be brutal. Well worth the views.', 'Nice hike, not to busy. Enjoyed it.', 'Great view. Nice extra after finishing cowels', 'Once you pass the traffic jam on Cowles Mountain, the trails is nice and peaceful. Great view from the peak.', 'Great trail! It only gets better after the first peak because not nearly as many people continue on past that.', 'Really great hike. A lot of shade when you go early. Some areas provide cool shades. Awesome view on top.', 'Gives a decent view of the city and not too bad if you are in shape. Good workout 30 mins up 30 mins down', 'Excellent trail!  I hiked up Cowles Mountain and continued onto Pyles Peak just beyond the vista point.  The summit was 1,379 ft.  I continued north towards the community on Mission Gorge Road attempting the 5-Peak Shuttle, but fell short at the third peak, Kwaay Paay Summit--1,194 ft.  I had begun at noon and the brush was very bad on the north side descending down to Mission Gorge Road causing me to run out of daylight after 5 1/2 hours.  I hiked to Kwaay Paay Summit in the dark before heading out.  I completed the hike to Pyles Peak summit in 2 1/2 hours.', '', 'It was a good trail', "Kids, strollers, dogs, trail DJs, crowds. You basically hike up Cowles then continue to Pyles. It's mostly downhill after the Cowles summit and much quieter. The Pyles view point looks northeast, while the better scenery is southwest toward downtown. Keep on going to Pyles Peak, a little uphill from the view point. Sunset and a panoramic view from TJ to San Diego's beaches on a clear day", 'We went to cowles mountain and say the Pyle peak trail. went to the summit and back down to the start of cowles. almost 6 miles. good little burner for those that want extra', "Went the long way, from Big Rock Park on the Santee side. This route brings you up the back side of the mountain, about 8 miles in total out-and-back. Definitely the way to go if you're looking for a challenge.  I never much liked going up Cowles on the obvious south approach because of the pedestrian atmosphere and not challenging enough, but this route is a whole different experience. It's definitely the road less traveled, and it's enjoyably savage. After reaching Pyles summit, you head back up to Cowles summit on your way back, where you'll log in another decent bout of elevation gain. A good training exercise to prepare you for the up-down-up-down brutality of nearby El Cajon Mountain. About 3.5 hours in total, and I'd recommend 2 liters of water on a 75F degree day.", 'Easy trail to the summit until the last .25 mile. Went on a Thursday afternoon and only crossed paths with 5 other hikers. Watch for snakes.', 'My favorite trail in the area. Great views and a good workout.', "I like doing Pyles when I don't have time to drive further away from the city and I still want to get in a hike with decent distance and elevation gain. Traffic drops off considerably after you leave the summit of Cowles and if you hike it from Barker Way you can avoid the crowds all together. I've found you can have the summit of Pyles all to yourself even on a weekend morning, which is hard to beat given that you're still within city limits.", "Agree with other poster, it's a nice hike in the beginning but gets harder as you go. Suggest if you are going to do Pyles to start early to miss the heat and crowds on Cowels. We started at 6am and think it was perfect.", "You'll have to go through Cowles to get to Pyles Peak but it seemed easy at first but it got a little harder. Less crowded. View wasn't as nice as Cowles but good hike overall.", "Went to Pyles Peak from Cowles Mountain.   It was only a good hike because Cowles Mountain is a disaster for a whole variety of reasons.    From Cowles to Pyles are very few people and up and down the whole way.   The views just aren't that great on either peak.   If you want a real hike, and not an urban stroll up a dirt hill go to Elfin Forest, Potato Chip Rock, or Iron Mountain.     Neither this or Cowles are really hikes.   They are places for college kids to go to show how well the breast augmentation worked out or the steroids are hitting their peak.   Mostly rude people that are more concerned with not getting their stretch pants dirty then getting a workout.  I would avoid this and  Cowles at all costs, not really hikes.", "Great trail. Much less busy once you pass Cowle's Mountain summit.", 'Really nice to leave the crowd behind at the top of Cowles Mtn and continue over to Pyles Peak. In spring, lots of blooms, a bit greener than Cowles trail. Dog friendly:)', "It's DIFFICULT not moderate.But was worth it.", 'Once you reach the top of Cowels Mt.,  just continue on to the next peak.  Far less people on this trail which was very nice.  No shade.  Bring water.', 'You have to climb Cowles Mountain first which is plagued with visitors. But once you pass the summit and continue on the Pyles Peak Trail, there is significantly less people and is much nicer. The trail is very rocky so make sure you are wearing comfortable and sturdy shoes.', 'a real workout!', "I climbed the mountain this past weekend! However, I didn't realize it was connect to another mountain range. My joy came when I noticed how it was just a few people I passed on this trail. My goal is to climb as many fun loving mountains as I can until...mane ole I'm enjoying myself!", 'Good trail, but watch out for snakes!  It was a great but or respite from the over crowded Cowles mtn.  Finished the5 peak challenge here, fun accomplishment!!!', 'Great workout! We took the barker trailhead.', 'Fun quick little hike this morning. ', 'cowles has a better view (which you go to first) but this one has less people and the trail is pretty cool', 'Hiked this today and let me just say it did not disappoint! Loved every minute! We had heard that this trail may be haunted so kept our eyes open for something out of the ordinary...let me just say we MAY have had an encounter ', 'moderate difficulty with great views. going early is the key here, minimal people. last quarter mile is a nice curve ball!!', 'Nice hike moderate until the last 0.25 miles almost straight up! Nice view. Take a glass of wine and a snack. A perfect place to watch the sunset!', 'Love this hike if done from the Santee side. Took us about 2 hours.', "Excellent hike ! Started at Big Rock and did Cowles and then went onto Pyles. We did not realize how far Pyles was from Cowles. It was pretty warm too. When I do this again, I'll have a bigger hat and more water !", 'Peaks one and two of the five peak challenge.  Five in one day 15.2 miles 4494 feet of gain.  Cowles, Pyles, South and North Fortuna, and Kwaay Paay.  Good times.', 'This was a great addition to cowles mountain if you want a bit of an extra challenge. Due to the nature of climbing two peaks ultimately the way back is challenging as well to get back to the top of cowles mountain! Very few people compared to cowles which was nice.', 'I like it! Started at 7pm was back down by 10 pm. I really like night time hiking at this particular location. the reason for that is, not too many people are out there. I highly recommend doing this hike at night time!', 'Its Cowles part 2. Fun hike with more great views and different perspectives. Bring extra water on warm days.', 'Easy fun hike.', "The road less traveled! Since you've finished Cowles you might as well head down and hike Pyles", 'Great hike!  Did this on 9-5-16 as part of the five-peak challenge.  Did them all in one day.  18.1 miles.  4,326 feet of elevation gain, 6 1/2 hours.  Fun!  Did Kwaay Paay first, then North Fortuna, and South Fortuna.  Then, drove to Big Rock and hiked Pyles and Cowles.', 'As stated before, the hike to Cowles is typically crowded. Continuing on to Pyles, there were very few hikers/trail runners, which was a nice change of pace for a weekend hike. Very little shade like all the major peaks in the park, so bring sun protection and a good amount of water. Clear trail with signs made it simple to navigate to the top.', 'I just completed mission trails 5 peak challenge and pyles was my favorite hike', 'connected to Cowles trail for a great hike.', 'IT WAS MODERATE TO DIFFICULT. NOT MUCH OF A VIEW, BUT THE HIKE WAS OK', 'good for working out. Lots of uphill', 'Typical crowded cowels, then drop town to Pyles trail and much less crowded. Let the dogs off the leash and enjoyed. Typical SD hike views. Nothing special but good exercise.', 'Good hike more work than expected after summiting cowles but worth it for the peace after such a crowded area on cowles.', 'Good hike, not very crowded once away from the crowds at cowls mountain.', 'We started from the front of cowles and the pyles peak. Once you get past the rush of cowles the trail is nice and quiet', "Pyles is great if you can avoid the main trail up Cowel's Mt", "Overall great hike. We started up Barker trail so we only ended up on Cowles for a short time. Once you summit Cowles and get on Pyles it's nice and quiet with very few people. Great views as well. Would do it again.", "Short and sweet.... One of the Five Peak Challenge trails. Hour and half and it's over.", "My new favorite city mountain trail. It's like how Cowles used to be: peaceful and beautiful. Some shade, not a lot, though. If you want to avoid the crowds and basically maintain the distance, try Barker instead of Golfcrest.", 'Nice addition to Cowles.', "Great hike.  Not too many people on the other side of Cowles.  It's a long hike but great workout.", 'Nice addition to Cowles to make it a "real" hike.  Way less people too, which is nice.', 'It was awesome, with good company, any trail is easy!!', 'Great family workout , We would definitely do it again ', "The crowds go up and down Cowles Mountain. Once you're off Cowles' peak and onto the Pyle's Peak trail, you have it to yourself.

The description to this hike describes a starting point at Big Rock Park, but the map shows the trail head at Navajo and Golfcrest. The route shown is a moderate hike. The route described is much more difficult climbing out of Santee.", 'This morning, 12/24/2015 first time hiking Pyle Mt trail after reaching Cowles Mt (x amount times) and I really enjoyed this trail. Just like the backside trails (via Big Rock Park) to Cowles Mt, this trail is less traveled which is good.  I only saw 8 other hikers, including me which I liked the solidarity. Another way you can tell, no trash and dog poop, like Cowles Mt trails. After 5 minutes into the hike (via Cowles Mt, the only way), you will see the switchback to the top but you will get delusional because Pyle Peak is not that, it the other Peak furthermore and more switchbacks which is cool.  I was disappointed the log peak was missing.  I wish people just respect the trails for others to enjoy,  Other than that, this is a cool peak/valley rugged hike, especially after the rain San Diego County had.', 'I hiked it from Barker Way on a Friday afternoon.  Very few people on the trail except for the bit when you join the primary Cowles trail near its summit. About 6 miles round trip, I could see it being pretty brutal mid summer but in December it was very pleasant.', 'Similar views to Cowles Mt, but no crowds', 'Hiked it from cowlestrail. it was a nice trail.  clean and well maintained.', 'Hiked Pyles peak from Big Rock rd in Santee (7.2miles). Steep hike to Cowles  and another 1.5 to Pyles. Great hike and no problems parking. If you start at Big Rock park the hike should be 7.5 miles', 'Hiked it from cowles, easy.', 'It is a good, mostly solitary trail. I hiked it from Cowles Mt.', "Hiked March 28, 2015 - a Saturday morning.  Arrived at trailhead (Navajo/Golfcrest) around 7:15 a.m.  Had to park down the street a 1/2 mile (really) because of the crowds.  Thinking back, the parking lot at the trailhead has space for a limited number of cars - maybe 20-30.  Plenty of parking on the street, but you may be a ways away like we were.  Trail to Cowles was crowded.  Pleasant ascent at this time of the morning - next time I will go even earlier. The trail to Cowles peak is 1.4 miles and 918 feet of elevation gain.  It is a continuous ascent.  The trail is usually plenty wide and is dust and rocks.  Abundant desert vegetation. After a rest at the summit of Cowles, we headed toward the radio towers, then took the trail on the left to head to Pyle's Peak.  Hardly anyone on this part of the trail.  We saw maybe 10 people total on the way to and from Pyle's Peak, compared to the hundreds on the trail from the trailhead to Cowles summit.  There is a bit of shade in certain spots on this trail, but consider the time of year - during the summer, the sun will be more direct and I don't think there will be much shade during the day.  Over 99% of this hike (from the trailhead) is full sun exposure.  (I'll bet this would be a great night hike.)  The trail from Cowles to Pyle's is up and down, providing a nice variety for the knees. It is 1.5 miles from Cowles to Pyle's Peak, and this part of the hike is very pleasant.  Hummingbirds were enjoying the flowers on the Yucca plants and other desert plants. From Cowles to Pyle's, there is a net loss of 244 feet, (683 feet downhill and 439 feet uphill).  

Total stats (using the Alltrails app on my iPhone):
  5.8 miles round trip from the trailhead
  2040 feet of total elevation gain 
  4 hours (56 yr old occasional hiker)
  Lots of water and sunscreen
  I would recommend taking 3 liters of water on a hot day

A very enjoyable hike!", 'Decided to hike this trail right after reaching the summit of Cowles so it was an added challenge!
not many people on this trail I guess Cowles is enough for them.
Made the mistake of not bringing enough water so I had to pace myself with the water.
bring plenty of water if you are going to do both trails.
And sunscreen..It was a hot day when I did it.', "very nice hike to pyle's peak. cowled mtn part is busy when you start pyle's peak is very empty a lot of shadow from trees make the trip fresh. I did t like that their is no monument at the top to take a picture with.", 'A wonderfully peaceful hike, once you traverse the Cowles Mtn trail. Hardly anyone continues onto this shaded & cozy trail. The last part is definetly steep, but well worth the climb!', "No way it is 6.5 mile like it says here on Alltrails. From the parking lot on the top of Golfcrest Dr it's only 1.3 mi. to the summit. Very short for a 'hike'.", "Nice short 35 minute hike to the summit. WAY TOO CROWDED. Doesn't seem to matter what day of the week, it's always crowded.   Because of that, I'd much rather hike N Fortuna summit.", 'Nice hike with less crowds than on Cowles Trail, although a short portion of hike is on Cowles, took fire road back which adds a bit more milage.', 'The uncrowded version of Cowles Mtn.', "Nice trail near San Diego State University.  First half is the Cowles Mountain trail, very well traveled that reminds me of Piestewa Peak in Phoenix for its popularity.  If you continue on the Pyles Peak trail, you'll only see a few people for the next couple miles with outstanding scenery.   Completed in under a couple hours.", 'If you are going to hike the human freeway that is Cowles, you might as well continue onto Pyles. The extra stretch adds an extra challenge and there is much less traffic. The trail has a little shade on some parts, which is nice.', "Finished Cowles and went to Pyles Peak but just about to start ascent and was nearly bitten by rattlesnake. Didn't see it until it had veered up in defensive position and was hissing at me. Decided to turn around as it shook me up but looking forward to going back and finishing. Cowles crazy crowded but not a soul on The trail to Pyles. Perfect. Spoke to Ranger and he said that each 1000 ft elevation is equal to an extra mile.", "Great workout hike due to the beginning being Cowels Mtn. After you pass the crowd at Cowels though it's a nice solitary hike, only passed one trail runner and two hikers. Nice views from both Cowels and Pyles Peak.", "This trail is attached to Cowles Mountain so because of that it's tougher than you'd expect.  However, I found the hike from the top of Cowles Mtn. to Pyles Peak more like a cool down from hiking up Cowles.  With the exception of the trail that goes straight up the peak when you get to the base of Pyles Peak it's more like a walk on a trail.

More Info: http://matthewsadventurediary.blogspot.com/2013/05/mor-pyle-peak.html", "Local, convenient, great added workout after climbing to the top of Cowles, and less people - in fact, hardly anyone! I saw a total of 4 other people and, at the very top, 1 disinterested snake. I did go on a Monday, though. I'll definitely be back. 

Some reviewers wrote that this is a 4.5 mile hike, but I think this is a 6 mile hike according to Afoot & Afield. (I'll check and edit this review if I'm wrong). 

I believe the hike can be completed in 2 - 2.5 hrs, but since it was my first time on the trail, I stopped and looked around a lot. ", 'Added this to my weekly Cowles Mountain trek. Adds an extra challenge to the hike.', 'The challenge with Pyles Peak is not the trail, but that it comes after climbing to the top of Cowles.  I usually do this after climbing Cowles from the Big Rock entrance, so adding Pyles makes it a nice 8 mile loop.  It is also nice because often there is cloud covering for some of the hike.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Waterfalls of Mount Diablo Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'paved', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Waterfalls of Mount Diablo Loop Trail is a 5.8 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Clayton, California that features a waterfall and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.
