user_texts:
['The lake is really really low. You can’t even see water until the back half of the trail and then it’s more of a swamp. The vegetation is still recovering from the fire. It was still a great hike to do!!', 'Good hike. One little steep hill. Very easy', 'A bit charred still from the fires, and the water level is low, but still a pretty hike and nice loop, away from the hustle and bustle...but not too far so it’s easy to access!', 'This is a moderate trail. you can have option to push a lil harder by trying a stiffer road or just follow a flat road.', 'This was my first hike. I enjoyed it!!', 'Is there a lake in the area?', 'Lovely trail not hard at all', 'took my wife and kids. our dog had fun fresh air great scenery', 'Too crowded even on a weekday afternoon. Too many bikers and people playing loud music while you’re walking, scaring off all wildlife. Not to mention. Due to the fires, only the outside area is open, causing you to hear a ton of traffic while you’re at it. Big nature lover, but between everything, you just feel like you’re waking along a street and there happens to be some nature nearby.', "it's a work-out with a great view.", 'Great place for beginners to start hiking!', "A good portion of the park was burned in the recent fires but they've since opened some of the trails again. Went today and there were several crews surveying the damage and tractors removing dead trees. The hiking is always good here, though. Easy trails good for running.", "Keep in mind that Peter's burned in the Canyon Fire 2 and it may be while before the vegetation comes back.  For now, it is closed.", "It's an easy scenic trail.", 'Cool views open space helpful signs', 'Easy trail around a lake. Comes with two inclines that is the only "hard" part. Relatively boring because you're still in the heart of a suburban neighborhood. If you come here at dusk or night, be prepared to get netted in the face by webs.', 'Must do of the Peters Canyon trails !', 'No shade. Trails are not kept well. There is a lot of dog poop along the trails.', 'Not that bad', 'Beautiful easy trail.', "I did this hike recently because I didn't want nothing to tough since I had hiked the previous day. Did a modified version of this loop which included some climbs. It's pretty easy and heavily populated. I'm a purist and don't really like the bluetooth radios on trails and I heard several on this hike. You get a mix of serious hikers, runners, leisurely walkers and mountain bikers. One thing to note is that they don't open the gate until 7am. So if you're an earlier starter like I am, take note!", "It's OK.  Hiking in the midst of suburbia isn't my cup of tea.", 'its a family and dog friendly trail, roadrunner, rabbit, raven and small birds afoot. cacti for you cacti lovers:)', 'Pretty views, and great for bike riding.', 'Easy and nice trail. It was good for my 4 year old kid.', 'Great hike use the East Trail Loop.', "Love this trail! It's a great go to for a quick hike with some good inclines. It can get very crowded on the weekends, so highly recommend to do it early as possible. The trail is good for running as well and dogs. Although during the hotter days in the OC I wouldn't recommend to bring your pets. Some weekends the nature trail is open and it gives you a sense your somewhere else. Parking can get pretty full rather quickly and there is a kiosk to pay for parking. Most weekends it's $3-$5 bucks.", "The trail is great. When not in shape these hills will make you shed some pounds. Just recently the trail got fixed by covering holes in the ground and it's great condition now. If you live in Orange County it's a great area to start hiking in.", 'Beautiful and easy unless you do "The Hill". This incline is tough for beginners and definitely makes you earn the summit.', 'Easy trail but beautiful!', 'Idea for beginning hikers.', 'Great hike on Monday 3.01 miles /2:06:23 min/ 698 calories', 'Easy hike,  great for kids. Dogs are allowed. With all the recent rains the park is green and the trail is lined with wildflowers along several parts if the trail.', 'Great way to start the day!', 'Beautiful place to Hike, amazing views, tranquil and so peaceful', "Second trail using this app. We started this loop going to the right from the parking lot. Neat at first cuz it was like walking in a grassy forest but soon turned into a slog up a long steep incline up a dusty, hoof-pocked wide hill. Wifey was huffing and puffing. A few minutes later we faced a shorter but steeper climb. Trails are dusty. Steep descent along a narrow V-trenched footpath necessitated a penguin walk like walking on a moving bus. A large portion of the final end seems like you're walking on a dusty service road rather than a hike in the great outdoors. Ends up walking along the street which completely breaks the mood. Unlikely to trek here again.", "It's a decent trail for the locals of the are. Not worth the 45 minute drive to enjoy it. There is some shade in certain areas but make sure you bring some water on a hot day.", 'I like how half the trails is easy and mellow and then the other half is all hills. Depending on my mood or energy level, I can pick between the two. Definitely one of my faves.', "I really loved this trail. I have tachycardia and the hills were a bit much for me so I had to slow down and watch my heart rate on them but the view was beautiful. I could see this trail being a challenge in warmer weather and it's definitely a busy trek full of friendly people.", 'Easy hike, and oops, I took my dog ', "Great workout ! That one hill that leads to the memorial bench is killer for beginners but totally worth it ! Really felt great after this hike ! There's some great views too", "I was confused about where to start, then realized it is a loop, so it doesn't matter. Doh! Very nice trail, but I would label it closer to moderate because of the two kick butt hills. Beginners beware.", 'Its a good workout!', 'I loved this trail it was awesome!', 'Nice trail, my first time here. It is painful to see the lake is dried and the vegetation is all so dead. I came by 8am, got to try earlier since it was already too hot to walk and the little bugs keeping flying around you.', "It's a cool trail, but the lake bed is dried up so there's only really a bunch of dead stuff everywhere.", 'I love this trail, one of my favorites!', 'easy trail but sandy and dusty， not much shade ，bring enough water', 'I"m a new hiker and I enjoy the trails here great workout and beautiful views', "Challenging but not too difficult. Bring lots of water if it's hot.", 'Very good hiking trail..great cardio excercise place 2 go..', 'Moderate = two good size hills. I really enjoy having trails so close to home.', "Great trail, the AllTrails description says it's only accessible October-June but I only saw a couple of short stretches that were closed for restoration (hiking in July). I did the Lake View trail and threw in the big red hill on East Ridge View trail, looping back on Gnatcatcher trail. It took me roughly an hour at a good pace with a couple of cool-down breaks. The trail itself is very nice and varied, got there at 10am on a Wednesday and it was pretty quiet though there were a lot more cars by the time I got back to my car at 11:15ish. Kind of cool seeing that the lake is completely dried up, and saw some nice plant life. Watch out for the heat!! You get a nice breeze in a lot of stretches but it gets very hot especially around the southern side of Lake View.", 'Hiked this past weekend, easy trail, not too many people but really hot! I think if we went earlier in the day it would been cooler.', 'Great! 3 different courses but my fave is going up the red hill. Medium difficulty for beginners.', "These trails are awesome! You can choose your difficulty level from easy to strenuous. It's a very popular spot so can become crowded during mid-day. Lots of people walking, hiking, dogs and bike riders.", "Great trail for a quick hour and a half -to -two hour hike, depending on your speed.  on the whole 5 mile hike, there is a nice challenge up to the top, and because there is not much shade it makes the mild part of the trail a little more on the moderate level.  Just pack the sunblock and a hat, and you'll have a great work work out!", 'This is one of my favorite place to go for a quick mountain bike ride. Has a few good climbs and nice flats. Only downside is that it can get pretty congested on weekend mornings.', 'Great trail for working on trail running skills as well as great training for a race or just to strengthen your cardio', 'Ohh the uphills!!', 'This is a great trail for beginners or for someone who wants to add a little something extra to their run. I have been going here for years; you can make it as long or as short as you want. There are 2 ways to enter; on the orange side, which starts you at the lake (or what use to be a nice lake before the drought) or on the Tustin side, which starts you off with some inclines.', 'Well manicured, dog friendly trails from easy to difficult level. The views on the difficult trail is spectacular. Would repeat', 'I live around the corner from here. great for running!', 'great hike. my go to place.', 'Best hiking trail ever', 'Nice view of Catalina. Went on the weekend. Quite busy.Good hills for that extra workout.', 'Great morning hike', 'Awesome day!', 'Easy daily walk for a jog', 'Is a really nice place to walk or run', 'pretty amazing views', 'Went during sunset. Loved the smell of the eucalyptus and sound of coyotes howling at the sound of the ambulance. There were neat shady benches during 5:00 pm and many different trails to take. It was great for a beginner hiker.', "A nice variety in difficulty is provided here, but there is almost zero shade, and it is impossible to forget that you're smack dab in the middle of the suburbs. Hike this trail for a workout but not if you dislike romping through other people's back yards.", 'Great training for Vail Lake Ragnar trail race', 'good workout trails', 'It was a great hike. But sad to see the lake dry and dead.  ', "Awsome for a beginner been doing it for a month it's really Awsome .", 'Excelente.', 'A little tough, but I enjoyed the 6 mile uphill challenge!', 'Nice place to get away. Short and easy.', '', 'Good hike, just be careful  with the rattle snakes and coyotes', 'Perfect trail for hiking with kids and dogs.', 'Easy hike, with just a few steep hills, nice views and different ambients', 'Really nice and took DA BOYZ ages 7-11.  They did great for the first 3 miles but we had a straggler the last 2 miles.  Lots of fun.', 'Great place for a nature hike. ', 'Great beginner hike and also some fun geocaches', 'This is a nice beginner trail, there are 2 steep points which adds to the excitement.  The lake is almost dried up due to drought. It is a good trail if you want to start slow to build up. It took me around 1.5 hrs to finish.', 'Great, easy trail in the OC. If you go on a clear day, the views are excellent. There are some steep hills but for the most part easy to conquer.', 'This is great for exercising. Not much else. I stay away from it on weekends as it gets crowded. I walk the trail up and over ridge 2 days a week after work. Takes about 1 hr 15 min.', "I'm not sure why this is called the Lake View trail because you can barely see the lake. This trail is better suited for runners or people that just want to take their dog on a walk.", 'could do some trail running here.', "This trail has a lot of options from steep inclines to level trails. I believe it's 5 miles. However, you can weave in and out the various trails to create the length you desire. The only negative aspect of this trail is that it is crowded with families, hikers, runners, mountain bikers and others and most do not exhibit trail etiquette.  I'll definitely venture Peter's Canyon more often.", "Place is very nice considering there is a lot of challenging spot. Medium to hard! Poo almost everywhere so beware, they don't really push a law in this place to pick up after their dog apparently! Over all, I'd like to go and bring my dog next time, dog friendly!", 'Trails made for trucks, not pedestrians. For a curated suburban park there is a surprising lack of water.', 'Beautiful during the spring great hike and enough hills to feel like you got a bit of a workout', 'Pretty good hike except too many dogs and irresponsible owners who left the poo on the trail.', 'Great trail run to help one train for obstacle course races. I finished my first Spartan race a few weeks ago and felt myself lacking with hill running this trail is excellent for training.', 'if we had some good rain im sure it would be beautiful but it is so dried up I was afraid I wildfire was gonna start at any moment! the hiking is easy or challenging depending on the routes you choose so that ia pretty cool! parking is $3!', 'this was my second hike ever. i went with my family. the trail was fairly easy. my 2 year went to sleep so we had to push the stroller which was not that difficult except for few slippery slopes and uphill', 'It is a good exercising loop but like others have said it is to urban. I am just happy my dog is allowed on the trails with me.', "I don't use this trail to enjoy nature but to get healthy.  It's a nice run", 'A decent training hike. Its a bit too urbanized for anyone who enjoys wilderness.', "I hiked this trail last week with a dear friend. We stayed on the loop around the lake. Most of it was quite easy, but there are two killer hills if you aren't in shape. We avoided one by taking the longer trail that went right by the lake, but there was no way around the other. I made it, but I had to rest at the top for several minutes before continuing. The rest of it was quite enjoyable. There were a few joggers, bikers, and fellow hikers. Everyone was quite friendly. We heard a woodpecker and saw a roadrunner, hawk, lizards, rabbits, and I think some doves and quail. I got a parking warning because I didn't pay the $3 (I couldn't figure out where to pay, but next time I will look harder). It was just a warning since it was my first offense, but maybe they were just in a good mood that day. Overall, I really enjoyed this loop trail and plan on going back... when I am in better shape.", 'I have a love hate relationship with this trail. Its a bit difficult for me as I am a newbie to hiking. The mail hill always gives me the hardest workout. Once I hike it though, its pretty much a breeze. Lots of up and downs on other hills, beautiful scenery and the lake just adds that extra touch. ', 'this is my 3rd time on the trail, 1st time I did it I went up the east ridge and I was hooked. planning to bring my family here when its cooler,  might have a chance to see some wild  life.  Everybody on the trail is courteous.  ', '+ Day parking is available at the lot for $3. Avoid getting ticketed/towed. Park hours are from sunrise to sunset (gate sign forewarns closure before 8 pm!).
+ Signs are posted to help you easily navigate the Lake View Loop.  
+ Majority of the trail is at a steady elevation with a couple of major inclines and declines. Great calorie buster!  
+ Be careful when going downhill; its easy to slip and injure yourself.  
+ Also be aware of the surrounding cacti and funnel spider webs!  
+ With half jogging and half walking, my friend and I took about an hour to complete the trail.  
+ Views of the lake were spectacular, especially while the sun was setting.     
+ Overall, a great place to do some trail-running!

[STATS] Summer-July. Late-PM. Sunset-high 60s. Light.', 'This was a great hike with lots of hills and valleys to keep me in shape and ready for the tougher trails. Lots of friendly people throughout the hike along with the mountain bikers. A few dogs but not many. Loved the hike, the views and the weather. A perfect morning with friends on the trail.', "People that are walking.... Please get the heck outta the way! They don't even turn there head to look to see where the heck ur coming from. Overall good trail n friendly people but watch out for the orientals they walk like the drive.", 'Great medium level hike, lots of ups and downs. Dogs are allowed, please only bring friendly dogs- as there are lots of dogs on the trails! Only down fall is the trail is often crowded... Make sure you are alert and pay attention to get out of the way of the mountain bikers, especially if you have your dog! Everyone is always friendly, and courteous. We do this trail 3-4 times weekly, and enjoy it!', 'Had a good solid ride. Fun but gets old after multiple rides. Great for beginning riders but would not recommend for more experienced riders. One of the downsides is that there are too many people as a mountain biker it gets very dangerous fast with too many people.', 'Love this trail. Did the opposite side today and it was a total of 3 miles. Friendly people, trail was crowded. Great workout! We will definately come back.', 'I love this trail! Good for hill running. Peaceful.', 'Great trail... Beautiful scenery. Was very muddy due to rain the night before. Will definitely come back.', "Very beautiful view. Will def. do it again even though trail is very easy. I enjoyed the view. Parking it's only 3dls", 'Great mt bike trail! I will come back for sure!', "I run this trail daily and bike it regularly. It's really fun for beginners or those of us who enjoy a solid trail run that won't kill you. The trail is wide enough for the crowds that turn out on the weekends, but offers enough challenging single lines to keep those who are looking for something more challenging entertained. Lots of small animals and the occasional snake turn up, and the views of the lake are great in the early morning. ", "This is a great beginners trail if you are starting to get into mountain biking. I always start at the back which is on Peters Canyon Rd.  I started on this trail myself, I would do the loop without Big Red becuase I felt like I just wasn't ready for it. I now do the whole loop starting from the enterance at Peters Canyon Rd all the way to Canyon View Rd all the way to Big Red and back down to Peters Canyon Rd. I used to hate this trail because with out climbing big red it felt too easy but now it's one of my fast favorite trails to do. It's quick and easy with a great Big Red finish. I do see it gets pretty packed and sometimes mountain biking isn't all that great when it's packed. So choose your time wisely.", 'very easy trail, fun to go with family ! wishing it were more challenging or had more trees/creeks.

 lots of horse poo on the trail though', 'Great hike today. Our first time here and we started off easy and veered off on to some of the more difficult trails. Will definitely go again. ', 'I have done this hike a couple of times and  I enjoyed doing the ridge route.  The different trails offer experience for both the new and the moderate hiker.  Word of caution, if you go there on a weekend come early because the parking lots get full and so does the trails.', 'Was fun to do with a friend! ', 'Great trail for beginners in hiking and mountain biking. Did the long loop with kids and hit all the geocaches in the area. It does get a decent amount of people on weekends but still a nice quick fix if I need it. ', "Great hike for first timers and options for longer hiking for not beginners. Daughter and I did 5.5 miles on Mother's Day and we really enjoyed ourselves. Would most likely hike again.", 'Love hiking a Peters Canyon.  It has beautiful views and long and short trails.', 'Nice views of the surrounding area. Was able to watch the hawks soar at eye level while on top of one of the high points of the trail. Dog friendly which is always a plus. ', 'Good for beginners. Scenery was ok, maybe nicer in summer.', '"Peters Canyon Regional Park" ', 'A great walk. Really friendly people on the trail with us. Had a little rise with the heartbeat when we happened on a four foot rattler crossing the trail. The snake took exception to our feet, hissed, reared back and rattled a bit. We gave it the right of way, got some pictures, tipped our hats, caught our breaths and went on up the trail. There were several rattlers out there today. Quite a few hikers were buzzing about sightings on the straight trail above the creek trail. All in all a nice hike with some exciting animal encounters.', 'pretty easy for the most part, unless you try to tackle big red. i enjoy riding there after classes.', "This is an excellent trail for beginners, and it's very easy to get to. It's good for young kids too. make sure to include the creek section of the trail!", 'I'm a frequent visitor of Peter's Canyon. Our running team uses this trail to practice for long miles and hill training. A good portion of the trail runs along a water reservoir and a house tract; this part of the trail can be boring at times and often brings a lot of bikers but if you use this trail to focus on your running vs the scenic route you'll find it quite useful for your training. However as this trail loops into the "Mountain and Sea Trail" and the "Hicks Canyon Trail;" you'll get a well deserved treat for enduring the boring bits at the beginning. 

Overall, not a bad destination spot but I would definitely recommend only visit during the day, not at night since this trail runs in an area that is not lit.

hike_name:
Marshall Canyon Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'river', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Marshall Canyon Trail is a 10.4 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Claremont, California that features a river and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['I was skeptical about the trail due to the fact that it starts in a residential neighborhood but it’s a fantastic hike. Nice scenery, some really nice views. Last, not sure how a 11-12 mile hike qualifies as “easy”. This should be listed as moderate.', "Don't really care for the lower part near Oak Mesa, but I don't mountain bike either. Upper portion near Marshall Canyon parking area is a big spider we of trails, but after enough visits, it's easy enough to figure out how to get back to where you parked. Definitely more crowded once you cross over to the Claremont side and into the Claremont Wilderness park. Most of the bikers here seem to be real good with their trail courtesy.", 'I thought this was a beautiful hike lots of photo ops and beautiful spots. It was easy for the most part with a couple inclines for good measure.', 'Easy.  Nice. But easy to get lost too. We somehow turned it into a 15 miler....in the dark.', 'Love this trail! It’s so beautiful, lots of scenery. My 5 year old son hiked it and he loved every second!', 'Really peaceful hike ', 'Excellent steady climb with several stream crossings.', 'Fun hike >> https://hikingguy.com/hiking-trails/best-la-hikes/marshall-canyon-trail/', 'love this trail', 'A great and beautiful hike with tons of wilderness and plant life! A must do hike!', 'Amazing, one of my favorite hikes, except the portion where you’re walking on the side of a golf course for a short bit. Plenty of wild life, deer everywhere several crossing the trail in front of me. Most of the time you’re walking along a creek bed, very serene and peaceful the half way point is in direct sun so bring plenty of water and sun screen. Definitely an easy hike, just long, didn’t feel like it though. Good, even, well  maintained trail great for running but you’ll want to walk through this one its beautiful. FYI this trail is shared by hikers, bikes and horses so be mindful and courteous to all.', 'To get to actual trailhead google MARSHALL CANYON STAGING AREA * 9/6/18 my car was broken into and my wallet and personal items stolen!!! Put everything in your trunk when you leave to hike or bike. Shattered glass all over my car :/ Hike was great until that point but there’s very little shade so it’s not ideal for dogs unless you have cooling vests and water for them but incline is great :)', "best trail around really. little bit of everything. couple small rock gardens, easy gradient at first and steepens up further on. creak runs through the trail a couple times and there's some decent berms further up. park at the elementary school lot. mind the horse poop and some sketchy drops. could definitely use a community day of trail maintenance, but still great.", 'I did a little backpack weight training on the trail starting at the biker entrance. It was around a total of 10 miles out and back. There are a lot of different mostly shaded trails/dirt roads you can take depending on what you want to do for the first 5 miles or so.

 Once the elevation gain starts, make sure you have water and sun protection because there is no shade like mentioned in previous reviews. However, there is a nice, shaded rest area towards the end of the gain with benches and outhouses. The bathrooms were locked when I was there during the week.

If you hike the part where the elevation gain starts, I would rate this hike more as moderate just because of how exposed to the sun you are.', 'For Hikers, google "Marshall Canyon Staging Area" and start from there.  Alltrails' map starts off at an elementary school that's so far from the actual trail for hikers. 

Looking back at the map now, it would be best to go east on Stephens Ranch Road from the staging area.  We ended up going south and then hiked north. It's all down hill and little shade. 

Once we arrived at the 3.5 marker (according to Alltrails' map), we went the in a counter clock wise route.  This is more difficult than going in a clock wise fashion as the east side of the trail is much steeper than the west/north side. I'll know now to check out the elevation map for better planning in the future. 

The east side has little to no shade. The west/north has plenty of shade.  

All the creeks were on vacation, we saw zero bodies of water on this hike during this time of the year, July 29. Was hoping to find a nice shaded hike with streams of water during the heat. 

Saw a few bunnies, lizards, ants and snake skins on the trail. 

Started at 3pm and got back at 7pm. Got real dark at 8-820pm in the area. Gates close at sunset or 8pm. 

Looking forward to coming back here in Spring time.', 'I have entered the trail in La Verne, near  Live Oaks—around the trail’s 3.5 mile market—and have gone both directions—towards the trailhead in La Verne and the other way up the mountain towards Claremont Wilderness.  It is easy in the La Verne side, but gets progressively more challenging the other way.  Around mile marker 5, the trail starts getting steep and progressively steeper.  Not easy for sure.  I’d say intermediate is more accurate.  Also around there is shade no more!   Good workout, but be prepared and know what you are getting into!!', 'Parked at Oak Mesa Elementary School off Wheeler Ave.  Access to the trail through the park over the wash bride takes you to Los Robles right, to Via De Mansion right, to Orangewood St left, trail head half ways down the block on your left. Find the trail head on Google Maps “Marshall Canyon Biking Trail”Trail has good shade throughout first 4 miles in then it opened up. Not to technical, some loose trails closer to the the top loop. Carful on Roller Coaster Trail coming down.', 'Great trail to get some cardio in. Be on the lookout, I had a bear pop out on to the trail today when I got to the top.', "Loved this trail! Had some trouble finding it...Yes, you should go over the bridge and walk through the neighborhood...but once found it was great! This will be a repeated trail absolutely. I hadn't been hiking in awhile and this trail was easy enough that it didn't kill me. Great trees, some old stables and lovely scenery ", 'Very easy and shady !!! Trees cover the trail the whole way  so it’s not to hot . Nice stream of water at some points of the trail .', "this is a great walking trail. perfect for beginners, bike riding, dogs, kids, and anyone who just enjoy quiet nature. It doesn't get too crowded and is always clean and peaceful. lots of shade and trees and grass. I grew up In la verne and have been coming to this trail for years and it's still just as beautiful as it's always been. especially after rainfall.  Very easy but very peaceful", "I really enjoyed this hike with my wife. There is tree coverage in certain parts of the trail as well. We started the hike past the golf course where there is a dirt parking lot at the end of the road. It's an easy hike.", 'Great for all ages', "Nice easy trail. Arrive early to beat the crowds. We started at about 7:30 & had the trail to ourselves but by the time we finished there were lots of people & we were being constantly buzzed by mountain bikes (even though there last fews miles they're supposed to go 3mph…)", "used this trail for biking and hiking for last 16 years. after a bad crash in chantry flats I quit for awhile. but I got a new bike, and i'm back. trails for great last week. conditions are nice. good size crowd. doing upper section next week. this is always my go to trail for a nice mountain bike ride for some lite cardio. lower half is shaded. entrance close to via de mansion.", 'Still confused about how to get to the lower trailhead for the Marshal Canyon trail. The green dot on the map begins at a park off Wheeler and the trailhead from there was too difficult to find and seems to go through a suburb. Finally ended up at the mid section off of Stephen Ranch Road. This trail head is not the Marshal Canyon trailhead, but the Spur Trail which ultimately connects to part of the Marshal Canyon Trail. Looking forward to hiking this trail, but honestly, even the trail map could do better at clarifying where all of the trailheads can be accessed.', 'Awesome trail with lots of terrain.', 'Great level of challenge. Not necessarily easy—more like moderate. The best part is the feeling of accomplishment. You’ll like it. If you want a shorter hike, park at the Regional Park. That should be a bit under 5 miles or so. If you want about 8 mile challenge park by Lowell Brandt Park. Have fun!!!', 'Love this spot. Also good for hikes', 'Fun good beginning trail.', 'Nice hike..  there were a few killer hills.  Beware there’s lots of cross country teams training & mountain bikes but everyone was respectful of each other.  There was a lot of shade so it’s not too hot.  Didn’t finish the whole hike because one of the members of our group knee gave out.', 'I did a 5 1/2 mile version of this trail, as featured in John W. Robinson's famous book, "Trails of the Angeles." Avoid it on hot and sunny days, as there are many exposed sections.', 'One of my favorite trails. Not easy though and if you are hiking gotta watch out for bikers, they speed down the trail. ⛰', "loved this trail, it's rated as easy it didn't feel easy to me.  It was a great work out.", 'Love this trail for some mountain biking!', 'Nothing to crazy. This is the trail  that sparked my hiking hobby. Good beginner trail. Tons of wildlife and rattlesnakes. ALOT I mean ALOT of horse poop on the trail watch your step. No crazy views but it is very scenic near the stream. I usually park on Stephens ranch rd , after the golfcourse in this dirt parking lot and start my trek down.', "We love this trail! plenty of shade, challenging enough for a good cardio workout. We took our shihtzu and he loved it, especially the spot where the stream crosses the path. we'll be back! 10.9.17", 'With dog.', 'Will DEFINITELY come back to hike the whole thing and/or bike to Claremont loop. Peaceful running creek water and serene atmosphere of trees and rock', 'No shade. A lot of horse poop', 'I went today and I like it', 'Crazy climb to the top,,, fun downhill to the bottom! Fun stuff!!!', 'Great trail', 'Awesome trail, great cardio. Challenging but not too intense.', 'awesome  trails kinda complicated because there are trails going and coming from different directions. lots of mountain biking altho they are careful with hikers. I would be back  soon', "It's a nice and easy trail, a little hard to find I would say", 'Great fun after a rain. Much of the trail under the shade of ancient oaks. Beautiful', 'Kid friendly :) stay on the left and walk next to the creek. You will find a rope where you can play. Hike 8 of 52 #52HikeChallenge', "Don't follow this map. It's start like 3 miles away from the real trail. I made the mistake I end walking more on the street then the trail. Please update this map.", 'You start out by a school parking lot then walk over a bridge, continuing down a side street until you make a left onto the trail. kept checking the map to make sure this was the right way. once you get on the trail you will have to jump over the creek a few times. If your hiking wait a few days to go after the rain our you will have a muddy time.', 'fun', 'fun!!!', 'excellent', 'Good', 'great and very scenic. good if you like that nature walk but still close to home type thing. it's not very "in the wilderness" (the trail crosses through a golf course) but it's still very beautiful and very scenic. I've gone as far as the gazebo at the top of the hills about 8 or so miles in. my cross country team used to do runs here alot so it's really a HIKE to where u need to pack alot of gear. one or two bottles of water and some comfy shoes and you'll be fine. if u run short on water, just ask one of the many cross country runners that train up there. they'll definitely have water on em haha.', 'amazing!!!', 'amazing trail.. i love it!!', "My first MTB experience came 2016-0918+0500 ([yyyy-mmdd+hhmm] = Sunday, Sept 18, 2016 at 5am). Though I cycle around the city for exercise, I was unprepared for the event. 

Discovery #1. I need a better light. 
The people who brought me had lights that projected far and bright, so I could see well what was upcoming. Mine could illuminate, but not so clearly as to pick out a line to travel, so I stayed behind them most of the way up.

Discovery #2. The trail is poorly marked.

Discovery #3. I need a digital tire pressure gauge. 
One of my friends insisted that I ride up the trail with a full firm tires, even though everything I've read said to lower my fat bike pressure to 8-10 lbs of tire pressure, but he was insistent. Once the ride began, I found myself having to lower tire pressure a few times on the way up as road conditions changed; and especially when starting downhill. Then my front became over-deflated, and combined with my inexperience, I found the bike's handling wanting to pull to the left, and controlling the bike got rather difficult on the way down. I did crash a few times, but attribute my downtime to rider inexperience instead of equipment malfunction. 

Discovery #4. I need to change my gear ratio.
I primarily ride on the street, and find my gear ratio too low toI discovered my single 38t gear upfront and 7 speed 34t in back is not low enough a gear for ascending the short uphill sections at the start of Marshall, so I ended up walking my bike a lot. Got to some park bench area, which seemed a natural rest area for visitors; then turned around to go back. 

Discovery #5. Starting early has its advantages.
I've heard that hikers do not like MTB'ers because they are thought to be inconsiderate when flying past them. I discovered early MTB riding is an easy way to reduce the number of obstacles in the trail, be it biker or hiker, but the early AM start time is discouraging. However, as an inexperienced MTB rider, I found their absence to be a blessing. 

Discovery #6 Fauna.
Saw a deer 10 yards away.

Discovery #7. (Has nothing to do with Marshall) I need new a wheel set & tire combination
After the ride, my friends weighed my bike with a shipping scale. My Momentum Rocker by Giant weighs 35.8 lbs. That was surprising to them. I had found only one post that listed the bike at 34._ lbs but had my reservations. Putting my bike on the shipping scale brought resolution to this year long quandary. While I ask you to weigh your own Momentum Rocker, you may want to keep in mind one post weighing the bike at 34, and another listing the bike at 35.  

After weighing the complete bike, we removed the wheels and weighed the bike again. The scale read 16lbs! 

This means the wheels of my Momentum Rocker by Giant weigh nearly a 20lbs combined! That shocked me and everybody. Again, without tires, the Momentum Rocker by Giant weighs 16 pounds; 
'
I am pretty certain that Fat Tire Wheel Sets have been advertised at under 5 lbs a pair, and Fat Tires under 4 lbs a pair. This discovery means with an upgrade of a lightweight wheel set & tire combination, the complete fat bike could be under 25 lbs. A 25 lb fat bike is unheard of for $620, but add a new wheel set for $500 or so, and it becomes very possible when upgrading the Momentum Rocker by Giant.  Giant/Momentum does not plan to build another Fat Bike model in the future, from what I heard (and Momentum says riding the Rocker on a trail will violate its lifetime warranty, just fyi).

Weighing my friend's bikes without tires, both my friends' bike's weight came in at about 19 lbs but they have suspension forks, which probably attributed to the variance from my weight. Thus, perhaps my greatest discovery from Sunday's ride, did not come from the ride, but followed after the ride, when we weighed bikes. The basic weight of the Rocker makes it worth upgrading wheels and tires, and though there is a fat bike derailleur mount available, the odd design at the rear of the frame which accommodates its freewheel hub does limit the range of the chain ring, and may make a 2x or 3x crank set an impossibility. 

I may post an update to announce my discoveries for anyone interested, especially for other Rocker riders who want to upgrade their bikes who may find my experience useful.

In conclusion, it may be considered an easy trail for experienced riders, but it is certainly a challenge for new comers. I was taken as far into the trail as my hosts thought my skill could surpass, and then rode back. There were plenty of MTB riders and several hikers this particular Sunday morning.

I expect greater riding skills, like getting your bike to hop over obstacles, develops with practice,  but starting with the proper gearing would help ensure I remain on the trail, and complete more of the trail next time I go out. Afterwards, I might be able  to contribute a more valuable assessment of the trail, albei", "It's rated easy, but if your out of shape it's moderate.  It's shady with a great view.", "Trail was very pretty but not clearly defined. Trail signs aren't clear and it's easy to find yourself taking an alternate fork and becoming separated from the main trail.All in all a descent outing.", "Bad experience. Like other commenters, lack of signs at the beginning and and bad signs throughout hike. If you start off with the All Trails map and take the path on the left at the fork, you will get lost near the end after 2.75-3miles. You will stray from the red line shown and there will be multiple forks. Take the fire trail, not the one shown in All Trails. While I didn't mind the little adventure of getting lost, my girlfriend was not happy. There is a tag that mentions a river however there was no river on the path we took. I should have read the other comments before going. Also this is not an easy hike due to some of the steepness, length, and lack of direction.", 'Good hiking trail but needs better signs to give better directions. Should have a porta-potty somewhere.', "I really like to go here if I want a nice easy stroll and relax. It's very pretty and easy to follow the trail.", "Big Time Sux!!!!! No signs and got lost and dead ends on trails.  No beautiful tree scenery at all.  I won't be back, unless with someone who actually knows where to hike and where there going.", 'Poor poor signs. Took the wrong trail, due to no signs.', "it's a really good trail. Hiked it this morning. great way to start the day. Only thing that it needs to get better signs to lead hikers to the correct path. I ended up going the wrong way and turned a 4 mile hike into a 6 mile hike.", 'One of my favorite hikes to date.   There was lots of shade and the trial was well maintained.  The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 was due to all of the side trails and lack of directional signs.  It can be a bit confusing.   I was actually thankful for the mountain bikers who told us how to get back on the main trail.', 'Imagine Claremont Wilderness Park but without the huge crowd and whole lot of shade. Also, no parking fees. I did a 5.5 mile semi loop in the morning before the summer heat took over. The oak tree forests are like something out of a movie rather than a canyon in Southern California.', "Great fun with my daughter but it's probably moderate for someone who doesn't hike all the time.", 'Awesome trail, Great fun!!!', "I love this hike!  Just be aware of bikes and for that reason I don't give it 5 stars", 'Hiking BIKING ALL', 'LOVE WALKING, HIKING AND BIKING', 'Not bad, too many bikers though.', 'Nice, well kept trail, wonderful view, but far too crowded for my taste.', 'Awesome trail.', 'This trail is awesome to get away from the hussel and bussel of the city.  Wild life is everywhere,  deer, hawk, owl and birds. The trail is easy to moderate depending which way you go, but worth the time.', 'easy enough for those that walk regularly.', "I suggest doing this trail a little differently. First, park at oak Mesa park at the top of wheeler. Then, take the sidewalk east, over the bridge and onto Los Robles street. Keep going east onto orange wood, and the trailhead will be on your left. It's absolutely beautiful, and when we went today, at around dusk we heard probably a hundred frogs for the last hour. Amazing.", 'Love this place', 'It was a great walk. The route that listed is not the actual trail but 75% fire road with about 25% trail at the end. I definitely like it in the spring time and it is about 50% shaded which is wonderful.', "Joined pro moments before taking this hike and grateful I did. The hike started out great but went south after halfway through. The program drained my phone battery quickly causing my phone to die. I began to follow the same path so I thought  and then began to learn we were lost and drifted off the proper  trail. When I got signal again from my son's phone I download this program into his phone and was able to find our way back to the proper trail and make it back to our vehicle. My phone was at 100% when we started and was off the trail by 1,5 miles when i was able to get signal from my son's. Had I not had app not sure what would have happened. A 3.5 mile hike turned into 6.3 miles and 4.5 hours. will be carrying a battery pack for phone just in case. Was a nice hike just pay attention to signs and your map.", 'Was a good starter hike for my family. Trails are well maintained and still green. Not a lot of water in the creek but enough to attract the wildlife.Looking forward to getting up there with my mountain bike soon.', 'Hiking', 'Great hike, very easy. There are many branches off the main trail. A lot of mountain bikers. Very polite. Saw (5) deer.', 'Trail is currently closed due to recent mountain lion sightings.', 'Nice and easy.there is the opportunity, to see a lot of dear very close.', 'Great trail, really easy.... Love the scenry.', 'Love this one!', 'This hike is adjacent to Claremont Wilderness Loop (it interects it, and shares probably 1/3 mile where both trails meet).  Few notes - Marshall Canyon is as pretty as Claremont Wilderness with FAR fewer people.  Parking here is free (as opposed to Claremont Wilderness).  For the GRAND LOOP, you should definitely consider combining both loops for around 10 miles of really good and reliable trail.  That would be a sweet workout.  FYI - I was told that on the Claremont side, if you are caught with your dog off leash, you will get a fine, the same IS NOT true for the Marshall Canyon side. These trails are used by hikers, joggers, and bikers.', "A nice trail. It's starts off rather ugly but gets nicer. It can be a bit confusing at times since there's sort of a lot of small paths and ways to go.", "It's want of the place that we found so far. Nice down hill not too difficult.many trail to discover. Over all good place for mountain bike. We love it!", 'Love this ride when I go mountain bike riding , SUPER FUN!!!', 'Great trails just watch out for the mountain bikers', "So I think I found it, at least the parking lot, but there's like 3 trailheads to take, not sure which one is the loop, I took 2 and they didn't seem to meet up... The map start point looks different than where I was..", 'Great view. The directions on here were incorrect.', "My husband and I did this trail with our dogs.  This trail starts off with a slightly rocky downhill path and it takes you to a beautiful tree filled path.  We were lucky enough to see deer along the path. This is one of my favorite trails and it isn't very difficult.", 'Really easy hike. Nice scenery. My only concern was how the horse riders deal with all the mountain bikers.I saw hoof prints but no horses. My horse is familiar with bikes but not coming around a down hill corner. So hiking is nice and fine but I think I"ll leave the horse at home on this one.', 'This is one of my favorite places to hike! Love the streams, trees, and views.   Lots of Mtn bikers and narrow trails so make sure you step aside so they can pass. Friendly people and plenty of shade. ', 'Spider web of trails!', 'My friends and I did a Santa hat hike in Marshall canyon today. There were a lot of mountain bikers but they were all nice and were careful around us. There was a stream flowing and a few rope swings. Very shady and cool, mature beautiful trees. Lots of horse poop! ', 'My friends and I wore our Santa hats and enjoyed this hike! Not very difficult and weather was perfect! ', 'Great place to walk if you dont mind the bikers and horses. But we saw a  Big Bear on the trail on 8/25/13 so use caution and  make sure you have a plan of action.', 'Nice trail with a lot of shade, not very crowded, which is nice!', "Hiked Marshall Canyon for the first time today. Got there about 10:30am did not see a whole lot of others. Really enjoyed it Not overly aggressive and shady trails. Plan on going back with my mountain bike. The mountain bikers we did see look like they were having alot of fun. I'll report back after I run it with my bike.", 'Went to to this trail last Sunday with my wife and found this trail to be pretty amazing. First time here and so glad that we came. We used to hike @ Etiwanda Preserve in Rancho but this one is far better, lots of shades, trees, and bird watching will be very good too. We saw many different kinds of birds on our way up and down. Just pay attention to mountain bikers, they are all over the place too but very polite coz they let you know if they are coming. We went up early around 7 am and the place is not crowded at that time. Overall a good place to hike!!!', "This trail was nice. It was filled with a lot of greenery. It's shaded in most of the areas. I would say it's moderate. It's good for a jogging workout if you're going to run it, or you can go for just a nice stroll. The last mile is a little steep and would take some getting used to. :) ", "amongst the overly high traffic amount of horse back and hikers on the weekends, this is my favorite trails for the last 4 years. This trail is about 40% percent shaded with luscious tree. Toward the climb to the top, expect some sun beaming down on you. ride early on summer hot days. MTB- best time to ride is weekdays, non holidays. There's a few walls that you can ride up and get about 10-15ft high. My Santa Cruz nomad and VPfree handles this climb and descent with ease.", 'Take the fireroads up to the top and then head down the singletracks all the way down to wheeler. The best trails are actually below the map on this site, Watch out for hikers and horses.', 'Did this last year, thought I had checked in and rated it! Duh!!! Awesome hike, live the trees, water and dog friendly atmosphere. ', "Good trail. Family friendly. Dog friendly. It's a labyrinth in there. So don't go it unless you know someone who has gone or if you have GPS. The network of trails is vast!!! You can loop the trail or go in and out. It's a nice quick trail that's close to civilization but far enough away to appreciate nature. Some of the most beautiful Oaks. ", 'Great trail for mountain biking, had a good time.', "I had a blast on my bike. It was muddy, steep, challenging and fun. It's a great place for beginner mountain bikers to work on their skills but you have to be in good shape to overcome the very steep paths. Watch out for the blind turns and erosion on the paths caused by the rain. Keep in mind that you are Sharing the trail with hikers and horseback riders and there's lots of horse poop so there is a good chance you may fall on it if you wipe out. We go on the weekday mornings and it's not crowded. Enjoy", 'Nice trail, defiantly worth checking out. You have to be in somewhat good shape to do the whole trail.', 'This is my favorite trail right now. We have put together a fun mix of brutal climbs and smooth flowing single tracks to equal roughly 12 miles loop. Best to go early to beat the crowds. Be careful and courteous on the downhill so no one gets hurt!!', 'Very nice trail...beautiful views...and not at all crowded! Thumbs up!!!Just finished this trail with my hubby, daughter, son, brother in law, and sister in law. I walked most of it and ran some of it...great workout!!! :D', 'This is more a "system" of trails than a single route. There are so many variations to the classic Miller-Cobal loop that you will not ever be bored in this area. There are very challenging climbs and numerous drops in single track and full trail fashion. The main loop itself has a number of climbs and drops that will test your endurance and determination. Climbs like Tree Farm are not for the faint of heart and granny gear is nothing to be ashamed of here. Just don't stop!!!A word of caution: it is crowded most days of the week and almost impossible in the weekends, making it difficult to enjoy. It is way better on weekday afternoons, temperature permitting.There are single tracks where you need to be careful with high-speed experienced riders that enjoy the technical side of Marshall. Another warning for the horse riders that deserve all the respect and yielding necessary. Be careful with the dinosaur size doodoo samples on the entire system.Please enjoy this trails responsibly, get dirty and muddy and rejoyce in the accomplishment of the climbs and downhills. This has to be one of the best trails in SoCal.', 'Wow great bike trail, even though I must have gone during rush hour.. There were alot of hikers & Bikers as well. Made it to the top on my Cannondale Mtn Bike n the down hill was awesome , even though less than  1 miles back I pinched my tube n I got a flat... But have a thicker n better tube n ready for round 2!!!', "Started at the south entrance at orangewood. It's a very cool trail for biking. the uphill takes a bit of work, but it's well worth it because of the downhill. There's also one or two jumps if you go fast enough. Just be careful with bikes going downhill because there are quite a few blind turns.", "I went early in the morning and there was overcast for most of my hike.  I started downhill on the trail from the dirt parking lot and for the most part it was easy.  LOTS of horse droppings which means you really have to pay attention with every step.  I didn't plan out my hike, which I should have because there are so many different routes you can take.  I just winged it and walked whichever way I felt.  Beautiful, beautiful forest!  I saw deer, dogs, and horses.  The first time I saw the deer it was pure magic.  There were quite a few mountain bikers and equestrians, so you have to kind of scoot to the side when they come by, especially when going downhill as it's hard for them to stop.  I encountered poison oak a couple of times which was interesting as the plant itself looks innocuous.  The hike back up the hill to the dirt parking lot was a little tough on me as it's steep going up and the ground is uneven in a lot of places.  I had to take frequent breaks.  I definitely want to go back and explore more as I feel I didn't even crack the surface of the place.", 'Nice trail. Moderate. Great downhill with birms and small jumps plus a larger gap jump over the creek. Claremont to the bottom of Marshall is about 6-7 miles', 'This is a beautiful trail and it is so close to where we live. It would be good to have a map or a plan when you do the trail for the first time because there are so many options/routes. We will come back', 'Hiked parts of this trail today, 9/27/11, pretty neat area. Both mountain bikers and horseback riders on the trail. I will go back.', 'Did this hike today. Was a good workout. Did the Upper Marshall Canyon trail to Clairmont Wilderness Park and looped back to Marshall Canyon. Warm weather and many runners and bikers', 'Tried this hike out last Saturday had a great time.  Will go back to explore some more. ', 'I run this trail from Stephens ranch over to claremont wilderness trail then back around. It is a good trail with just enough hill to make it interesting. Once out of the canyon area it can get quite hot so bring some water if you plan on doing this trail in the afternoon.', 'I run these trails from the Stephens Ranch entrance, the Orangewood Avenue entrance and the Johnson's Pasture/Claremont Wilderness entrance.  All fantastic routes, and what I love about these trails (what's not to love..) is the solitude.  There are so many offshoots from the various fire roads and paths that you can take a different route every time and never get bored.  Deer, squirrel, occasional snakes, birds... it is all there without crowds. Be careful of the "Trails End Ranch" no trespassing section that divides the trail between a section of Miller Lateral and Marshall Canyon.  It isn't marked on google earth or mapmyhike, etc., but when you are on the trails, you see the no trespassing signs.  Unfortunately, the residents will stop you and possibly make you turn around instead of completing the 100 yards (approx) to the other section of the public trail. It is too bad, because there are some FANTASTIC trails you miss out on because they bar your access... but nonetheless, there are plenty of other trails to enjoy. 

I can't say enough about the trails here.  Some are challenging.  You will always climb and descend, regardless of your route, you will just climb/descend more on some than others.  Enjoy!', 'For this trail I jogged some of the downhill and even terrain.  This hike has many different routes to take. I actually got lost at some point put found my way back soon. This trail meets many different other trails so be careful not to stray too much. This trail is a lot of fun with great trees and stream.', 'Today marked my 4th time biking Marshall Canyon, what a workout! The trails are great and the downhill is worth the bike up!', 'We just did this trail yesterday,loved it,it was a great bike ride.we are going back next weekend:-) ', 'Awesome hike. Alot to see. We saw a group of deer running in the hills, which was awesome. I do recommend this place for sure', 'We went hiking in the Claremont Wilderness Park/Johnston Pasture all the way to Marshall Canyon immediately after the rains at the end of the year. There were several mudslides up there that had blocked the trails for ranger vehicles, but there were still people hiking.I walked right past the "Trail Closed" signs. Saw lots of footprints and bike tracks in the mud, so we weren't the first ones there. The best entrance, I think, is the one at the top of Mountain Ave. in Claremont. Just go right on the last residential road once you get to the top. The entrance is at the end of that road. The best part of the hike is when you turn left (west) instead of right after passing the bench structure near the top. It winds down back toward Marshall Canyon. There's a little picnic area tucked away under the trees with, believe it or not, a restroom called Dottie's Pottie. Well, it's actually more of an outhouse than a restroom. No running water or lights, and very, very dark and creepy with a million cobwebs. After that you can take different side trails that lead down to streams on both sides of the trail. The streams are dry during summer, but after the last rains they were rushing. Hope this helps.', "Does anyone know if Marshall Canyon Park  is open? The Claremont Wilderness Park where I usually go running has been closed since the rains and according to the Claremont city homepage until further notice. Does anyone know if that will be opening soon. Sad, because I really love this place and it's close to home.", "The trail is for multiple purposes, we saw bikers, horses, and hikers. This was our first real hiking experience, took about two or three hours. It's definitely a great exercise! The trail keeps getting steeper as you go higher, but it has a great view, and the trail is perfect for a jog back to the car.   ", 'Excellent for Mountain Biking and hiking. If you start at the bottom (Oak Mesa Elementary School) it should talk about 30-60 minutes to reach the gazebo at the top of the Claremont Hills Wilderness Park. Watch for hikers and horses.', 'Great for running. Awesome for mountain biking.  There is shade from the trees for nearly the entire length. It criss-crosses a creek the hole time and feels like you are far from LA. Id happily do it again.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Cuyamaca Peak via Azalea Glen Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'river', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky', 'snow', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Cuyamaca Peak via Azalea Glen Loop is a 7.7 mile lightly trafficked loop trail located near Descanso, California that features a river and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from May until October.
