user_texts:
['Beautiful trail', 'Great Hike and views.', 'I Actually got my hiking partner and myself lost in these mountains... 12 miles later, feet bloody we made it back.
Lol', 'Great trail with magnificent ocean view but there is no shade at all. There is $15 parking fee when you park Moro Canyon Trail as All Trail shows. Drive to Crystal Cove Trail to avoid paying fee. It’s free there.', 'Good hiking trail for a moderate workout. I was expecting nicer views but not bad.', 'Love this trail- great hills for the hikers and plenty of running trails for the runners.', 'Great work out with some challenging inclines. Watch out for mountain bikers on the narrow fence line trail portion of the hike. Bring a hat and plenty of water.', 'I saw a coyote pup and a rabbit while hiking on the trail. Beautiful views with well maintained dirt roads.  Up and down steep hills all along the way. Bring plenty of water - a great trail for running!', 'Great hiking trail with multiple hills and great views of the Pacific Ocean.  This is our go-to hike near our home in OC.', 'Beautiful and challenging', 'Is a great work out ! No shades but nice view! ! Highly recommend', 'Decent hike around Crystal Cove Park - completely unshaded. A nice way to end the hike is to go to Laguna Beach :) There are many rolling hills along the way for a good workout. I finished this in under 3 hours.', 'Great conditioning hike going up the BFI with amazing view of Newport Coast and PCH. For an extra challenge, after BFI, go down East Cross Over then up Poles :))', 'A great workout for hiking', 'This trail is not that beautiful. I mean...if it’s all you have then fine. But there is no greenery, telephone poles along the route and yes the coast is nice but it’s obstructed by peoples houses!! If you want a long hike to do and not drive far, this is a good choice. But it’s not as beautiful as it’s made out to be. I parked near the baseball field to avoid the $15 parking fee....which also is absolutely ridiculous.', 'This hike was fun and challenging if you’re a newbie like me!  The route we took did have a lot of hikes up hills and my legs were jelly by the time we were done.  The scenery, serenity and confidence boosting was all worth it!  Absolutely gorgeous to find this gem in OC!  Well worth it, don’t bring children on the long hikes and there are in fact rattlesnakes!', "at first the incline is intense but over all its a good easy trail. it's easy just a long trail.", 'A great hike! At the beginning it felt crowded but it got better the deeper you went into the park. Not as many flowers as you’d like due to dryness. I didn’t love all the mountain bikers on some trails. Not all of them were careful to warn you about them flying around the corner', 'Hiked from Ridge Park Trailhead to avoid paying $15 parking fee at Crystal Cove Visitor's Center parking lot. I completed the loop in clockwise direction and added in approximately 3 mile out and back hike on the beach via the underground tunnel under PCH. I had to take off my boots to wade through the tunnel which had 12"-18" of water in the tunnel. Did not see many wildflowers today. It is really starting to look dried out since there was so little rain this winter. An enjoyable hike. Not a lot of people or bikes on the trail but it was a weekday.', 'Intense but super fun! Best one in OC so far.', 'Man was this a work out. We chose to counter-clockwise and ascend the BFI. That was a challenge, but once we got past that it was a relatively moderate hike. Unfortunately, we didn’t get much rain this winter, so it was a little on the dry side, but the wild flowers were blooming, and the rest of the scenery was still nice (can’t beat those views of the coast). We did encounter a rattlesnake on fence-line trail, but it never got close enough to be a threat. Would definitely do again, preferably after it rains', 'great hike right next the coast.', 'This was a great hike today especially after the rain.. If your looking to get a great workout in with some strenuous hills and open trails then this is the one to do.  I actually used Strava to range the hike and it came out to to just over 9.5 miles.  If you do the whole loop like I did then you will be very satisfied with it especially when the day is nice and it makes for great pictures when your along the PCH ridges.. El Moro Loop has some great views that overlook the ocean and you get some fresh air for sure.. The trail was very quite and peaceful, so if your looking to get away and decompress then this would be ideal.  I will definitely do this trail again and maybe get a trail run the next time around!', 'So beautiful! Surprisingly steep areas, it takes a little practice not getting deviated on the paths. The map feature is priceless!', 'Great trail! It was a good cool day. Make sure you have plenty of water and some light snacks if you do the whole loop', 'Views were gorgeous on this trail offering a sense of escape from the city life.  Aside from this trail being a longer trail, I’m not sure how it’s ranked as hard.  Trail was well paved and flat for the most part. Would definitely go back and run the loop next time.', 'We had a great day with not a cloud in the sky to hike the perimeter loop. It wasn’t too strenuous. Great views out to Catalina once got to higher altitude. Trail is extremely well marked. Lots of mountain bikers and a few runners on the trail.', 'Parking at the coastal peak park is free...(Ridge Park road )', 'Be sure to take rattlesnake trail.', "I have done this look a couple of times.  I mainly went with full gear to train for the Trans Catalina trail.  Of the three campgrounds, I will only stay at one, the Lower Morro.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is super busy.  There are constant people and bikes; when I hike, I prefer a little more quiet.  The location is beautiful though.", "This was definitely a good trail to experience. The level of difficulty should not be underestimated, however, I feel the challenge aspect depends on which trail you plan on hiking. They offer a map with the level of difficulty for the trail based on how long of a hike you plan on attempting. My friends and I chose the most difficult one and it was definitely 10 miles. We enjoyed the different change of scenery throughout the hike and being close to the beach kept a nice breeze on us for the day. It's a great trail!", "Finished this one earlier today. I didn't have time to do the whole perimeter but there are several options to shorten the hike if necessary.  It was hot and there's really no shade so be prepared for that. Also be prepared for quick steep climbs followed by long flat stretches. I recommend finishing the hike with a walk along the beach... Especially on a hot day. I wish I brought my bathing suit and a towel because the water looked very welcoming after sweating all day.", "Note to self: Come earlier, before the heat. Bring more water, electrolytes. If you are not an avid hiker in moderate shape plan on spending over 3 hours on this trail. (9.3 miles). It's also a really fun way to get in shape while enjoying the outdoors. Once you're down the hill consider heading over to the beach since you're right across the street. Lastly, for me it was a challenging trail which I really enjoyed and I'm looking forward to returning soon. Happy Hiking!", 'Beautiful place, perfect for enjoying glorious sunsets.', "one of my favorites. so easy, do this then go to the beach, then Afters for ice cream. it'll be the best day.", 'This hike is one of the most difficult in all of the state park. I recommend starting early in the morning to get a head start. It has some of the best views of the SoCal coastline and of the canyon. There are some strenuous up hills in this hike so I do not recommend this hike if it is your first time at crystal cove or if your not an active backpacker.', "One of thinnest trails I've been on. Very rewarding but also very challenging parts.", 'Great', 'awesome and hard', 'a good hike for conditioning. has some views over looking the shore through out.', "Crystal Cove perimeter loop is a great, moderate to difficult hike in the beautiful Crystal Cove State Park. The trail is well marked and there are quite a few people hiking and biking here, especially on weekends. On a clear day, you'll be rewarded with beautiful view of the ocean. Be careful of mountain bikers going down. Beware of snakes. I saw a little one crossing the trail.", 'great hike and very well trailed. there are places that lead to other trails but there are signs. We did almost 11 milesbeautiful views of the oceon and Catalina island.  very steep in some areas', 'Great inclines. Beautiful views as you get close to ocean. Restrooms along the way and very clean. Parts of it go flat for a long time. Next time I want to try one of the more challenging trails.', 'A good hike if your looking for hills', "Great hike if you're practicing with long distances!", 'Gorgeous trail! The weather was breezy, around 67 degrees. I have an off tan now but definitely worth the run. Locals were very friendly! I will be back soon', 'It can sometimes be confusing to keep track of which trail you're on (even tho there are many maps) as there are a lot of trail forks and different route options. starts out with a big incline and then plateaus for a long time before steep decline. Decent bathroom available at info center. $15 parking fee. We enjoyed the trail in early April and the wild mustard was incredible. As tall as mature corn stalks! Oh. This trail should NOT be rated "difficult."', "Fantastic trail with sittings of beautiful flowers, wildlife, friendly hikers, and an amazing sunset view at the end!! I'd take this hike any day!!", 'Lots of greenery and flowers in bloom. Amazing vistas and not too crowded on the weekdays.', 'Great uphill hike! Very nice view of the ocean and other trails. Took about 3hrs to hike 9.8miles. $15/day to park or $5/hr. Very little shade so be prepared.', "Awesome hike. Plenty of uphill, but there is plenty of flat parts as well. Wear sunscreen, a hat and bring plenty of water.  Great views, and it's nice to end at the beach!!!", 'It was amazing', "Love this trail!  Very long with great views and a great workout!  It offers areas to camp and so many beautiful scenic views.  Can't wait to go again!", 'way to easy your basically paying $15 to park and walk on a hard pack firebreak road', 'Good free app.', 'Got lost. Started at Costal Peak Park and tried to do the loop. Stayed on Bonner Ridge trail and missed the turn to Crystal Cove. Wound up at Laguna and had to walk 3 miles on PCH. There were some parts of PCH that had little to no sidewalk so it was dangerous.', "My first hike in the US ! Started early on a cloudy morning from parking lot and hiked back to beach. It's beautiful", "One of my favorite trails to hike. Definitely a heart pumping workout, if you're making the big 9 mile loop. Make sure to bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Depending on which way you start the views overlooking the Ocean shoreline is incredibly breathtaking. The beach access at the end is pretty much the cherry on top. Happy Trails!", 'Definitely some steep stretches along the way, but I started at the top by Ridge Park Rd (free to park up there as opposed to the $15 parking at the state park) and reaching the ocean view at the south end of the trail was so rewarding! I would definitely recommend bringing a hat and lots of water; I hiked this in the early afternoon and there was no shade to be found on the trail.', "great hike make sure to bring water. It's  $15 to park make sure you pay the signs are NOT clearly posted", 'I hike here regularly. To save money, park on the road at the end of Ridge Park at the top, plenty of room.
Only problem is, the finish is uphill.
There are a couple of bathrooms marked on the trail and large blocks at the top and bottom.
There are many steep pitches but nothing too long.', 'Solid hike with views of the Pacific Ocean and, on a clear day, Santa Catalina island.', 'Bring water, the view is awesome', 'A very groomed trail with little surprises. Few hills and shade.', 'This is my favorite trail. It can be as hard or easy as u want it to be. I like doing the whole loop. Bring plenty of water and plan on 3-3.5 hrs.', 'Challenging uphills and downhills.. The beach was beautiful!!', "Walk the rim going clockwise all the way out past the Eagle Scout gates. Give yourself a couple hours at least to hit the elevator down at end of the long hike for a truly amazing sunset. Trails are wide and have lots of traffic so it's all about the view!", 'Ended at 11 miles rattlesnake tail was the best part! Lots of sunscreen!', 'very good', 'Awesome! beautiful scenery', 'lots of trails, so you can change the distance, time and workout/hike. fun wide truck size trails, ocean breezes. $15 dollar parking. no shade on trails, but great views.', "We hike for almost 10 miles, my suggestion, start early on your hike there's no shady trail, bring lots of water. The view was amazing on the top, but the trail is confusing there's no name of the trails, so keep your GPS handy.", "The first mile is a steady incline and then it goes up and down which is difficult. However, when you need to stop and catch your breath you're surrounded by beautiful landscape.", 'Great weather', 'First time here. Did the loop 9.5 miles. I like the trail not to many people. Overcast at the beach so no view of the ocean but it was ok cause it was hot. Well maintained. Enjoyed it and most every one was nice.', 'Good for a leisure hike, pretty view', "Amazing. Not too crowded, it's big and spaced out. And there are a lot of mountain bikers. I was walking this time though. But I will bring my bike next time. Great ocean views", 'Pretty landscape, and not-surprising b/c its Orange County lots of visible housing developments along the perimeter. There are a few stretches with shade but that makes up', 'Some track housing visible but the sweeping ocean views make up for it. Really beautiful coastal hike. Will definitely be back and will make sure to plan to stay at one of the hike-in campgrounds.', 'It was nice at the end. To many housing developments visible.', "Not bad.  Very little shade so be ready for the sun.  Views are ok but nothing special.  I thought the best part was on the return, through the canyon.  Nice shady, peaceful.
It's interesting that they have all of those points of interest on the map.  But ultimately it's a crop of rocks sticking out from a mountain that are millions of years old.  And a couple of areas where there were rock slides.
As the other hiker said, it's a little depressing that for the most part, you can see huge track housing.  Always a bummer.", 'A very uninteresting trail. Never out of sight of houses.', 'Somewhat of a boring hike. The best part is walking out to the ocean at the end.', 'Loved the trail! Very well maintained and well signed.   Great trail to work as hard or as little as you want-  we backpacked loop clockwise and camped at lower Moro campground.  Amazing view, perfect sunset made for a great trip!  Bring lots of water, not much shade on trail- campground had little to no shade.', "My husband and I started from Shady Canyon in Irvine to add 6+ miles rt. it was sketchy finding the trail from there (Ridge Trail was closed so we followed Bommer Pass to West Ridge to Bommer Ridge (walk under the 73 Tollroad to Ridge Park to trailhead). From there, Bommer Ridge Trailhead is well marked, but NONE of the trail markers match the map so we totally missed any turnoff for Morro Ridge (came across another hiker with the same issue) so we ended up following Bommer Ridge to its end, somewhere around the Laguna Bowl turnoff. We still got a good 17 mile hike, but not the hike we'd hoped for. Hikers beware...the trail markers will confuse you!", 'Ah, yes, hiking with young scouts. So.......lots of breaks and general standing around. Nonetheless, this was a pleasant if a bit dull hike. Do not count on any shade though and, if sensitive to the sun, avoid during summer. Lots of water and watch out for the mountain bikers. This is one of their faves.', 'Fun and good exercise. It can get hot so bring water if your going to be out for a while.', "It's a relaxing ocean view trail.  Trail loops vary from 3 miles to about 10 miles.  Enjoyable.", 'This place is ok to go hiking but better for mountain bike riding. Park for free at north west side of crystal cove. The street is called "ridge park road". Google maps your way there using "Newport coast drive" and "ridge park road".  I rode "boomer ridge trail" off of that parking spot into "boat road" and into the streets and went back up "no name ridge". You'll find a very nice peak near end of "boat road" looking over the beautiful city of Laguna beach. Take plenty of water and Gatorade. It's a sunny trail. People are friendly and generous unlike other trails.', "Really great workout  did the 9.2 mile loop. Bring lots of water, sunscreen and hat. There is no shade. One big suggestion of you are going to be doing this loop whether you are starting by the ocean or the ridge....travel this loop clockwise. The whole right side of the loop can be a bit unforgiving on the uphill action.   I learned the hard way and I'm in pretty good hiking shape.", "Enjoyed the hike. 85% of the trail is wide enough for big groups, hikers, bikers and horses (although we didn't see any other than their left behind remnants). We did the entire loop including the side loop up through the residential housing. All around a beautiful hike, at some parts a bit steep, but all in all and great hike. Would never do it in the summer as there is no shade.  Pay attention to the trail signs posted all over. We ended up at the beach/camp ground when we should've ended up at the ranger station.  Bummer because by that time, we were done!  Take lots of water!!!", 'Used to live out here and went to jog/walk and just enjoy the beauty of this park. Definitely worth the visit. Will be going again when I visit friends out there this spring.', 'Great views of the Ocean and trail provides opportunity for a real fast pace work out as well.', 'Hike is easy-moderate depending on fitness level.  Maps throughout the hike. Parking is $15.00. Lots of bikes, so be careful.', 'A good workout. You can make it as short as you want or really long. Lots of trails to choose from. Rattlesnake is the best trail but narrow and bikes fly right by. Bring water.', "A really nice little trail. The bikers do fly by and keep an eye out for a baby rattler.  Make sure to bring water this trail isn't very shady. Outside of that this is a lot of fun, beautiful views, variety of terrain that'll really work you out.", 'its a great hike beautiful place nice views and afterwards you can go down to the beach for a swim.', "The hike itself is not my favorite, it's not exactly beautiful or shady, but once you get through the BFI and to the point where you can camp, it's wondrous to sit back and enjoy the view and smell of the ocean as the sun sets; and to wake up to in the morning. Good for the family too, it was nice to have a day on the beach. One thing to remember: this campsite doesn't have potable water and does not allow for campfires and everything is pack in pack out. There is a huge incline to get to the incline so be careful what you bring, you will be carrying it up a huge incline and there is no water up there.", "If you park up by the nature center, you have to pay $15, found that out the hard way. The trail was nice, but watch out for bicyclists, they fly around that place. It was a scenic loop with beautiful views of the ocean and islands. But, be carefule the map that they give you is pretty bad, and there is nothing on it to tell you that it connects to another trail at another park, also found that out the hard way. Other than that, I'd definitely recommend this hike, it's good.", 'Parking is free if you park at Ridge Park Road at the north-west entrance of Crystal cove around Coastal Peak Park Newport Coast Newport Beach, CA 92657
Coordinates: 33.605764, -117.801822. 
Road Intersections: Ridge Park Rd -  E Coastal Peak,
There is street parking and is not hard to find a spot.', 'Nicely labeled loop/trails. Quite busy with lots of people biking and hiking. Only downside, pay $15 for parking. Beautiful view of the coast and Catalina Island is visible on a clear day.', "We did the 9.5 mile loop...bommer ridge to gate 12, then down to cut across trail, up rattlesnake and then back to bommer ridge. If you like hiking on fire roads, you'll love this place.  The only single track on our loop was rattlesnake and it was awesome!  Overall, it was nice and a good gettaway, i'm just not a huge fan of fire roads.", "So I didn't go around the while the loop because my son wasn't up for it.  However I started at the beginning of the trail and followed the 73 freeway as the map shows and we went all the way down and ended at the El Morro Elementary School.  I tracked that I went 7 miles so to be quite honest I don't know how the whole circle could be 10 miles, but being I didn't do the whole thing I can't say. I found it a nice hike. 
Mostly the road is even and compacted dirt. There are areas where it is rather uneven. Few hills this way. I imagine there are a lot up hills on the way back.  I did once of down the other side of the trail (from the starting point rather following the 73, I went right and followed the trail by houses) I walked 3 miles down and turned around.  There were several tough hills on that side both going out toward the ocean and coming back. Not lots but several. My 9 year old could do this, but was complaining after half way, not a lot, but it was clear he was getting tired. I think I pushed it a little going the whole 7 miles with him, but he did good. 
I enjoyed this, but the hills can get to you, I wouldn't suggest doing this as a beginner. This map is very helpful, as the trails were not well marked. I found using the GPS in the iPhone app while following this map made it really easy to follow the correct path.", "Love this hike! You can choose from many different routes and lengths so that makes it nice :) very beautiful! And there's also camp sites you can stay at", "The trail is fairly easy to hike and whenever you go, you'll always see the locals jogging, walking or biking. It's not crowded despite being located right next to a suburban neighborhood but there's always going to be people who will greet you with a friendly hello. Watch out for bikers, especially since it's Newport Beach, but they're always polite. Like the others say, it's an urban oasis but to me, it's only if you hike on the trails that have a view of the neighborhood or the freeway. So if you're looking for an adventure into a foresty area, try going to other trails that lead deeper into the canyons.", 'The wildlife and views of the ocean were lovely and hiking down to the beach in the morning was a real treat.. Its very much an urban oasis in that you are constantly aware of the highways or condos in the distance. I like my wilderness a bit more rugged.

Also dealt with some condescending rangers who doubted my friend's and my ability to camp in the "primitive" campgrounds (us being fragile ladies); the same campgrounds I had three bars of reception in the entire time. I could have done without that.', 'Good view of the ocean and hills. Its an oasis in the middle of civilization. ', 'Great trail with beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean. Trail was very well maintained with good signage.

Apparently all of the trails are shared with mountain bikers, most of whom are pretty rude, not looking ahead of what they're doing, and who all expect hikers to get out of their way, even on the slim, 1-person-width trails. If you want a pleasant hike, I'd go somewhere else where mountain biking is regulated. I spent most of the time listening for the sound of bicyclists and getting out of the way, rarely ever getting an "excuse me", "sorry", or "thank you."', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Malibu Lake Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'fishing', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'rock climbing', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'lake', 'partially paved', 'river', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Malibu Lake Trail is a 6.6 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Calabasas, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Horses are also able to use this trail.

user_texts:
['Clear trail to follow. Pretty flat mellow hike. Some shade. Arrive early if you like less traffic on trail. Several mountain bikes and trail runners. First time here so I’m not sure how it was before the fires. This was still a very scenic hike and will only get better as the area recovers. MASH set survived.', 'This area was so much fun to hike! Although the recent fires have torched a lot of the greenery, there were lots of great spots for rock climbing and going off of the main trails, a nice river and cool rock formations. I’m a new hiker with an athletic background and this Trail was generally easy :) Lots it open space, I imagine it gets pretty hot during the summer. I got here around 8 am and left around 12 pm.', "What a great hike that has all kinds of layers and adventures to it. I did the lower east loop that goes through a bunch of epic rock formations (great for rocking climbers), the former set of hit TV show M.A.S.H, and ends with the rock pool where people gather to swim and jump off mini cliffs in the wilderness. I could only imagine how this park looks when there is actually water in the Malibu creek, it was all dried up pretty much when I went except for the rock pool area.

Most of the trail is wide and flat for the most part making it very doable yet still a great workout since it's about 6-7 miles long (roundtrip).

- @justroc @just.trek", 'just loved it! was perfect for walk and jog and sights were wonderful to see!', 'Beautiful easy hike. Loved the MASH set.', 'love this place', 'Great hike for a Saturday! There is potential to make this hike up to 10+ miles. It was neat to see the old MASH filming site. Nice change of scenery throughout the hike. The earlier you go, the less people. The trail starts getting busy around 8:30. Highly recommended!', 'Great moderate hike for the whole family. Always nice to see the original M*A*S*H Site.', 'Like everyone else said, this hike has some pretty scenary but the end is a huge disappointment. I guess I should have read the reviews more carefully but you really just end up at a gate at the precipice of Malibu lake... So close, yet so far. Wish it would have ended up at the lake so I could check it out.I would rate this as really easy. Mostly flat with one part that has a 10 minute incline you have to hike.One way took me about an hour.', 'beautiful trail!', 'Great trail very quite and serene.', 'very nice trail, beautiful and peaceful.  highly recommended place to spend time with family, hike or simply clear your mind from the crowd of the city without being far away from it.', 'Absolutely gorgeous! Great hike.', 'Love the creek and openness of trail, where there early enough to enjoy the trail in peace and quietness.  Also parked outside the parking lot and save $$$', 'Easy', 'For my second hike it was easy enough for both me and my husky(on leash). We got to see the lake and made the full circle back to the entrance. That last hill to the main street gets you heart going right at the end. There was a good amount  of people for the time we went (nice people) and some people on bikes. Be mindful of the horse droppings as they are all over the trials.', '', 'Beautiful and easy trails. But we were disappointed that we couldn’t get to Malibu Lake at the end.. you can’t even see the lake and you can’t access it. Bummer! Along the whole trail there are many spots where you can smell the sewer. So much for a walk in nature with good smells.. the MASH site is pretty cool. Worth the effort. We still enjoyed it after all and will do it again.', 'The kids and I love hiking here!', "Parking is 12 dollars. Some people park on Mulholland Dr and walk in to avoid the fee. This trail scales closer to easy. There's no dramatic inclines or excessive rough terrain. Family friendly! Pretty straight forward with on and off shading. Century Lake was my favorite point of interest. The 50 ft dam can be accessed with some easy trespassing, but there's no safe way to get to the base of the dam.The set of M*A*S*H is half way through the hike.Unfortunately the ending is rather lackluster as you are dropped off on the tip of Malibu Lake which is gated off completely. No point to the end other than to reach it.", 'Cool hike. Starts off pretty easy, and then gets a little more fun. We took our 5 and 7 year olds, and they enjoyed it, too. I love MASH, so that was fun for me and the rest of the family.', "I'm going camping there soon so I'll see if I like it.", 'Loved the hike and will go again for sure', 'Closed today.', 'Hiked this trail yesterday. Loved it. Will do it again.', 'Beautiful - I did it once before and it was totally manageable. But I was there last week post rain storms and a majority of it was impassable due to the water.', 'If anyone went to this trail today (2/25) can you please post an update on the condition of the trails

Thanks', "Malibu State CreekSo we attempted to Hike the M.A.S.H site at Malibu Creek State Park but with the storm we had it completely washed out the trail. So we were unable to access it. The Trail leading up to the bridge is a puddle. Just to cross the bridge you had to go over several fallen trees. To cross to the other side of the bridge you have to cross a steam knee high and along the rest of the way you will have to walk through water. We went as far as the caves that are on the left of the trail and couldn't go any further unless we were willing to walk through waist deep in water.We did get to visit the Dam and explore other areas of the park. It's definitely one of those places you can go back to and hike several trails. We got there before it opened, so we just bought our parking pass through the parking machine which is $12. If you want to avoid the cost, you can park on Mulholland and walk in. I also bought the park map on the way out, which was $2. So next time I return we can explore new trails.", 'The whole park is gorgeous. This is a relatively mellow hike with lots of photogenic scenery.', 'A nice local hike and not too tough for the kids. Beautiful scenery and the creek seems to have more water that normal given the recents rains. A very nice family hike.', 'Beautiful scenery', 'Great park to explore.  It costs $12 for a day pass and extra for a park map.  I came on a Saturday late morning and hiked by myself.  The park and trails were moderately populated - just enough to make you feel safe, but not crowded.  The trails were pretty well marked.  I explored all around - to the M.A.S.H. Set, century lake, rock pools and Reagan ranch.  I was able to do this in less than 3 hours as I mixed hiking with some trail rubbing.  The hike is pretty moderate, though there is some good terrain to do hill sprints.  Also good hike to do as a group as the trails are pretty wide.  Also saw a handful of mountain bikers.', "Easy long hike with a very nice view all through out.. MASH site is there too.. mostly shades and there's a lot of dears and blue birds.. creek is a little dried up right now.. but all in all i was satisfied with the hike", "I haven't been here since the big drought, so it was a real disappointment to see so many shades of death along the trail.  It appeared that all the trees were dry and bare, the riparian landscape was muted and bleak.  It's not the place I remembered, but the hike was easy and light.  The MASH film site was in good order!  I would warn you that the hike is a bit anticlimactic as it dead ends at a chain link fence without a view of the Malibu dam.  As far as wildlife goes, we saw a few turtles in the stagnant ponds along the creek, but few other signs of life.  If you're coming expecting the same old Malibu Creek, I would suggest waiting until Spring.", "There is a small creek resivoir which is accessible but the Malibu lake is actually a closed private community so you can't even get there and they fail to mention that. After 3 miles of hiking we found out that we can't even get there.", 'Great trail', 'I like this hiking trail , but the lake water was not clean!', "It's a nice place to go hike", 'It was ok,  we were going to the Mash site and actually got a bit bored, but it was a long 6 miles hike, there is one hill that was a bit much but everything else is flat, the water is there but kind of stagnant.  But it was a good Sunday afternoon', 'Great trail! Not so far from Malibu beach. Good for pets.', 'This hike can be as long or short as well as easy or hard. A great hike from beginning to end, we hike to the mash site and pass on down to the dam and then when we hike back we hike century dam trail which is really awesome with shade from the trees and the lake which usually has ducks and sometimes turtles.  One of my favorites :-)', 'Another fun trail like heading up Mush trail.', "I have approached Crags Rd from both the Grasslands Trail and Cistern Trail.  It's a very nice road for hiking.  At this point I'd say the MASH site is the best feature along the trail but then I'm of an age that I watched the original broadcasts of MASH.  I haven't been in the Visitor's Center for over a decade but at that time it was a worthwhile stop and may still be.  The easier approach is the Grasslands Trail.  The Cistern/Lookout Trail has really great views but hiking out is taxing.  It isn't that it climbs that much, about 450 ft, it just does it over a very short distance.  When you encounter steps on a trail you know there's a significant grade.  If you can leave a car at the Grasslands Trailhead and take another car to the Cistern Trailhead, you could walk down the scenic Cistern/Lookout Trails and exit the easier Grasslands Trail. Its about a 4.5 mile hike if you enter by the Cistern Trail, go to the MASH site, backtrack to the Visitors Center, and then exit the Grasslands Trail.", 'I loved that this was a long hike. Going through the State Park Main Entrance requires a parking fee of $12. We opted to park on the street and walked an extra 15 minutes, but that is the whole point of hiking during weekends.We saw the Mash Site. There were a lot of friendly trail bikers and trail runners. There are a few trails to explore. Almost every site is photo worthy. We saw some dogs both leashed and unleashed. A few hikers had toddlers on their backs. I can definitely go back here!', 'beautiful trail, the MASH site was very cool. lots of shade, so a good choice  on a hot summer day.', 'Mostly an easy trail, it gets very crowded in the weekends.', "this spot is wicked mellow...with the exception of the rock garden. On the way to the MASH site, there are a couple different routes to take on the rock garden. One of them is pretty technical, and if your not on point it will not let you ride, the other spot is slightly easier, but you better have some fundamentals down before you just try to ride in there. I did some rock hopping to make it work...but if your cool with that than it's wicked fun.", "Today was the first time I've come here. I liked it a lot. The rock pool is awesome and I had a fun day cliff diving with my sister. For sure coming back.", 'Love the changing scenery. Hike is easy and fun.', 'The trail is perfect for newbies bikers (as me and my wife) some challenging up and down hills.For hiking is great as well.We will do it again!!!', 'Easy walk...can get brutally hot during summer months.', 'Best time to go is in the morning. It can get brutally during summer months.', "This is such a beautiful park. It's an easy walk with the family. The lake does get pretty crowded but everyone is nice and tries to make room for you.", 'Nice easy walk with the kids. This is such a beautiful park with beautiful scenery.', 'Easy walk with the kids.', "It was a nice easy walk.   I went on 4th of July. The lake got crowed by 10am.  I'm into more challenging trails but I don't regret going to this one.", 'loved the lake and was surprised to see rock climbers. great views and open space.', "This is such a beautiful park, it's great for hiking, mountain biking is limited, unless you like to carry your bike a lot. It can get a little crowded, especially on the weekend.", "lots of land ..there's lots trails to choose from at easy, moderate and difficult levels. it does get a bit busy but the size of the open area makes feel like very little traffic.  parking is $12 but there's also free parking along the street side.", 'Awesome hike with friends! MASH site was super fun to see!', 'Pretty, not hilly, and took a little less than 3 hours.  Definitel6 glad I did it!', 'Beautiful area. Love the MASH site. Will be back someday soon. :)', "Pretty good trail. Make sure you take the side trail to Century Dam (the Forest Trail). The best of the scenery is close to the trailhead--thus crowded with a lot of people who aren't serious hikers. A crowd reminiscent of Eaton Canyon. The MASH set is not particularly interesting if you're not a fan of the show. The area between Century Lake and the Rock Pool looks very interesting but we did not have time to explore. ", 'Gorgeous! Too crowded for my liking was the only downfall.', 'Great place. Love it! Easy, chill and most certainly a very friendly staff. ', 'When I went hiking here in the summer I did have to pay a $12.00 fee before entering the park per car.  This could have been because of the 4th of July weekend. Such a great trail. I went off the trail and did some bouldering which was fun!   ', 'A very nice hike through foothills, grassy areas, like-side trails and the filming location of M.A.S.H.  The hike on the everytrail Guide involves three spur trails, none of which are marked on the trails themselves.  So, it's useful to have a map of Malibu Creek Park trails, or download the Guide to your phone.  The main trail is "Crags Road."  The trail head is across the street from the parking lot.  It begins as a paved road and becomes a dirt road, a shaded trail, then small a dirt road from the MASH set to Malibu Lake.  The Rock Pool spur trail, which is approximately 1 from trail head, provides some opportunities for rock climbing, as well as the very nice swimming hole at the end of the spur trail.  The swimming hole can become quite crowded by the afternoon during the summer.

I track the trail and the distance tracked was 10.0 miles.  I did take one spur trail not included on the Guide, which added approximately .5 miles total.  The Guide gives a distance 7.9 miles, but my best guess is that the distance is closer to 9.0 miles.  That said, it's an easy hike without much elevation change.  My tracking of the trail is here: http://www.everytrail.com/view_trip.php?trip_id=2181465', 'Very nice trail a little bit difficult to get to the mash set lot of rocks for your bike lots if hidden path in to the greens highly recommend', 'Nice place!  We went a saturday for a walk on the mountain, and loved it so we went back on sunday too to get wet at the pawn!', 'Loved it! Easy trail,  good for families.', 'Such a beautiful hike. The mixture of scenery is amazing! The trail is well kept and is by no means grueling at any point. Lots of shade providing great areas for picnics and bear naps. Highly recommend for anyone', 'There were a lot of bees near the creek where people go swimming and jump off the rocks. other then that it was a great short hike', 'Is their any camps  to spend the night (backpacking)', "If you're looking for a non-strenuous and a  well maintained trail this is the one. Trail features various options other than hiking, such as rock climbing, fishing, and even sites to check out. ", 'love malibu creek', 'This was the most relaxing place, but yet refreshing as well. This is a family friendly place, awesome to swim or rock climb. Highly recommended.', 'Nice Trail, not to strenuous
Pretty and great shade at parts', "Nice views but was not able to enter because they don't allow dogs on the trails.", 'Very beautiful scenic trail. One technical area right before the MASH set.', 'Dirty water and dirty crowds. Go in Spring', "Hiked Craigs trail to MASH site.  The good part is that Craigs provides a lot of trailheads you can take.  Originally, my hiking buddy and I wanted to go to Reagan but missed the connecting trail.  I suggest that you stop by the visitors center and get a map.  MASH site was cool and touristy because that's where the outdoor scenes were shot for the show MASH.  We went on a Sunday morning from 9ish to 11ish.  There were a lot of mountain bikers. And, as we were leaving a lot of families were coming in with rafts (I don't know why they wanted to go in that water...eck).  I would definitely like to go back and check out the other side trails and the peak that we couldn't find.", 'Nice trail, the trail its self is a fire road with a creek on the left and grassy hill to your right. The trail its self will lead you by the century lake & malibu Lake, a few note if you take a side trail it will lead you to the rock pools, also if you do not wish to pay to enter the park you can park on Mulholand hwy and take grasslands trail in', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Loch Leven Lakes Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'backpacking', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'snowshoeing', 'trail running', 'forest', 'lake', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'over grown', 'rocky', 'snow']
hike_description: Loch Leven Lakes Trail is a 8.1 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Norden, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from May until October. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
