user_texts: ['Short loop around the area. Boulders to climb and play on. Very quick with informative placards. Good for families.', 'Great little loop with the whole family. Lots of fun boulders to climb and idyllic picture spots. Really cold and crowded day yesterday. Had to park a half mile away in a pullout because the parking lots nearby were all full.', 'Good intro to the park and some easy bouldering for nice vistas.  Don’t choose this if you want to avoid the crowds.', 'Easy and beautiful.  No water necessary here because it’s so short.  Nice places for easy rock climbing.', "Extremely popular hike but for good reason.  This trail is easy and has a little bit of everything JTNP has to offer.  The interesting boulder formations and wide variety of plant life are not only pleasant to look at but thanks to the many educational plaques along the path, you can learn about what you're looking at too.  There are no elevated viewpoints unless you are willing to scramble to the top of the rocks, which we saw many people doing, even in jeans and without ideal footwear.", 'For a short hike, this one offers a lot of value.  1.  Rock Hopping and Bouldering is available for hours. 2.  Great diversity of desert plants to see.  3.  Photography opportunities abound from sunrise to Noon to sunset to overnight,  the way the sun can play off the numerous boulders, rock walls,  and trees is awesome.  We came early morning in December, temperatures in the upper 30s and very peaceful, I believe my group of 3 had the entire valley to ourselves for the first 1.5 hours.  The nature trail winds around and you do need to look for the signs or plant icons along the way to stay on the official trail.', 'Great, easy hike. If you’re limited on time and want to get a sampling of the best of Joshua Tree, this is the hike you’ll want to do. Lots of boulder piles, cacti, Joshua trees, wildlife and more. Super scenic, and if want a bit of adventure you can climb and scramble over the boulders. The trail is well-marked and easy to follow. Excellent for newbie hikers or families with kids. You’ll also see many rock climbers and boulderers in the area.', 'Very easy “walk in the park” type of trail that was absolutely breath taking! A must see while in Joshua Tree!', 'Easy hike to get started.', 'Rewarding and easy one mile hike with lots of different plants. Good signage, though the busy nature of it means that people are all over the place.', 'Many rocks to climb on and beautiful views from the top of them!', 'An easy going trail in the rocks', 'Amazing expansive valley hidden behind the rocks. Knowing that it was created by destroying the rocks and making the passage makes it accessible for trail hikers and also explains how it was hidden for so long. Again. Good opportunity for rock climbers on the way', 'best one mile hike in the world', 'Excellent way to start the day!  Love the terrain.', 'Pretty but VERY crowded', 'Fun little loop, saw some tarantulas!', 'Had a blast on this trail even though was 1 mile it was a little difficult as far as directions. you just have to stay on the pass and trust your judgment and you should be fine', 'Don’t know what we did wrong, but on this seemingly simple loop we got quite twisted, frustrated, and confused.  Gorgeous views and nice signage (for the first half of the trail).  Had a blast on the rocks.', 'Beautiful and easy hike. Divers vegetations.', 'Beautiful easy hike in a valley full of rocks to be climbed!', "A rock scrambler's dream! So many rocks to climb along the entire loop...a ton of fun! The loop itself is not that amazing...pretty, but you follow a short path. Get off the trail and enjoy this wonderland.", 'This is truly a gorgeous area. We came here for sunset over Memorial Day weekend, not planning to walk this trail, but we hiked it in the dark and it was still awesome. This is a great spot to see the moon rise. I’ll have to come back in the daytime. :)', 'This was a very fun, scenic trail. Many great views, rock climbing, and very active during the weekend.', 'Cute small walk', 'The rocks on this trail are interesting. It took us less than one hour.', 'quick and easy,  beautiful vegetation to look at.', 'Stunning views, a bit crowded, but worth it.', 'Beautiful and great as an intro to Joshua Tree hike.', 'A loop in and around the exposed granite of Joshua Tree. Minimal scrambling, somewhat crowded.', 'Easy. Fun for the kids ages 6-12. They loved scrambling up the boulders and the interesting scenery.', '', "Probably the best short trail I've ever encountered. Especially off-season when it offers both solitude and amazing views!", 'Beautiful and great for the kids.', 'Great short hike and so fun! Rocks are amazing!', 'Really fun little loop, my daughters loved the lizards and rocks to climb!', 'A fun little loop amongst the rocks and various vegetation of Joshua Tree. The trail is pretty short and easy, and has a lot of opportunities for exploration amongst the rocks. The history of the valley is pretty cool so take the time to read the informational signs.Definitely more “touristy” due to the short length and ease of the hike, but still fun to see.', 'Fun little loop with lots of rocks to scramble onto and over if you please! Would be a great place to take kids', 'Easy fun loop trail. Fun sights to see and very accessible.', 'This trail was easy, no real elevation gains and was one of the more scenic areas. You are surrounding by rocks on all side once you enter. We were hear at dusk so the light made the experience all the better.', 'Beautiful but overrrun. This trail offers Joshua Tree NP in a box...with nice rock formations, joshua trees and other desert fauna, and some history.', "Short 1 mile hike. Gives a real feel for the park. Breathtaking rock formations and all kinds of desert plants. The trail is marked very well and has signs explaining what you're seeing.", 'A great first intro hike to Joshua Tree! Very easy but with lots of great things to see. Takes less than an hour.', 'Gorgeous rock formations and desert scrub. If you are at Joshua Tree for the first time this is a must visit.', 'This review is for the Chasm of Doom within hidden valley. Two people that had done this scramble through the rocks led our group. Several times occurred when foothold coaching was necessary, or there was complete darkness, or you had to lie flat and shimmy through narrow spaces. At one point, you come to a sort of window in the side of a mountain with big rock ledges where you can sit in the sun, take in the views and see activity in the parking area below you. I got pretty bruised up from this scramble but it was super fun.', 'Fun to climb around on the rocks!!', 'Easy nature walk on a cool day. Interesting rock formations.', 'Wonderful view!! Must go!!', 'Beautiful trail. One of our favorite. Arrive early since it can be very popular.', "Easy trail, great for families. Beautiful but busy the week between Christmas and New Year's. Plenty of shade in the afternoon.", 'Christmas Eve stroll. Super easy and fairly crowded.', "This was one of my favorite hikes of my day in Joshua Tree. It's only a mile but the scenery and giant rock formations are incredible.", 'Easy peasy with good scrambling opportunities throughout!', 'Just  beautiful! More of a walk than a hike.', 'Large family friendly. We have 5 small children under 10 and really enjoy this hike.   There are parts where we carry the 2 year old, but other than that the littles can do most of it and enjoy climbing.', 'What great place to hike. This hike has some good views of the rocks and I also saw a few rock climbers.', 'This is more of a nature walk than a hiking trail, but it is absolutely gorgeous and unique!  This valley is surrounded with massive boulders which are relatively easy to scale.  If you go off the trail there are slots to explore and amazing flowers and wildlife!  We saw a whip snake and a rattler, as well as all sort of flowering cacti and lizards.  I highly recommend this trail, especially if you are into rock climbing and bouldering.', 'amazing trail to explore', 'Easy trail and fun climbing.', 'Awesome trail. You can walk around it or if your up for a challenge you can climb the rocks and get a phenomenal view from the top.', 'AWESOME!!! LOTS OF HIDDEN CAVES!!! MANY GREAT PHOTO OPPORTUNITIES.', 'Otherworldly! Beautiful at sunset.', 'Well maintained and marked. Moderate amount of effort is some places but most is easy. Nice views. Well worth the walk.', 'My favorite kid-friendly trail. The loop is pleasant and not too strenuous for the kids. Lots lots of rocks to be climbed along the way too and gorgeous scenery. This is one is an easy trail and must see in the natl park!', 'Great easy hike in Joshua Tree. The park is incredible.  Did some climbing on the rocks along this trail.  We hiked Hidden Valley and Barker Dam in a morning.  Would recommend both.', 'another great easy trail for all levels.  lots of rocks to climb if your interested in that.  amazing scenery all around', 'Fun easy hike for family', 'Easy, short and spectacular.', 'Was my favorite hike at Joshua Tree. Aside from being very crowded it was a spectacular hike, feels like your in own world inside the canyon.', "A very short but spectacular hike ... one of my favorites in this park. Great picture opportunities. Spotted a Stellar's Jay on the route. Often very crowded so pcik your visitation time carefully.", "This was a nice little trail that went into a valley with a mini unique ecosystem.  We went in December during a period of unprecedented visitation, so as expected, this trail was busy.  In fact, this trail is heralded as the most popular in the park.  The trail has its own parking lot and vault toilet.  It requires some light climbing up and down rock stairs throughout, but nothing too extreme.  No hiking poles are needed.The trail recommends you proceed clockwise on the loop to better pair with the informational placards.  I don't think December is the optimal time for this trail as many of the plants were dormant or not in blood, but it was still beautiful as it wove thru unique rock formations along the way.", 'Fantastic little loop to venture off and do some bouldering.  Often very crowded.', 'Easy hike, perfect to begin this park views.', 'Great trail if you have toddlers in tow!', 'Easy but beautiful hike with some very nice views.', 'Nice easy loop.  Has plant life.  Good for all ages', 'Was a really good start off hike today with my son along with many other great hikes out the day lot to see clean trail nice little cool cave as you come to the end nice people good vibes', "A one mile loop completely surrounded by a circle of incredible rock formations and outcroppings.  The sign at trailhead states approximately 1 hour???? For 1 mile!! YEP, it's because with every step there is picture perfect scenery.  You go slow because there is just too much to see.  Trail has rock stairs at beginning and end of trail, but interior is very easy. Take water!!! And lots of pictures", 'Best short hike in the park. Rock formations surrounding the valley are fantastic and the plant diversity here is amazing. Get on this trail early to beat both the crowds and the heat of the day.', 'Fun, short hike with lots of opportunities to boulder around.\n\nVisited December 2015', 'Easy loop. More crowded than other locations.', 'Beautiful hike.  Excellent for all ages from young kids to 80+.  Climbers to watch too. Best of the short hikes in the park.', 'Nice easy little hike with little kids to burn off energy and climb on some boulders!', 'Absolutely beautiful hike.  Not for anyone with difficulty walking, as there are stairs and so forth cut into the rock and might be difficult, but it is one of the most beautiful hikes on the park.  A lot of people use it, so no privacy.  Lots of rocks and lots of climbers, so you are likely to get a show.', 'Easy loop but so great. the scenery is fantastic. Our boys could not get enough of the boulders!', 'Beautiful short trail nestled in the fascinating rock formations.', 'Incredibly easy hike through some of the best scenery in the park.', 'Just like lots of the other short loops in Joshua Tree: easy, typical desert scenery. Lots of photo ops and chances to scramble on the rocks and boulders.', "This is a great mile long loop. Easy peasy. Lots of opportunity for bouldering and photography. There is some rock climbing but I'm not familiar enough with activity to review what they are like. ", 'Though this is a very easy hike and extremely short, it as absolutely amazing for photography. Surrounded by beautiful rock formations, tall green trees, and many Joshua trees. The temperature dropped about 10-15 degrees easily. We took the trail counter clockwise and it was awesome. ', "This is an easy little hike, perfect for a hot hot Joshua Tree afternoon. It's busy, but it's beautiful and really a gem in the desert. I loved the views and colors and character of this little patch of landscape a must-see in JTNP. Lots of climbing too.", 'this is a pretty an easy hike. go early in the day to avoid crowds.', 'Great scenery and interesting history on an easy and well-maintained trail. hike_name:
Rodeo Beach Coastal Trail Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'partially paved', 'views']
hike_description: Rodeo Beach Coastal Trail Loop is a 4.8 mile loop trail located near Sausalito, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

user_texts:
['Fun hike with friends on New Year day. Gorgeous views, a little crowded but tons of cool graffiti art in the Ana dined buildings and bunkers.', 'Steep incline worth the views!', 'Awesome views!', 'Wide open views of the cliffs and sea. Very steep but worth the payoff. Lots of side paths to meander to vistas.', "Nice hiking trail, the first half is a bit tough, but gets easier afterworlds. If you're looking to hike in forest between trees, pick another one. This is open high elevation space with nice views overseeing SF, the beach and marin county.", "Done this twice. It's a nice hike. 

I suggest going all the way to the top! Totally worth it. Would also suggest going on a clear day (if you can find one, haha), as everyday we've gone it's been super foggy!", 'Great workout with beautiful views', 'Amazing time. Saw the Marin headlands. It’s amazing', 'Beautiful 2hr loop.', 'Great hike, not too many views since the fog was covering the majority of the trail. Make sure to go on a clear day.', 'I feel like this trail was pretty moderate. If you aren’t use to hiking up pretty steep inclines, this hike may not be for you. Make sure you don’t miss the Wolf Ridge trail head. Heading up near Hill 88 had me distracted and I never saw it. If you hit the graffiti then head back down the hill and look to your right for the trail head.', 'Easy trail, lots of parking right near the beach.The trail is mostly fire roads with a short section on stairs. There are several areas that have been rerouted because of closures. The eastern half coming down from Hill 88 is slightly boring as there aren’t many views and you can’t see the beach. There were several Batteries and other historic things to see along the way.', 'Nice and easy hike, beautiful views.', 'Great loop with a nice stopover on hill 88. Takes 2-3 hours with leisurely pace.', 'Great hike for lots of variety to keep kids entertained.', 'The hike started off subtle. We were hiking on flat gravel then the trail began to incline & it became more steeper the further we went. The view was beautiful. I brought binoculars & go to see a deer. Make sure you bring lots of water. I enjoyed it I would go back !', 'Beautiful hike by the coast. A little windy near the water, but views are worth it at the top!', 'Fantastic hike. Challenging in the beginning, but well worth it for the views. The ocean breezes are heavenly and the route is not very crowded. Not a very complicated route, just pay attention.', 'Great view but easy to get lost. After 8 miles  later and enjoying the beach I had to take a taxi back.', 'Great views and perfect Sunday distance', 'Stunning views! Lots of options for trails and exploring! Will be back soon!', 'Absolutely beautiful.  We will be going back sometime in the near future.', 'Beautiful hike! The views are stunning. You get a steep hike at first and a nice downhill at the end. Reference your map as it’s easy to go off the trail. Go early too! We started at 8 am and it was perfect!', 'Absolutely loved this hike! So much to see and do. There is something for everyone. Moderate hike with amazing views. ', 'Beautiful!', 'I did this hike on my own, it was great. The weather was perfect and the views are outstanding. Totally doable, but an excellent work out.', 'Beautiful and relatively relaxed trail that goes inland and to the beach.', 'Easy hike but also easy to loose the trail. But that’s also because I was distracted by the views. Stunning. Fun. Do it.', 'Amazing trail. Love the stair case and also the old base! Good for all types.', 'Pretty easy hike with nice views. Plenty of parking with public restrooms.', 'Beautiful views and a good variety of trails to mix it up.', 'Majestic views, frog concert and sunset upon returning to the trailhead. First part is all up last part you get to cool down and be in the shade if you are hiking later afternoon. Spotted 2 coyotes at 30 feet.', 'Enjoyed this hike and great with the pup!', 'Amazing views, open trails - great for dogs.', 'Awesome hike and beautiful views! The dogs loved it.', 'Great hike with nothing but scenic views. There is not a lot of shade along the trail, and make sure to bring water.', 'Great Hike. Dog friendly. Some hills but not to steep. Beautiful views of SF. Bring water.', 'Great trail with amazing views. Moderate difficulty, but very doable', 'This is a beautiful hike.  Plenty of parking down by the beach.  The beginning of the trail has labels for leashed dogs but once you clear crowds and get on the fire road many people had dogs off leash.  I started hiking in the afternoon and return to the trailhead around the time for sunset.  Very serene to watch the sunset on the cliffs overlooking the water and hearing the waves below.  The trail was not that crowded.  The elevation change if you do the entire loop is a nice little workout.  Once the sun was down I even heard tons of frogs in the field beside the parking lot.  If you do the full loop and have dogs off leash make sure to put them back on leash when you get to the lagoon area.  The cars surprised me around the corner as the road was right there but doggies were safe.', 'We started the loop at the end of the parking lot. Views of the ocean then Bolinas. As we rose, a bit steep and a good workout, we finally saw Tennessee Valley then Mt Tam, mill valley opened up below us. We could see Sonoma and Napa and then rounded the turn, so Sausalito was spread below. The East bay, The bay bridge and Golden Gate Bridge. Mt Diablo and SF came into view.  Fabulous views, steep hikes and easy courses. You can turn down and make it shorter or extend the hike easily. Dogs are not allowed on the extended part. Enjoy!', 'From the Rodeo Beach parking lot go clockwise: Coastal Trail - Wolf Ridge Trail - Miwok Trail - Rodeo Valley Trail - parking lot.  Personal rating: good hike to repeat, moderate level, not long, 1 hr 45 min, beautiful views.', 'Love this loop and generally not too many people', 'Amazing!', "Great views. Not too difficult, although there's almost no shade, so wear sunscreen!", 'I took the suggestion to go counter-clockwise which was beautiful as the sun was going down and def worth the short divert to Hill 88. Really great, short trail, not too taxing- just watch out for mountain bikes on the single track sections.', 'Nice hike to get in during the late afternoon if you have a late start. I would recommend this hike on a hot day. There were some cool breezes when we went. The view of the Golden Gate Bridge would have been better if there had not been any fog.', 'Amazing hike, moderate, with stunning views!', "Great hike! Went with my dog! Here are two tips!

(1) if you start at the parking lot most people go clockwise. For a more spectacular climax, and to get the slightly boring and flat bits out of the way first, I suggest going counterclockwise.

(2) Take the slight detour for Hill 88. It's not that much longer and gets you to a higher peak.", 'great hike with your pup! whale sightings!', 'Pretty nice mellow hike', 'Stunning views out here! Always on the hunt for dog friendly paths, and we were able to take him off leash. Part of the trail is on a paved road but we deviated a bit to get off it and gain some extra elevation. Can get pretty chilly and windy even on a clear, sunny day.', 'Great loop trail with stunning scenery! Bring your dog, but watch out for rattlesnakes!', '', 'Easy parking at Rodeo Beach.  I went clockwise up the Coastal Trail - uphill for 1.9 miles and a bit of a workout.  The rest of the hike is easy - downhill and then flat through the valley.  Great open vistas the entire way.  Excellent coast/ocean views during the first half of the hike.', 'We veered into this trail from the easy Tennessee Valley Trail. Beautiful sweeping coastal views!', 'Not much shade, and some parts can be steep, but the views are pretty awesome. My dog had a great time too.', 'I took this trail and expanded to a total length of 8 miles: At the Wolf Ridge Trail meets the Miwok Trail, instead of turning right, I went straight and continued onto Miwok Trail, Bobcat Trail and then back to Miwok Trail. At the end of the Miwok Trail, I turned right onto the Lagoon Trail and back to the parking lot. Most trails on this loop are fire roads good for biking but not the best for hiking. At the peak of the Miwok Trail there were some gorgeous views of the SF Bay.', 'Solid trail with nice views throughout. A popular route, but not too crowded.', '', "This trail was so great!! We took a dog with us, didn't run into any trouble. We took the trail counter clockwise( I definitely recommend going this way). It's a long gradual way up and around but on the way down back you get the amazing views of the coast and get to have fun with all the old military stuff around. I also recommend taking a little detour and going up to Hill 88. Bunkers and views await up there. The trails are extremely well marked and maintained. We went on a weekday so parking wasn't hard, but there is lots of options right by the beach on Mitchell Rd. And if you follow along there is also a big parking lot with bathrooms. It was a cool sunny, slightly windy day but if you go in the summer bring lots of water because there is practically zero shade along the whole trail. AMAZING HIKE!! 

I've added some pictures from this hike on: http://vsco.co/daianasegura/", "It was pretty, with great views on a clear day but most of the trail was dirt road or along a road and it was very exposed to the sun. We did it on an unusually hot non-windy day so that may be why we didn't love it. A lot of the trail also is littered with old bunkers if you are into that but it takes away from the nature a bit.", 'We did this trail for the first time when we did the Golden Gate Trail Run!  Super challenging and beautiful!  Looking forward to getting back there for a nice hike!', 'Really nice for a shorter hike.  I did this on a Saturday, so instead of just launching directly into the hike, I stopped by the Nike missile base (SF88) at 11:30 to do the guided tour first.  Definitely recommend it.  You do really need to be there at 11:30 though -- self-guided tours aren't permitted.

I did the hike clockwise, which has you starting at the Rodeo Beach parking lot at the end of Mitchell avenue, then heading northbound up the coastal trail.  It's steep-ish towards the top, with some stairs, but the first part is mild switchbacks that take you by Battery Townsley for a nice ocean view.  Near the top expect some decent wind and fog if it's that kind of day.  My knees don't like steep downhill pounding, so I prefer doing the steep gradients uphill.  If you'd like a more gentle climb and a gravity-assisted descent, definitely do this hike in the opposite direction.

From there, you continue on the coastal trail as it turns east toward hill 88 (the control site for the aforementioned Nike base).  It's worth a quick side-trip to the site to have a look around.  As is standard military nomenclature, "hill 88" refers to the height, in this case 880 feet -- the top of your climb on this route.  If you do the hike clockwise, you'll hit 880' in a little over 1.5 miles.

After returning to the coastal trail from the Nike control site, you again head east until it turns into the wolf ridge trail (also called coyote ridge on some maps).  At this intersection the coastal trail almost double-backs on itself, heading northwest down towards the Tennessee Valley.  Keep heading east on the wolf ridge trail.

You'll intersect the Miwok trail and turn southbound.  From this point on you'll be on the leeward side of hill 88, so the wind dies down and the temps creep up.  It's a gentle, meandering up-and-down all the way back down to the Miwok trailhead and a short  walk along Mitchell road westbound back to your starting point at the Rodeo Beach parking lot.

Lots of flora and fauna to ogle.  Tons of wildflowers in bloom when I did this in early July.  Also saw: bobcat, turkey vulture, red-tailed hawk, a mule deer and tons of western fence lizards.  

Very lightly traveled for a trail in the Bay Area on a Saturday.  Only saw 3 others on the trail.  A free trail map is available at the visitor's center on Bunker Road, along with some interpretive exhibits.  Just follow the signs on your way in.', 'amazing views, we went off trail and climbed in old bunkers. what an amazing piece of history!', "Recommend to park at the visitor's center and hike this counterclockwise up Miwok Trail to Wolf Ridge Trail then back down the Coastal Trail. Miwok trail is a good warm up, mostly all gradual uphill about 900feet, then the Wolf Ridge trail is narrower mixed with flat, downhill, and some steep uphill sections but wonderful views of the hills. At the end of the wolf ridge trail you're rewarded with beautiful coastal views and as you continue down the coastal trail come across various military bunkers, views of SF, and some glimpses of the Golden Gate Bridge until you're back at sea level on a small beach. As you walk back to the parking lot on the south side of the lagoon there's even some shaded areas of vegetation to mix things up. A good rewarding 5 mile loop that gets your blood pumping but it by no means very difficult for the average person.", 'I really enjoy this trail in the mornings with my dog. Dogs are allowed off leash (under voice control) along the whole length. I try to walk this loop at least once a week, and it is well-used by bikers, hikers, and trail-runners. Personally, I prefer to park at the visitor center and walk the loop counterclockwise. That way your ascent is on a nice steady grade for the most part, and the descent has wonderful bridge and ocean views. Finish by walking along Rodeo Beach (your dog will love this!) then loop back to the visitor center along the coastal trail on the south side of the lagoon. But please be careful that your dog does not enter the lagoon boundary, as there are sensitive birds and amphibians there.Tip: make a detour to the top of Hill 88 for vistas and some urban archaeology!', "Challenging climb to the top offset by a great stroll a hundred feet up along a mile of the coast. Once you get inland it's kinda boring but the trail is well maintained.", 'Good trail with a little bit of climbing - there us an option to do this trail, upto a point, on the street, while not super smooth, not a bad road bike road either. This park has some good road cycling in addition to hiking.', 'Fun! Easy bring something warm as winds can really pick up', 'Great hiking trail. every where you look has some great views of the city and the GGB.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Cowles Mountain from Big Rock Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'trail running', 'walking', 'views', 'rocky']
hike_description: Cowles Mountain from Big Rock Trail is a 4.5 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Santee, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from October until June. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Too many people!', 'Went New Year’s Day and it was trafficked as expected for a cool morning. Get hike for a challenge and felt great to accomplish it. Stay hydrated', 'Not terribly crowded for New Years Day - great somewhat challenging hike', 'Sooooo crowded. ', 'Great work out! The views were amazing of San Diego! Good cardio as well! We chose to take the harder trail path definitely a great work out! Would love to do again!!', 'enjoyed it 12-9-18 not as crowded as Coweles will do it often although walking down the service road to reconnect with big rock can be dangerous', 'Really good hike. Has some stretches that are challenging like the last bit to the top but the views are worth it. Well marked trails too.', "I love that height it's so green", 'Great', 'Went on a weekday, and there were barely any hikers or riders on the trail. Surely challenging the last mile, but well worth it!', 'Nice hike with some challenging stretches and good views on top.', 'The trail has potential, but is very crowded and most do not observe trail etiquette (for example: amplified music, leaving trash on the summit, not picking up after dogs).', 'Not much to look at on this hike until you get to the top. Great views of San Diego once you get there. Pretty good work out. Went on a week day and it wasn’t crowded at all.', 'Great trail for training. l less crowded than the main Trail.', "The majority of the trail was pretty tame, though it got steep towards the end. Lots of people on the trail at 8 am on a Saturday. Nice views of the city at the top. The trail is well maintained and easy to follow. It starts by a city park with bathrooms, so that's a bonus!", 'If one must do cowles, I definitely suggest this route. It is much less crowded than the front way and there is tons of shade. Doable for children as young as 5.', 'Definitely moderate even though the signs are rated difficult. Went early to beat the sun. Not too busy of a trail although there were some working cars driving up and down. Very steep part towards the summit for about .5 miles. Make sure you wear proper shoes!', 'More enjoyable, more strenuous approach to Cowles than the "main way."', "Heavy trafficked trail and dog friendly. First part of the trail goes behind home houses, then eventually merges to the main trail where you will see many other hikers. The hike up is a steady incline with a few steeper parts. once you get to the top, you get a panoramic view of San Diego. Be careful on the way down. If you are not wearing shoes with enough traction you may slip at some parts. Overall, it's a good hike to go with kids and dogs.", 'A favorite on Cowles Mtn. Great terrain and views', "I've climbed Cowles twice, this time taking the less trafficked route, and I enjoyed it a lot more. It is very steep towards the summit and there is a lot of loose gravel. Make sure you wear HIKING shoes or boots. I made the mistake of wearing running shoes, and I slipped and fell and scraped my knee. Overall a nice hike, great for beginners like me.", 'Great workout hike - Easy to find trailhead - trail in good condition even after rain - started right before sunrise and  rock ridge trail was empty .... at least going up', 'From out of town and so glad I picked this! Ran all the trails up there but this was my favorite segment - not as heavily trafficked as the others were to get to the peak.  Spectacular views all the way up and back.  The trail is well marked and easy to navigate and the single track segments were just hard enough to keep it interesting.  Had a great time!', 'Ive hiked and biked this trail on a few occassìons.  Experienced mtb only and you will need to walk some.  Its a nice stroll up the mountain though and it is  definitly prefered trail to the top of cowels for my taste.', "Big rock trail is awesome! lots of greenery and really feels like you are in the thick of it. once you hit the fire road to Cowles it's definitely an uphill battle. loose gravel makes it intimidating for the descent but overall a good hike round trip. Plenty of street parking and in a safe neighborhood.", 'Good hike. Just a lot of lose gravel. So you have to be careful when going back down. Lots of traffic but fun. View is really nice once up there.', '', 'Did as a midmorning hike on a Friday. Trail was relatively crowed.', 'first time doing this hike! it was amazing started from  big rock trail near the park down below. great nice hike loved it', 'Great workout', 'what a work out. so proud of Kacey and myself for getting this done.', 'Really liked this trail but my first hike in many years and a bit out of shape so it was difficult. working to get back into shape.', 'Totally different from the other side. Less hikers and a great incline', 'First time going up this way.  Fewer hikers on this route.', 'Best trail up Cowles. Do it at least once.', 'Quite a nice route up Cowles with much less foot traffic. The service road is my next goal. Plan on going up with my bike theu that route', "I love this trail and suited for my training! It isn't too rocky and crowded than the Cowles Mountain Trailhead. It is a longer route but it was worth it.", 'Cowles is busy during the weekends, this back side is a lot better then continue on to Pyles Peak.', 'Good hike', "this app says this trail is moderate.. bit the signs say difficult.. I'm leaning to the difficult side. It was hot because I started closer to 9 a.m. instead of 7 which was my goal... but.. considering the direct sun and really no shade.. especially as you get closer to the summit 7 is probably still too late for a July day. All in all, I would do it again but earlier... much earlier or in the fall or winter. But hey, got some good exercise. ", "The incline was killer! great workout for those who aren't avid hikers. The people were amazing and the views at sunset were fantastic. I will definitely do this hike again.", "It was BEAUTIFUL! First hike since moving to Cali, also first one alone and the highest difficulty; I'm thoroughly impressed with the scenery.", 'It was a good run hike for me I was pretty much alone on trail felt semi remote bushes very grown out will do again', "Love it. I try to hike it sat and sun am's ", 'Overcrowded kind of like hiking in the mall but nicely maintained.', 'love it ', 'It was my first San Diego Hike. It was a good hike for a workout if you walk briskly. The terrain is not too difficult. There are spots of slippery gravel/rocks that you just need to take your time going down. Towards the top it got steep and felt like a great workout. Views were beautiful! I saw dogs, kids and teens doing the hike. We took almost two hours to complete. We had a bottle of water at the top and a bottle at the end.', 'The hike to Cowles Mountain Peak from Big Rock Park is OK until you hit the service road which is pretty drab. There were not many people on this trail, but at the top there were a surprising number.  They come up from a different path to a completely different trail head.  I started going down that path just to check it out but there were so many people on it that it was actually not pleasant.  Once at the top of Cowles Mtn Peak, the best part of the trail is really to hike the extra mile and a half over to Pyles Peak.  It is clearly marked as the Pyles Peak Trail.  The trail is beautiful.  It goes through interesting wild flowers and even some unusual cactus.  The views all along that trail are excellent.', 'The first mile and a half of this trail is lovely.  However, once you get on the service road part it is one mile basically straight up.  Yes, a mile of consecutive steep pitches, each steeper than the last, and no shade.  Enjoy!', "Pretty easy. But fun if you're a beginner", "Love this trail not many travel the Big Rock Trail so it's nice", "I love cowles! It's super close to SDSU so I'd do it on my breaks! It only takes me about an hour to an hour and a half round trip! It's short but soo steep so you'll definitely get a great workout in! Gorgeous at sunset too!", 'Good workout!', 'Good for exercise thats about it. Too many people and very rocky.', "My wife's favorite hike going up the back side of this mountain. Never overly crowded and has a decent amount of shade in the morning.", 'We had nice time, took us an hour, pretty good workout. I have done Cowles twice before but it was my first time thru Big Rock Trail, loved all the green around me.', 'Was visiting the SD areas and completed this hike.   Great views and easy to follow.   Took about 45 mins up.', "Cowle's is a fun hike, but it can get a lot of people traffic on any given day. For more fun try lesser traveled trails like Barker way.", 'Much better than Cowles from the front and dog friendly :)', 'Not worth the hype, but great workout.', "Good trail, not overgrown and well marked.  Secluded, wildlife is tall.  Opens up during the last half mile on a service road to the top of Cowels mountain.  Good for running, not to rocky.  Cowels front side has much more rocks and to many people.  Didn't like the top part of the service road, didn't have a nature feel to it.", 'Also known as Cowles "Backside" is more challenging than the "Front Side".  Much steeper in a lot of places & is less traveled ... not nearly as crowded as the "Front Side". Kinda pushes you on the way down!', 'Had fun. Parking sucks but, other than that I enjoyed myself.', 'Great hike!  Did this on 9-5-16 as part of the five-peak challenge.  Did them all in one day.  18.1 miles.  4,326 feet of elevation gain, 6 1/2 hours.  Fun!  Did Kwaay Paay first, then North Fortuna, and South Fortuna.  Then, drove to Big Rock and hiked Pyles and Cowles.', 'Today was the first tine going up this way. I really liked it. The first half of the hike is awesome. The second half is in a service road and becomes more crowded. Overall it is better than the crowds going up the other Cowles Mountain trail. Definitely recommend this hike.', "Got Cowles and Pyle's Peak in one shot from this side for a change.  A lot less people, but that ain't saying much.  Once you get to Pyle's though, the herd thins.  Great exercise, but keep an eye out for the Rock Trail cutoff otw back.  I missed it and had to back track which is not fun.", 'Great for my first time up Cowles. The Big Rock Trail was empty on the way up (sunrise) and I only saw a half dozen or so on my way down......once off the access road that is. We got very low clouds which actually made for quite a visual treat since we were above them at the peak.', 'Tough hike, the access road at the top is brutal.  bring water and wear sunscreen, very little shade on this well worn trail.', 'Pretty intense seeing we got to the top and decided to hike pyles peak right after.  Lesson learned', 'Good moderate hike.', "good steady climb. a good workout. I went the extra couple miles over to Pyle's. easy", 'I loved', "Really enjoyed it! Didn't do the full loop, just up and back. 5 miles on the dot.", 'A good and fun hike!  Great views and a great day!', 'Too crowded, what made up for that was going on to Pyles Peak', 'nice trail with great views :)', 'We hiked Cowles Mountain and Pyles Peak from Big Rock. The map on AllTrails shows this as a loop. The connector trail from Pyles Peak that takes you back to the Cowles Mountain trail is closed for a re-vegetation project. This is an definitely an out and back. Pyles Peak is about 1.5 hours out and back from Cowles Mountain at a fairly good pace. The gravel service road that takes you to the summit of Cowles is very steep and an excellent workout. The views from the summits of both Cowles and Pyles are spectacular. It was well worth the trip. It ended up being a little over 8 miles out and back and a little over 3 hours at a brisk pace. I would rate the hike moderate to difficult. We went on a nice day. It would be more difficult on a hotter day. Take plenty of water either way.', 'Very good hike with XLNT elevation change.  Outstanding views from the top.', 'Great!', 'Our family loves this hike. yes it is longer going up from the back side or from Big rock park.', 'Overall nice & easy hike .get here early to beat the crowd', 'Much prettier and much less crowded than the front side!', 'A nice non-waste of time while I was at the Santee Wal-Mart. Leads into the San Diego River Trail.', "A great hike within city limits, perfect for training! I've heard Cowles is usually super crowded but on a Sunday afternoon it wasn't too bad. The steady incline makes for a great workout. You are rewarded at the top with stellar 360 views of all of San Diego. It's a wonderful resource for when you don't have time to leave the city!", 'The trail was marked and not confusing. Great for cardio work out.', 'Great!', "Just did this hike today. Started off from Big Rock (Mesa Rd.) Went to the top of Cowles Mountain, went down to the other side (Navajo Rd.) Then with the same route back to Big Rock from where I started. 
Date Hiked: Feb 22, 2015
Total Miles : 7.98
Total Time: 2 Hrs and 10 mins

Definitely one of my best workouts on these trails. I've been hiking every sunday for the past 6 weeks now and I need to catch up on some other trails that I've completed. This was my 5th time on Cowles, 3rd times on Potato Chip including Lake Poway route. As well as Iron Mountain.

My Hikes  usually starts about 30 mins before sun rise. Cowles Mountain from Big Rock is less crowded but the Navajo Rd start point is pretty packed. It rained a little bit today but it helped me cool down during the hiked. Im still up for any hikes in the area and still want to go check out The Three Sister's Falls.


use MapMyRun App to track your workouts...", 'Very beautiful climb! Much longer than Cowles Mountain, but so worth the views!', 'great to do at night, and not as crowded as i keep hearing the main trail is.', "Did this hike with my brother-in-law today.  We started out around 10AM and finished up around 12-12:30ish.  The trail is very dirty/dusty so wear shoes that you don't mind getting a little dirty.  We saw quite a few pet owners with their dogs on the trail, so very dog-friendly.  We didn't see too many young 'uns, however, there were a few at the top.  I'm pretty sure mine wouldn't have been able to make it due to the heat and how steep the trail is near the top.

We did saw a few mountain bikers and trail runners, but they obviously were more dedicated than I was... I'll stick to hiking.  Take lots of water because you'll need it.  I was soaked with sweat by the time we got back to the car.  Also, we didn't see too much wildlife besides bugs and hummingbirds at the summit.  Was hoping to get some pictures of snakes, but they were all hiding somewhere when we went.

The trail we took which seems like the back trail was much less crowded than the trail on the front side of the mountain, which was nice.

Once we got to the top, the view was absolutely stunning.  360 degree panoramic views make the mostly uphill hike very rewarding.  When you're at the top, you definitely feel a sense of accomplishment!

Because of the views near the top and the great workout, this trail is definitely 5 stars!!", 'Had to do this hike again because I enjoyed it. I wanted to really push myself seeing that I was starting a little bit late in the day. Started at about 6 and was up and down in 1 hour and 15 minutes, almost 30 minutes quicker than my first attempt. Temp was cool and sun was setting but it was nice with the lack of crowding. I walked quickly up and jogged most of the way down. This attempt felt great.', 'This is a nice hike... ALL the difficulty is at the end when it gets steep ascending to the top. Trail is much nicer than the more popular front side of Cowles Mtn. I started mapping my route from my car and went a total of 5 miles in an hour and 48 minutes.... 3 hours is more than enough time to get this hike completed. Next time I will begin at Big Rock ascend to the top of Cowles mtn., go down to the bottom of Cowles and return back up then down to my car to make this a little more challenging.', 'This hike is not very long but pretty steep. Beautiful trail though. Much less crowded than the usual approach.', 'Did this hike in the morning on a week day so it was not too crowded. It was a nice pace and a beautiful sight at the top!!', 'Crowed over on this side as well.', 'I prefer this approach when hiking Cowles Mtn, not as crowded.', 'Trail was more crowded than expected but still a great hike.  Views are excellent.', "Compared to the more popular Cowles trail, I found this to be much more enjoyable and challenging. Definitely less people and parking was a breeze! I followed Nathan B's directions in his review and it got me right to the trailhead without a problem. I found the steep incline at the last quarter of the hike to be rather challenging (then again it was pretty warm today). It took me about 54 minutes to the top at a steady but not hurried pace. I'll likely do this hike again. ", 'You can hike up Cowles the boring, overused way, or from this way. From Mission Gorge rd. turn south down Mesa rd. and you can either park by Big Rock park and enter the trail here, or continue south down Mesa rd until you are on a dirt road and continue down until the road dead ends to a metal gate. I like to park here and go up the dirt road until you see the trailhead on your right. Either of these ways will give you about a 4.4 mile hike which can be completed in about 1 hour if you run some, or 2 hours if you walk most of the way. The two trailheads mentioned here intersect about half way up then take you to a fireroad which you turn right on all the way to the peak. The hardest part of this trail is the steep ascent at the very end. I do this hike 3-4 times a month as it is close to me and you are given some solitude because it is not over-crowded like the Navajo-Golfcrest side. I have only seen one rattlesnake here and I have been countless times. Enjoy!', "It has been said that this is an easy trail that's good for beginners and out of shape people. The Mission Trails Regional Parks official trail map, rates this trail as a 5 on a scale of 1 to 5. I've not found a document, on their website, that explains the basis for their trail rating system, but having hiked pretty much every trail in the park, I've found the higher the trail rating the more physically demanding the trail is. The point being if you are in good shape you'll probably find this trail easy, if you are not in good shape or are chronologically challenged, as I am, you will probably find this trail a bit physically demanding. However, a slow steady gate should get most to the top. Once there, particularly on a clear day, the views of downtown, Point Loma, the mountains to the east and other suburban areas are worth the trek. The south trail to the summit of Cowles is very popular and this tends to make the trip a bit like being in a crowed mall, which makes the less used north approach, more appealing to grumpy old geezers such as myself. It's longer, but gives one more of a feeling of solitude.  If you are looking for a longer hike, there's a side trail of about 1.5 miles that will take you to Pyles Peak (also rated by MTRP as a 5). On the day I made that hike, I think I saw three other people on the trail. So, if you want a trail for exercise, views, walks with friends and ease of access, give the North approach to Cowels Mountain a shot.", 'Good place for hiking Starters, Its a diferent view from San Diego', "It's a pretty decent hike to take your dog or to go with friends who are not in great shape. It's a pretty easy hike and there's not much to look around once you get to the top. Also, there's always a lot of people there and I don't understand why because it's not that great of a hike. If you're looking for a great workout, I would try Devil's Punchbowl or Mt Woodsen, but definitely not this hike. If you're not in great shape and you want to exercise or take your dog on a walk or randomly decided you wanted to do something outdoors with your friends then this is the hike for you. It's a good beginner hike and you'll definitely still be able to talk as you walk. The people on the trail are super friendly and you get to see a wide variety of people hiking so that's always fun. It's not that hard so I wouldn't bring a lot of water but definitely bring sunscreen! It definitely doesn't take 3 hours though; Last time I went I was with my mom and her friends who are all well above 45 years of age and not super athletic and it took us an hour and 20 minutes.", 'I thought this was a great loop! Brought our dogs and they loved it!', 'I use to hike this when I would get bored.  It was right behind my old apartment complex Sunridge Apartments off of Graves Ave.  Some of those inclines are killer but was always nice the first month of Spring.  DO take some water and sunscreen because you are exposed most of the way unless you find a boulder or bush to rest under.', 'The northeast approach of Cowls mountain is a little less busy, but probably my least favorite due to the fact you are on a fireroad for the last part of the trial.  It starts out nice from the bottom, but once it does hit the fireroad its kind of boring. The east approach is probably my favorite, followed by the South approach which everyone goes to off Golfrest.  If you are looking to get away from some of the crowds, then this approach may be for you.', "This trail is good for testing yourself to see if you can climb up the mountain before doing bigger trails.  You'll see all kinds of people and maybe learn something.  People bring there dogs and kids up this trail but make sure they're fit or you will have problems.  Bring water and camera, great view of the City,  I went up at lunch time during work with my uniform, it was raining lightly but there was a least 60 to 80 people on the trail.  Take your time and enjoy, and let the fast people pass.
", 'Great trail to jog up and down. Can get crowded at times but for a jog pace its perfect distance and grade.', 'Very fun hike. Did this weekend. Good inclines but not overly challenging. ', 'We hiked this trail from the end of lake murray blvd.  It was not crowded at all for a weekend. It gets hot so we finished the hike by 10:30 am when temps started to spike. I saw lots of birds and rabbits and a very active beehive. ', 'Great views, good hike but crowded', 'Crowded and annoying. But decent exercise and easily accessible. ', 'It was fun...great trail :)', 'nice view and easy, except for the very sudden steep, 1/4 mile part.  this trail up Cowles is less busy but harder to find; start at Barker side.', "Great hike! I took my miniature husky up there in the afternoon.  We took the Big Rock Trail and it took up 2 hours round trip.  We went at a very leisurely pace and took frequent water breaks.  Running shoes are fine on this trail.  Saw lots of people on the trail without water.  There's very little shade and even on Dec 31, temps reached over 80.  Probably wont die of dehydration, but you will be very thirsty.  Crowds were limited on the trail, there were lots of people on the summit that had taken alternate routes.  Saw a few other dogs, but people were respectful and had them on leashes.  Trail was very clean, no trash.  AMAZING views from the top for a San Diego hike.  Great workout and will definitely do it again.  ", 'Best to start near school fence and Big Rock Park, off Mesa Rd. via Mission Gorge Rd, which is available from 52 &125 highways. Nice trail through old homestead then slowly climbing up hill in tall bushes, sometimes wet as creek flows through here. This is a slow grade up then most other venues for Cowles, but does get slippery:shale/rocky on the road near the top, last mile. The Northeast approach gives you great views all over the park, over to Pyles Peak, Kawaay Paay, along the way to the top of Cowles Mountain. Remember it can get cool at the top, so bring a jacket/cover up.', 'Good trail!  Not too crowded.  Good workout with steep inclines on the way up and fun to trail run down.  Trail is rocky though so wear trail shoes.  I wore my five fingers and it felt like the rocks would go right through them.', "Good trail & it's definitely not as crowed as the main trail. ", 'Great workout...you can do some trail running too!  Not as crowded as the main trail.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Santa Paula Canyon and Punch Bowls Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'partially paved', 'river', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky', 'washed out']
hike_description: Santa Paula Canyon and Punch Bowls Trail is a 6 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Santa Paula, California that features a waterfall and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
