user_texts: ["Nice flat hike, with beautiful black sand beach access at the end. Also has an alternative route that's more difficult.", 'Some nice coastal views towards the middle/hills but otherwise not that scenic', 'Nice hike, with beautiful views but it is not easy. I’d rate it moderate.', 'Mostly a walk to the beach (not much hiking). Make sure to take the stairs at the end to the top for a nice view of the beach and the greenery around!', 'Nice leisurely walk to Tennessee Beach, great side trails which we ended up doing the trail to Muir Beach the following weekend.Nice crowd, nice restrooms too!', 'Dogs are not allowed. We brought our dog, immediately saw signs that said no dogs, but took him anyways because we were already there and got a stern warning from a ranger.', "Now I don't know whether to bring my dog or not - conflicting review says dogs are NOT allowed, above says yes allowed on leash. Hmmm", 'Dogs are not allowed on this trail.', "GPS will take you right to parking area. there is no service once you start walking trail. really nice walk and the beach at the end is just GORGEOUS! doesn't feel like your in the bay area. blue water. make sure you do a TICK check before you leave.", 'Nice hike to Muir beach but it not for me cause I like to hike the peaks', 'Easy beautiful trail to a cove on the beach. My favorite to go place if I don’t want to travel very far.', 'It is a very lovely trail.  I have done this trail several times in July - August.  Great weather and great views.  Its  bit of a hill with a grand end at a lovely cliff enclosed beach.', 'Relatively short but lovely hike, especially on a non-foggy day when walking towards the beach and looking between the two hills that form the "Canyon". I always enjoy that view whenever I\'m on this trail.', 'Love it. Easy and beautiful. I uploaded some drone footage here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Tx-NJojqss', 'Amazing hike ending with a beautiful, Californian, cliffside beach.', 'Easy walk along mostly paved trail with breathtaking scenery at every step and turn making the windy day a worthy one! Beautiful on a 60 degree day with lots of mist and wind. Saw a salamander walking along the path! Watch out for our little amphibian friends! “California orange belly newts!”', 'The path is mostly paved so it’s more of a walk than a hike! But beautiful views and we went on a warm day so the beach was so comfortable', 'This was a good trail with a stroller. The kids (5 and 3 years old) had a lot of fun finding beautiful pebbles in a streamlet near the ocean. They are excited to go back!', 'Super easy. Good spot for picnic or big group of friends. Gorgeous little beach at the end. Parking is easy even on the weekend.', '', 'Great family hike.  Fun beach at the end for kids to splash in the puddles**note no dogs allowed', 'Beautiful view!', 'Make sure you go up to the lookout point at the end. It is worth it!', 'Busy during weekends but nice views.', 'this is the starter trail for anyone looking for a super easy hike to a small beach front.', '', "The beach looks great, I'm definitely coming back in a sunny day to lie there for a while.", 'Awesome hike out to the beach.  We were able to take an Uppababy Vista without any issue.', 'LOVED this hike! I did the straight forward hike, then went to the Beach overlook, then walked towards Pirates Cove. Really beautiful area and low-key with some inclines.', 'Nice walk that ends at Tennessee Beach. Pretty much perfect.', 'Really beautiful hike', 'Love, love, LOVE this trail. Such a great mini escape.', 'Marin county favorite. Very gentle stroll to a protected Cove and beach. Accessible and doable for all.  Sometimes of the year the anchor of an old shipwreck can be seen.   Hard to believe this is about 6 miles  as the crow flies from San Francisco.  wonderful get away.', 'Pretty easy trail - most of it is paved - with the option of a challenging incline when you get to the beach. Great views of the coast - we plan to do it again.', "Easy hike, especially if you stick to the lower trail (to the left) where it splits heading to the beach. I have a bad knee and managed just fine. Went on a Monday and the weather was clear and it wasn't crowded. Beautiful!!", 'It was a beautiful and easy hike. The only thing that bothered me was the sandblasts. Other than that it was fun!', "Great trail. Easy to follow as it's one well traveled road all the way out to the beach unless you take the fork to the left which puts you out at the same spot, but it's minus the little butt burner and the view from the top of the trail to the right. Right now it's as green as Ireland and covered with wildflowers. Super pretty. Easy to moderate is accurate.", 'Despite the slow start through the cemented area the trail becomes incredibly beautiful once you hit the dirt. About halfway through the hike you will find yourself at a fork. Both path are beautiful but I would suggest taking the right trail as you head to the beach.The right trail is much steeper but offers a beautiful scenery. The left trail will bring you through a tight path leading over a small bridge. No matter which you take you will end up at the beautiful, windy, beach. Both paths lead to the same area so I suggest taking the upper trail first and returning on the lower one. Just remember to bring a windbreaker and you will be fine.', "My first time. It's beautiful, moderate traffic, stay to the left if you want a few hills to climb or stay to the right for my flatter trails. Both lead you to the ocean", "Tennessee Valley Trail is a beautiful, fairly easy walk to the secluded Tennessee Beach! This is a great walk for the entire family! I've been here many many times and always loved it. Be aware that parking can get pretty crazy on sunny Weekends!", "On our road trip back in November, we stumbled upon this trail during our day in Sausalito/San Francisco. It was so beautiful and a good little bit of exercise. There are some hills to climb and valleys to walk down but it's not hard at all. Great for a stroll and the little beach at the end is wonderful.", 'Easy and beautiful, a bit crowded though', 'This trail is AMAZING and gets very difficult if you turn left at the beach and go up the hill. Love love love. Probably about 8 miles.', 'nice view', 'Beautiful hidden beach surprise at end!', 'Enjoyable if crowded trail. Nice views ands the added climb up to three old battery was unexpected. Will be back to check out some of the other trails in the danger location.', "Not really a hiking trail, better used for a leisurely stroll.  Best suited for inexperienced hikers.  I'm not a fan.", 'Lovely short hike with a beautiful end view.', "This is a basic, flat trail to Tennessee Beach and back. The first half or so is paved. Lots of parking. This could be a quick run, walk, or mt bike ride. I read the sign on the way out that says no dogs...oops. I get it, as many people don't pick up after their pets. I gave this a 3rd star because the small, private beach is cool.", "There are two different types of Tennessee Valley Trails. One of them is the upper and the other is the lower. Depending on how much elevation you want to deal with, I recommend the upper trail of you want a trail with gradual incline. If you want something more flat, I suggest taking the lower trail. Nevertheless, you're rewarded with stunning views! Pack a swimsuit, bring your kids and pooch and it should be a BLAST for everyone!", 'Beautiful easy trail with a great view at the end.', 'Great trail. Steady ascent challenged my friend and I while we jogged and hiked to the top. Fog just made it dreamier. Easy parking on the road when we hit it up about 6:30 PM on a weekday. Cute wooden footbridges and blackberry bushes added interest to the trail.', 'Trailhead to Muir Beach via Fox (steep) to Coyote to Green Gulch ( beautiful and high, the path winds down to Zen garden (part of Marin Organic) and on to Muir. Coastal Trail back (10mi)', 'A little uneventful', 'Get there early for parking. Nice beginner hike while offers other options for climbing.', 'Perfect with kids. Paved most of the way.', "If you stay on the easy path, it's not much of a hike (which is totally ok!) but more of a nice, scenic stroll. The scenery is actually quite beautiful, and I went with a friend when it was a little foggy out. The huge rocks and cliffs were amazing to look at. Spills out right to the beach, then you just go back onto the trail.", '10 out of 10 would hike again.', 'Had a great time out on this hike!1st time we ever went, found gem on this app!! thank you! it was a  Easy path to take the kids! today we were lucky was able to see a seal, dolphins and beautiful views!!', 'Just completed this trail yesterday and I would say \'all that I could have asked for myself\' on that beautiful day! Had a feeling of content. (You know, the kind of which doesn\'t come easy.)It was supposed to be rainy day and it did pour! But even in that weather, the trail had a good number of hikers, trail-runners, bikers; which was a big surprise!The trail is quite flat and easy as everyone have mentioned, which quickly leads to the Gorgeous views of the ocean and stone-formations. The beach itself seems to be a work-of-art, a painters imagination! Lost track of time just standing there and watching the waves and listening to the ocean.There is also a little extra hike to a spot which is overlooking the Tennessee Beach from a height. If you and your group have the time, I would recommend this part as well. But be careful at the very top. Though the view is breathtaking but  there is Not a lot of room up their. So you have to be cautious of the edges while taking those  pictures/videos.Also took a detour and went to visit the "Pirates\' Cove". The name is completely justified! It\'s a little hidden from the trail and the path leading to it is a bit steep & tricky. I did slip and fell on my way down because of all the rain & mud. Check that out on YouTube- http://youtu.be/Vls2Rnot8js . But the cove was worth the effort & pain! Instantly gave the feeling of being secluded, untamed, uninhibited, wildly beautiful.', "Super easy and pretty walk down to a beach. I like to get a large coffee and just stroll down and back. Wide paths, so the crowds aren't bad. You can easily walk around slower traffic.", 'Beautiful scenery... Easy or moderate depending on trail you take.', "Easy trail to the beach. This time of year a bit dry and crowded on a Friday afternoon.  But the beach is beautiful!  Beautiful ocean and rock formations alongside the trail and at the oceans edge. Unfortunately today there were two Dead Sea lions and about six dead seagulls. Don't know why -sad.", 'Easy and beautiful.', 'Awesome trail. Great views from the beach.', 'Great hike for beginners and bikers.  Love the cloud cover since it basically rolls right over your head as you hike.  Traffic into the area was kind of bad but expected since it was a holiday.', 'It was fun.Good place for beginner mountain bikers.', 'Perfect hike for all ages. Just under four miles. Stroller-accessible. Lots of opportunities to spot wildlife. Beware of sneaker waves on the beach, especially during the fall and winter months.', 'Beautiful views, easy hike that my little kids could handle. Very little shade. Bathrooms about 1 mile down. Will definitely do again!', 'Nice easy hike with some good views and great bird watching.', 'Great easy hike to the beach! Lots of sparrows and wrens, and great views of kestrels and owls if you are lucky! The wetlands offer views of mergansers and scaups. The beach is pretty and sunsets are picturesque! Just get past the somewhat uneventful beginning paved road and veer right to the beach trail!', 'Grew up going here, the hike in the valley is beautiful and easy/flat. You end up at a small beach which is typically overcast but very charming. If you want something more challenging and with stunning ocean views the hike from Tennessee to Muir Beach is probably more your speed.', 'This trail is an easy hike. The beach at the end is great! However, if u go on a foggy day it can be pretty windy on the upper part of the trail and cold at the beach. Go when the tide is 0 or negative and u can boulder on the rocks to the left of the trail outlet.There are signs posted all around for no dogs, but I saw several. ', "This Trail is right next to my Computer Company Office (http://www.4Directions.biz) so I get to ride and hike it almost every day (especially if I am fixing a Computer and there's at least an hour of copying to do). Very easy and pleasant. I've seen lots of Hawks, a bobcat, foxes, etc...  So come to Mill Valley and enjoy our beautiful nature!", 'This is an easy but enjoyable trail with lots of wild flowers.  The best thing is when you come to the breathtaking vista of the beach at the end.  Great spot for photography. ', "This was very enjoyable.  Easy walk that started out wide & paved.  Good for strollers, etc.  More difficult trails are accessible from both the trail head and from the straight, easy path to a beautiful beach of black sand!  The trail follows a stream on its' journey to the ocean.  Be careful at high tide or you may get stuck on the beach for a few hours!  Climb up to the bluff that overlooks the beach for a beautiful view of the beach", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Bridalveil Fall Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['wheelchair friendly', 'kid friendly', 'stroller friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'walking', 'forest', 'paved', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Bridalveil Fall Trail is a 0.5 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Mariposa, California that features a waterfall and is good for all skill levels. The trail is primarily used for walking, nature trips, and birding and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
['East short walk in the snow.', 'Pretty trail in winter.', 'Short and sweet! Easy walk to the bottom of the falls.', 'Was quick and easy... nice view!', 'not really a hike but a short walk but worth stopping and checking specially if you have little kids as we do. they loved it. we did it on December and it was impressive. the little creek was frozen adding additiona attractive', 'Not much of a hike but the view of the falls is stellar. Parking lot fills up quickly so plan a very early trip. Stop by tunnel view afterwards just up the road', 'Super short hike but the views are pretty!!', 'super easy hike!', 'Magical, went all the way to the top, where the waterfall hits the ground, pure heaven ☺️', 'Bridalveil Falls trail, Yosemite. Water still falling in November when some of the other Yosemite Falls have dried up. Beautiful, ethereal, don’t miss it. I’ll be coming back in late spring.', 'Quick and effective! Great photo op.', 'Beautiful view of the fall off the top of the mountain. We did hike down to the actual fall. Slippery rocks so it is more dangerous. Use caution.', 'nice easy hike', 'You get real close to the falls. Too bad not much water was falling but it was still worth it', 'Easy and well paved path with a view of the waterfall at the end. Rocky area under the waterfall to boulder on.', '', 'Very easy paved trail. BEAUTIFUL and not crowded early in the day.', 'This is a short hike but it’s great to get out of the car and stretch your legs after a long drive because it’s the first waterfall you come to in Yosemite Valley. Parking is hard because the lot is small and summers get very crowded, so be patient. The trail can get crowded too, but there is bathrooms at the trailhead, misty conditions if the falls are full, and good photo ops.', 'Amazing.  A short walk turned into rock hiking up to the base of the falls and swimming in refreshing water (cold!!).  Wife and two kids climbed the rocks.  Very slippery, use caution. Barefoot on the way down was much easier.', 'Beautiful falls that are perhaps too close to the road. There are just too many people everywhere, scrambling on the rocks, screaming on top of their lungs and in general exhibiting the sort of "crowd behavior" that one would expect to see at an amusement park rather than in nature. 
That said, it is definitely wort stopping by if you're driving past.', 'Short, paved trail with lots of people. Takes maybe 10-15 minutes to make the bottom of the waterfall from the parking lot. Well worth the stop.', 'Very easy paved trail, done several years ago! Very very crowded. Not the way I like to enjoy nature but is great for all skill levels and the falls are pretty. Just felt very much like a "tourist attraction".', 'An easy Yosemite hike', 'simple. easy. and picture perfect.', 'my husband and I took our four kids to this water fall and loved it. we climbed the rocks as far as we can and got some beautiful pictures. be prepared to get wet.also expect a lot of people!!', 'Beautiful waterfall with very very short hike to get to the falls.', 'lots of people. paved path. good sight though', 'Nice views', 'Easy trail and great with all the water.  If you want to get close bring a rain coat', 'Super easy with good views. A little touristy, but fun to stand in the mist', 'The hike up to the falls was extremely easy but the view of the falls coming down the cliffs was spectacular. Would highly recommend for all ages. I suggest parking on the road slightly past the trail because it was extremely hard to find a parking spot. Great choice for a first day and super refreshing to feel the most from the falls spraying up at you. *bring a poncho or rain jacket if you do not want to get wet.', 'A nice easy trail if that is what you are looking for, and spectacular falls. Good for the whole family, best in the springtime.', 'Quick and easy trail. 100% worth the time and effort. You can get soaked on a hot day if you like, or just get some awesome photos of the base of the fall', 'I went on March 19 and it was a delight, with snow still on the ground. Slippery in parts of the paved trail, so it’s better sometimes to go off the trail just a little bit and clamber up and down. Excellent atmosphere, filled with spray from the falls and the roar of the water when you get to the top of the trail.', 'Awesome Trail , went with my 7 yr old. it was so icy and dangerous when we went. 
My son loves it , but i had to slide down to the trail on the ice yet it was Fantastic', 'Short and sweet, just the way it was meant to be. Pretty cool in the rain. They’re going to be renovating the trail soon, to make it more accessible and crowd-friendly, better bathrooms, better parking lot, etc.', '', 'If you want to see a waterfall but are short on time, this is one to see. Best time to go is in the spring/early summer when the snow is melting.', 'Very easy paved trail, great views of the fall.', 'Nice, short trail to get you to the falls.  It’s fairly crowded but has some nice sights along the way.', 'Excellent introductory view of the park.  The best part is scrambling up as far as possible for better views of the falls / rainbows.  There is an adjacent waterfall if you walk laterally after scaling up 150 feet or so, with a cave that you can enter for cooler views and pictures.  Technical climb for rock scrambling which is moderate-difficult.', "Good simple walk on a paved path. Not too many people when we went. The end of the path affords amazing views of the falls above. I went off trail and rock scrambled to the base of the fall, which is about another 230 feet elevation. This is very technical, and though many tried, only a few got as high at the fall. Take care, since this is a dangerous change in skill and not for everyone. Skill change on the trail goes from Green, to Single Black here. Need to take care on that part,  remember that every rock is water polished smooth-so it is very slick. About half way up, the water mist makes every rock slippery..  And the obvious way up or down, isn't always the right way.", 'Super short walk to the beautiful falls, works great as a stop during a scenic drive, but there are so many people doing the same thing. The parking lot here has bathrooms and water.', 'Short hike with nice waterfall. worth a quick look as you drive through the valley', 'Beautiful ! Larger than lower Yosemite falls Depends on the time of year I guess', "The waterfalls in this season seem to have dwindled down quite a bit since my last month's visit but it is still in every way impressive! 

This spot is very heavily trafficked mid day. The most difficult part of this trail was finding parking!! 

After a quick half a mile trot towards the fall, you will have the option to either take some photos from a distance or rock scramble over to the base of the falls for another half mile. The part is technical and can require decent shoes for good footing. I took off my flip flops and felt like I had an advantage doing so. 

If you choose to take it a step further and go all the way to the first tier drop, the area is mostly secluded because it's even more dangerous to go this direction. I suspect you can't come to this area after a good rainy season because the fall would be too massive to stand close by. 

Other than having to deal with people, I'm still in love with this place! It takes nothing to walk to and needs to be a part of everyone's visit.", 'Lovely fall and easy walk on paved path.', "Super easy. If you want to get close to the big water fall you have to do some climbing and make your own path. If there's a lot of people it makes it more challenging to dodge them.", "It's not much of a hike, more of a walk to a very picturesque falls. Arrive before 8 to avoid the stampede.", 'Really fun! We climbed the rocks and went up pretty high! Would not recommend without proper shoes and equipment becuz the rocks are slippery!', 'There were so many people on this trail/walk!', 'Neat to see the waterfall so close!', 'Very short hike - very little parking - we went by 3 times and couldnt find a space however if you go real early - you are fine.  I think the views of the waterfall are actually better from the main road as opposed to under the waterfall itself', "lots of fun scurrying up the rocks to the waterfall. it's very easy and paved for the first bit, but when you leave the path and start up on the slippery rocks it becomes much more challenging and fun!", '', 'Easy and beautiful trail. Good for all age and skill levels. Wear a raincoat!', 'Easy. Got soaking wet', "Half mile, easy paved trail. Go early or fight the crowds. Parking is a nightmare. The pit toilets are foul.
There's a better view of Bridleveil across the valley. There's a pullout on Northside Drive directly across from the falls.", 'shorter than a .5', 'Definitely bring a rain jacket!!']

user_texts:
['Words don’t do this hike justice.', "if you're on the south Oregon coast, you will definitely want to see this.", 'Love love love this place! This time of year there were hardly anyone, very peaceful.', 'Great hike', 'LOVE! You have to do this! We went and there was nobody there and it was gorgeous :)', 'Came here on a Wednesday @2pm. becomes "off road" about 3 miles before the trail head. Unfortunately, my scion xb wouldn't make it to the head (due to "creek" more like puddle) all the way so we parked about a little over a mile before getting to the head. My friend and I didn't mind at all, it made the hike a little longer. The actual hike was beautiful, where good shoes, and take a camera. :)', '10/1/18If you want to mix it up from just viewing Redwood trees I’d say this is a must do. While there were footbridges in place, and well placed rocks/logs, just plan on getting your feet wet. The trail makes a loop and returns via the forest on top of the canyon but I think most people do it as an out and back through the canyon as that’s the most interesting part. It’s a bit of a drive on a winding gravel road through the trees to get here, and it’s a day use fee area (unless you have a parks pass or other), but it’s worth it for this hike and the secluded stretch of coast.', 'Just an amazing hike with every step a picture perfect opportunity. Very family friendly but like others have mentioned, water shoes or waterproof hiking boots are a good idea. Don’t go in a hurry, and enjoy natures artwork.', 'So beautiful! A must see!', 'Beautiful, peaceful, easy hike! Well worth the drive back to the trailhead. My husband and I did this hike at 0900 and were the only ones around. Wear waterproof shoes/sandals as your feet will get wet. They filmed a scene from The Lost World Jurassic Park here if that excites you as well.', "Astoundingly beautiful, even though well trafficked. Easy, even for older, less active folks. I suggest water shoes, you'll get your ankles wet unless you can cross the shallow river/creek on a log (easily done if you have someone with you to hold your hand). So worth the drive on a very narrow, sometimes dirt road riddled with blind turns. Loved it!", 'amazing to hike such great sights!', 'Beautiful. Great short hike. Only downsides are that access is 8 miles down a bumpy dirt road, and there are a lot of people. At least 30 cars in the parking lot for a 1-mile loop hike.', 'Fun area! Little crowded but so worth the sites!', 'beautiful a must see easy hike except to get wet feet', 'Gorgeous fern canyon, lush and moist. Super easy hike, try to go early or late as it tends to attract large groups and families. Well worth the crowds though. It’s a unique canyon.', 'Interesting mostly because you are hopping on rocks and logs most of the time. Recommend wearing flip flops or wellies, not hiking shoes.', 'Go early and you’ll have entire trail to yourself', 'Short but gorgeous trail. Shoes got wet as most of the trail is through a river at the bottom of the canyon (ankle-deep water)', 'Loved it hiking and camping and fishing was the best!', 'Loved it. Hike was easy but wet. It feels like you stepped back in time entering the canyon. Definitely work seeing.', 'The canyon is tall and green. It is a must see.  Makes me feel like jurassic park.  Bring tall wader boots or plan to get wet. If it has rained then you might not be able to even get there.  The road is a bit of a challenge if there is bad weather.  It might close.', 'This trail was beautiful! We went at the end of March on a rainy day and the trail was flooded with water. We ended up taking our shoes off and hiking barefoot but the surroundings made it absolutely with it!', "Absolutely stunning! It's best to go early in the morning because it can get a bit crowded. Bring water sandals or an extra pair of shoes because your feet are gonna get wet! Not really a hike, more of a scenic walk. There's often elk around the parking lot too.", 'Beauty abounds in this magical place. Getting your feet wet is pretty unavoidable but well worth it!', 'Don’t miss this if you are in the area.I took James Irvine trail to Fern Canyon which was about 4.5miles one way. Once in the Fern Canyon Hike along the creek to get the full experience, your feet will get wet but well worth it. Feels like you are in a prehistoric movie set. I was there for 30mins without meeting a soul. I am sure it will get more crowded in the summer.', 'ķ', 'Get your feet wet. Hike over logs. ', 'Beautiful hike.  We did this last March. Glad we hiked in water shoes and shorts,  as a good stretch of it we hiked right in the creek.  Loved all the elk in the area.', "If you are in Northern California, this is a MUST. A very easy but extremely beautiful and magical experience. You will feel like you're in Jurassic Park. If going in the Spring, may want to consider wear waterproof boots! Your feet will surely get a tad or two wet.", 'This is where part of Star Wars was filled.  Felt like an alien planet.  Beautiful and mysterious.Saw many bull elk while hiking.  Not to be messed with.Loved the place.', 'Saw tons of elk. Nice easy hike.', 'Although I'm a much bigger fan of moderate / hard rated trails, this trail will always be a true favorite. It is most definitely an easy trail so it's perfect for anyone! Thankfully even my baby sister agrees to "hike" this trail with me, which makes for wonderful family exploring time. 

And there's truly nothing more majestic! You drive through groves of trees, along the ocean, park, and walk up to the canyon's grand entrance - see the pictures I've uploaded if you don't believe me! 

You hike through the entirety of the canyon of ferns, up and out through more groves of trees, and back down to the entrance of the canyon before retreating to your vehicle. Although it's short, you can spend as much time as you want in the canyon, which is always my preference. 

If you want a hike that's simple and allows time for reflection, then this hike is perfect for you and your loved ones.', 'This is a fun little loop. If you don’t want to get super wet, you can ninja your way thru most of it without having to get too deep...but, there are a few points where you really just have to go for it. Waterproof boots, above the ankles for those who aren’t into getting wet. My wife and I loved this one. Stop often and take in your surroundings. It’s likely you’ve never seen anything like it before.', "There was lot of water when we had been there. Since it rained a lot a day before we went there. There were about 3 water streams which our car had to pass to get to the fern canyon trailhead. Since our car was not SUV, we decided to park right before the first stream and walk one more mile before reaching the actual trailhead. Fern canyon was pretty amazing, we walked to the end of the trail in the water running like river. It was so much fun!! If anyone is visiting it in recent 2 days, don't try to save your shoes, no matter what you are going to get wet! :)", 'Beautiful canyon to see Maiden Hair Ferns that require hiking up a shallow river. This is a very short trail so continue on to one of the connecting trails for a longer hike is a must!', 'Check for park closures and road closures before you arrive. Tried to drive up after the rain today for a day hike in Fern Canyon and the 4.0 mi steep and windy dirt road looked very slippery and muddy and washed out. Campground and trail to Gold bluff beach said closed. We decided to turn back rather than get stuck.', 'What a great hike. even though we got wet. It rained the day before so had some waterfalls flowing.', 'The road up here was very bumpy and we crossed two creeks. My Nissan Sentra was able to make it through without too much trouble. The trail took us about an hour and a half to complete. We stopped a ton to take photos of the views. If you just want to see the fern canyon walls, you'll have to cross a creek and they're right at the start of the trail about 5ish minutes from parking. Theres a well-sized tree you'll have to either climb over or crouch walk under. Without good waterproof shoes, and proper hiking gear, I wouldn't consider the first fifteen to thirty minutes as an "easy" hiking trail. It was, however, well worth everything. Very gorgeous.', "The fern walls are really cool. It's def worth the drive down.", "Super dope when it's sunny", 'One of the most beautiful hike you can stroll through in Red Canyon. Its a bit challenging because you would have to cross over trees, river banks, rocks, muds, etc. You get the point. The view of the Fern Canyons are spectacular! They are like gardens hanging of the wall.', 'Really enjoyed the beautiful scenery... felt like we were in Jurassic Park & Star Wars!', 'It was an amazing hike, just beautiful. I would hike it again.', 'short, gorgeous. we did the loop but getting over the giant log is difficult. have a really tall guy with you!', 'This was really beautiful and I definitely recommend!Be sure to bring cash for the $8 self register. The road to Fern Canyon is bumping, unpaved, narrow at certain points and dusty. My Nissan Versa did just fine. After passing the Gold Bluffs campgrounds there is a stream that you can cross and the trail head is a mile up the road. There are bathrooms in the parking lot.', 'Favorite according to the kids.', 'Amazing! So lush and green. I loved the walls of ferns.', 'Stunning -- a must-see!!!', 'This trail is so beautiful.  Well the loop trail is closed but just follow the creek through the fern canyon.  If you are adventurous keep going up the creek and climb over all the obstacles.  You will come to a small waterfall on your left that is quite pretty.   We are a family of six.  My kids were in heaven.  Important tip- We all wore muck boots and it made the trail much easier.  Could have sold them to almost anyone on the trail too. ;). If you end up doing the trail in tennis shoes- just plan on getting them wet.  There are board bridges but you are still going to get wet.   The moss, ferns, creek and even fallen trees make this an I forgettable hike.  My kids (who hike often) said it was THE BEST HIKE EVER!   We loved it.', "This was a great hike! The tall walls of ferns were so unique and the stony river bed was lovely. The hike was very easy. We saw elk and banana slugs, two things we hoped to see while in the area. Be warned, there is an 8 mile drive on an un-paved road to arrive at the parking lot as well as areas where the water streams across the path. We made it through in a mustang so it's doable but nerve racking. Worth it.", "Did partial hike here 7/1/17. Very easy hike with views that seem to good to be true for the minimal effort involved!! The whole place has a magical, land before time feel. There's lots of water along the path so be prepared to get your feet a little wet. The drive to get here includes 4 miles of rough gravel - so make sure your car can handle it and you don't mind it getting a little beat up. Cool bonus - there's a lovely beach adjacent to parking lot with many wild elk just milling around.", 'Wonderful hike through the cannion covered in ferns. The loop is still closed but the hike is still worth it for the fun alone.', 'Most unique trail that we completed during out visit to the Redwoods parks.  the scenery was amazing and our kids kept themselves busy looking for salamanders. They unfortunately didn't spot any. The guide we read said  this trail was "easy", which is true if you are not trying to keep your shoes dry. After completely submerging out shoes in the water a couple of times we stopped caring about dry socks and the trail was EASY! My recommendation is "wear a water/hiking shoe! The loop was closed when we hiked here also, but the hike was still very enjoyable! A must see!', 'This really is as good as it gets!', "First off we loved it! But I don't know I agree with this being easy anymore. There were so many trees down it was a jungle gym activity more than a hike but that really was half the fun.  There were so many people when we went 7/3 that it was almost impossible to get a good canyon photo.", 'Easy fun trail.', "Great place to hike with the kids. Didn't make super far but was well worth the stop. There were boards placed down over the water crossing parts since the water flow wasn't high.", 'so beautiful!!!', 'Was cool to see, but no signs or showing how it "loops". Ended up being gone for 3 hours! The more fern wall section is easy and good for kids, but once you start climbing over fallen trees and up side trails through overgrown stuff turn back because it's like that till who knows how long. did find a Lil waterfall back there though.  With hoe many tourists are there you would think the trail would have signs.....', 'Great trail!  Be prepared to get muddy and wet!', 'This place is really cool.  Highly recommend if making a trip to the Redwoods.', "Perfect little hike but I would advise wearing water friendly shoes. We ran into the tree obstacle but didn't have any problems getting around/through it.", 'Beautiful hike up a creek surrounded on both sides by near vertical walls of fern, Redwood sorrel, wild ginger, and more.', 'Loved this place.  You will get wet.', 'Bring a dry pair of shoes!', 'Was closed due to flood 12/18', 'Best hike ever! It was kind of scary driving in to the parking lot. The road was so narrow.', "Awesome and extremely unique little trail.  The only problem is it's too short and too remote.  Hope to take a few friends back in the future.", "This was probably one of my favorite hikes. went here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and had a blast. the Photos don't do this place justice, a must!", 'Amazing!!', 'Jurassic park trail. Gf went crazy and climbed some trees', 'Great early morning hike.', "Most amazing hike ever!, I love this place!! It's like stepping into another world.", 'Very pretty - a little crowded and can be very slippery climbing over some of the fallen trees.  Worth the hike from the visitor center or driving in and walking through the canyon.', 'One of the prettiest and most amazing trails that I have ever hiked. Well worth the 8 mile drive on a dirt road each way.', 'Beautiful and easy hike to do with kids. mostly flat unless you take the stairs to the rim.', "This is one of my favorite hikes. It's just a nice easy walk through one of the most beautiful places on earth. Plan on your feet getting wet.", "Just beautiful. I couldn't stop taking pictures. This is a very easy walk through the canyon. If you are visiting the Redwoods National Forest, take the time to see this.", "Have hiked this trail about a dozen times.  It's a must stop every time we are in NorCal.", "Absolutely stunning. This was my favorite part of our entire trip. Fern Canyon is a must see!

Also - we had some people in our group who didn't want to do the entire hike. You can follow a dirt road in past the beach, park and walk about .5 miles to the canyon, as well. If you inquire at any information center in the area (Klamath, Crescent City, etc) they are extremely helpful.", "Keep an eye out for Elk on the way in! This is a great family hike and would be great for a hot day! We hiking this in early April, it wasn't hot but it wasn't cold either. Once we got to the mouth of the canyon there was a sign posted on the other side of the creek that the loop trail was blocked and impassable. So we opted to just go up the creek into the canyon. At first we tried our best to stay out of the water but had to give up and just walk through the water. It wasn't super cold water so that was nice and our daughter absolutely loved it! We went in as far as we could until a big log jam.", 'Beautifully built and maintained trail with steps, bridges and wayside markings. Walk along the Little River with plenty of ferns, old and new growth trees, wildflowers and small waterfalls. We loved this trail.', 'Beautiful area. Chose to came at one of the backcountry sites.', 'An amazing hike. Easy and breath taking. Bring water proof shoes like rain boots or prepared to get your feet wet. Half of the trail goes through the stream.', 'This was a very cool place. Our three boys, 10 years old, LOVED IT. We stayed for a couple of hours. Will go back again.', 'Easy hike out and back through a lush valley with fern-lined walls. Lots of cool photog spots along the trail. We were there at the end summer and it was still quite cool along the creek.', 'Amazing trail!!! The sheer beauty of this trail is overwhelming. I drove all the way up the coast from LA to see this small loop. SO worth the drive. And as an added bonus, parts of Lost World (of the Jurassic Park series) was recorded in this area. It feels like Dinosaurs are going to pop out around every corner. So sick.', 'very beautiful, a must do before you die', "One of Humboldt county's best hikes.  Scenic, easy, short.  Fun in the summer when they lay out the little bridges over the creek.  A little bit of climbing over trees, plan to have wet shoes or just don't wear flip flops.  The drive is a bit dicey with pot holes and dirt and a few points you have to drive over a creek.  $8/car for parking for the day.  They've filmed quite a few movie scenes from this area too ;)  Jurassic Park anyone?? You'll sometimes get some great views of the elk.  We've done this trail multiple times and the elk are always my favorite.", 'Took my friends from Bay area there and they loved it. If you go on spring or summer you have to go to car wash afterwards.', 'Beautiful, like I stepped back in time!', "Pretty much a long jeep trail to get to the canyon from 101.  The trail goes up the bottom of a canyon, so you're basically hopping along/over/in a stream-bed.  I thought it was a disappointment.  May be because of time of year.  I went in mid-March.", "Keep in mind, to get here is a trek alone. Between pot-hole dusty roads, to creek crossings that can be impassable at times, the drive makes it even more special. Don't let the drive detour you though! Fern Canyon is a MUST. Its incredible. I've been there over 25 times, and whenever i have a guest in town, that's one of the key places i make sure to take them! Heavy Rain, Fog, Sunshine, you name it, do not leave your waterproof hiking boots behind. You willlll need them. Dogs are not allowed on this trail. Parts of Jurassic Park were filmed here, and its no wonder why. Be mindful that this is a key destination spot, so there will also be a lot of people enjoying the scene as well. I went during Labor Day Weekend one time, lets just say that Six Flags doesn't have anything on Fern Canyon.", 'March 23rd 2015 was a dry day, heavy rain made the little creek to deep to chance crossing it in our Kia Optima. We were bummed not to make it, before going in a car you should find out about this creek first.', 'Incredible beauty!! This is a DO NOT MISS trail. Very easy walk.', 'Awesome trail!! One of my absolute favorites. The trail is fun. You get to cross small foot bridges, and climb over trees and logs. And, not to mention to incredible fern covered canyon walls that line the trail. This hike is a must do when visiting the redwoods.', 'Very pretty area. I would have given more stars but for the crowds. This is a very popular area. $8 to drive up to the trail head.', "My family went on this hike in mid June. They absolutely loved it. My son believed it was where they filmed jurrasic park and it was very believable,  beautiful surroundings. It's definitely a must do when in the area!", "From the Elk Prairie Visitor Center & Park Headquarters I took the James Irvine Trail to the Fern Canyon Trail.  I then looped around via Davison Road along the coastal trail south to the Miners Ridge Trail back to the James Irvine Trail and on to my starting point at the Visitors Center.  My iPod Nano showed a distance of 15.9 miles.  This route offers a well preserved and maintained hiking trail, easy to moderate in physical exertion and welled marked. Do take a map, though, but no need for a compass or GPS. There is beautiful foliage seen through the loop, along with many giant redwoods, dense leafy coverage similar to being in a Rain Forest.  The walk along the coastal dirt road is as expected of a seaside landscape before once again entering the forest at the Miner's Ridge Trail.  Miner Ridge Camp was closed October 11, 2013 when I did the hike.  Park signage warned hikers of antelope during rutting season along this section of the trail, but this did not happen during the mid afternoon when I trekked through the section. I did encounter fellow hikers mainly coming in from the Fern Canyon picnic area to see the Fern Canyon; but once passed this section I had the whole loop to myself with the exception of one mountain biker whom I met twice looping the trail, too.  In summary, this is a very enjoyable hike through a dense Rain Forest environment with large redwood trees, ferns, thick foliage, on a well maintained marked trail. Most all stream crossings have bridges that are well constructed and maintain. You also are in the mountainous area for most of the loop so you will be viewing some stream crossings from very high above the water below. If you are looking for a nice 1/2 to 3/4 day hike offering an opportunity for good exercise, then this also is the hike for you to do. It is not a difficult hike at all.Jerry D", "This was an awesome adventure I have 5 kids from 4-18 years old and they all loved it. My 4 year old kept saying, this is the best day ever. They all wanted to hike it twice so hike it twice we did. Best 1 mile hike ever. Don't let trees get in your way keep trudging through and you will hike on top and in the river bed.", "So if you are up for an adventure, just getting to the trailhead will give you one.  Come when you can spend time exploring the beach too.  We thought we'd hit this on our way down the coast.  The road in is long and basically single-track so watch out for on-coming traffic, you'll need to pay a day use fee, and then drive along the rocky beach road to the trailhead (note you can't see the beach from the road, you have to get out and hike to the beach)... Fern Canyon is where they filmed Jurassic Park II and if you really look close you can see the dino's footsteps through the creek that runs right through the bottom of the canyon.  I remember the scene - also watch out for those hungry little dinos that run in packs looking for wayward hikers.  Anyway, we picked our way across the wooden plank bridges - there must have been about 20 ... to cross the river as you get deeper and deeper into the canyon, ducked under and climbed over numerous trees stumps and fallen limbs... The canyon is lined from floor to the top of the walls with lush green ferns - you get a really cool feeling just walking through and looking up both sides.  There were several groups of people who got to a certain point and turned back due to fallen trees, stumps, high water, etc. but if you hike all the way to the back of the canyon, like we did, you'll see some steps to the left which take you to the rest of the loop, which gives you sort of a two phase hike, one through a water-filled canyon and one on higher ground, with a boardwalk at one point.  It is really an adventure and you'll probably run into some of the native elk on the way out.  Recommend this just for the experience!", "The drive to get to the trail was a bit bumpy, and there were a few times that we thought we wouldn't be able to make it in our Accord, but we kept going only to find cars much less equipped parked in the lot.  The drive there was long, slow, and completely worth it!
We saw quite a few elk on our way there, and then once we made it on the trail, it was just amazing.  It was gorgeous, and my only complaint is that I wish it was longer!  Definitely worth it if you're in the area!", "Did this one in late November during a 4-day rainstorm, we were up to our knees in water and climbing over logjams to get through, but it's probably the most beautiful trail I've done so far, especailly when there's no one else there. It connects to Friendship Ridge and the coastal trail running north so you can make a longer loop out of it. Know that the coastal trail turns into a lake in the rain though, so does the dirt road going to the mouth of this canyon, so you will have to park a ways back and hop over some streams. The park road also floods just off the highway but it's usually passible if you drive slow. The canyon is something anyone who's heading up north should see.", 'This hike is beautiful.  It is well worth the drive to stand between the walls of ferns and take in the sights and sounds.  Weekend days can get relatively crowded, so go early, pack a picnic lunch, and enjoy it on the adjacent beach after your hike.', 'Great little hike. We took the easy way in - about a 1 mile loop, but definitely a scenic hike. We went in mid June and the ferns were in full growth. A little wet on the walk in - you can either wear waterproof shoes and hike through the water (about 4-6 inches deep) or balance on logs that were placed to walk across. ', 'Awesome trail i just wish there was more of it! The elk that meandered onto the trail were quite a view, watch out for those guy', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Ernie Maxwell Scenic Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Ernie Maxwell Scenic Trail is a 5 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Idyllwild, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from March until November. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['We did this trail in reverse so we would have the uphill section first. Great New Year’s Day hike! Lots of friendly people along the trail.', 'Cool trail', 'Took the dogs with us on this hike. Although it was a little narrow in parts, we all enjoyed the walk and the beautiful scenery. Lots of other furry friends on the trail today!', 'Really nice walk', 'Easy fun hike', "Hiked this trail this past weekend and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's an easy out and back trail with beautiful views.  It was a perfect hike during this holiday season.  The smell of fresh pine trees really put me in a holiday spirit.  I look forward to returning to this area to try other trails.", 'Nice walk lots of traffic on weekends', 'really like this hike, just to get out of the house for a couple of hours', 'Gorgeous boulders, trees and easy to boot. Great for families.', 'Great trail to walk with your kids.', "If you a serious hiker - don't waste your time.This is a trail in the backyard of some mountain houses, you will hear people in their backyards all along. The views are Ok, and it is as short as it is not challenging.", 'Beautiful easy trail.', 'So someone’s review said to start at the trailhead where the parking is and my friend and I think they are completely wrong. If you start from the dirt road entrance which is off of Taqhuitz rd I believe that is uphill. You finish the trail at the parking lot and if you follow the road a little up and to the right you find restrooms and picnic benches. When you go back down there is only a small part that is up hill but then the rest is downhill. We both hiked with our babies in baby carriers. Trust me when I say start from the first road. The hike itself of course is beautiful because you are going through a beautiful forest and beautiful sights as you go higher and higher. However The end isn’t as rewarding as Taqhuitz peak. When Taqhuitz peak opens again from Southridge, I would suggest trying that one. It is a moderate to hard hike due to the switchbacks but it is very beautiful and so worth it when you get to the ranger tower.', 'I definitely suggest starting from the bottom. When I did the trail I only knew of starting at the trailhead . My friends and I hiked through and realized there was parking on the street to start from the opposite side. Hiking back  was mostly uphill and we would have preferred to do it the other way around. To hike uphill first (out) and comeback (back) downhill , park on the street end of the trail not the trailhead end of the trail.', 'Nice views. Dogs liked it too', 'Great hike to take my wife and dogs on.', "Great day hike to beat the heat and get active. Lots of shade on the trail so it's ok to go in the middle of the day. Good for all fitness levels. Disappointing thing is there is a parking lot at the top of the trail which takes you out of the wilderness", 'Easy trail, great day hike!', "Nice shaded hike. I've done bottom to top, and top to bottom, def recommend doing bottom to top.", 'this was an easy trail going out from the trailhead, coming back was more of a climb. although if you start from taquitz rd (if I remeber the street name correctly) you will be going up and than an easy down. it was a little more narrow trail in many spots, and it was warmer this day. we started at 7 am and the bugs were pretty heavy, although this was one of the hottest days of our Summer. we ended and were back home in Hemet by 11 and before we left we went to eat breakfast so it was a quick hike. have fun hiking.', 'Gorgeous hike', "Easy hike, lots of bugs don't forget your Off Spray. My kids loved it.", 'This is my favorite trail of all times up in the San Jacintos', 'Easy trail, great warm up trail, easy to follow.', "Very pretty trail, but note that the ascent is on the return as there's a steady almost unnoticeable downgrade going out from the trailhead. Trail was well-maintained, nice views, lots of ttees, and brush with cute little lizards racing through. It has a Climbers Trail offshoot that my daughter explored for a few...it looked fun and I would have joined her if I hadn't had the baby on my back. Overall nice trail, I'll do it again but earlier in the day and preferably without a mini hitchhiker. ;)", 'Beautiful trail with nice views', "I'm a moderately Advanced hiker. I would consider this trial extremely easy. My girlfriend's 8 year old and 6 year old did it no problem.", 'We loved this trail for trail running and used it as a warm up day before San Jacinto via Marion.', 'Gorgeous wildflowers this time of year!! ', 'This was really great. Went with my wife, two kids (15 & 10), and our dog. We had a great time. Very well maintained and everyone we came across was friendly and wanted to pet our dog. Parking was easy and Idyllwild is a great little town too. We’ll be back.', 'A well shaded, easy hike through mixed forest. Great variety of flora and some sweeping views.', 'I did this hike on Mother’s Day w my husband and my daughter.We start from the lower trailhead Where little parking is available.We started at 7am and walked the easy trail to the other end of the trailhead At Humber Park. We took our time at took lots of pictures during our hike. We could see suicide rock and taquitz peak From the path at times but it was very cloudy & cooler temps today .The details say it’s 5 miles but it’s longer and not too much incline. At the turn around point ( the other trail head) we enjoyed the small creek w waters flowing. So I prefer the return to the car back mostly downhill. I recommend this for family friendly.', 'Good and easy - pretty. Remember to put your dogs on a leash it’s the law. Everyone you pass is always super friendly', 'Great trail for all levels. Plenty of shade for those hot days and nice views from time to time.', 'Fun hike for families with kids and a fog', 'This is my favorite hike during the week to warm up for my harder hikes on the weekends. I suggest going from the bottom of the trail to the top then its mostly all down hill. If you start up at Humber Park you go down then you have to turn around and its all up hill from there.', 'Love this trail! It’s a quick one, but so worth it if you have a small dog and want to get him/her some exercise outdoors!', 'Fun little trail through the forest. Gets a little crowded but to be expected.', 'Great hike with kids and dog! Need an adventure day pass to park so make sure you get it in town. Lots of shade and cool breeze. Great views of the peak!', 'Fun hike with bits of snow. Bring walking sticks if there’s still snow, parts were slick. Would definitely go back.', 'Great hike even in a little snow..... glad we had our walking sticks for the slippery parts but the views and trail are a treat!', 'Excellent easy hike for entire family and dog! Gorgeous views and perfect blend of sun and shade. Definite must!', 'Easy and pretty, with great views of Lily Rock and Suicide Rock.', 'Super fun hike!  Beautiful views, nice trail and perfect distance.  Posted pics of my lovely day.', 'Did this hike today. Possibly best time to go. There was little sections of snow in the first half a mile, it was sunny but nice and chilly with a lot of shade. It’s mainly slightly downhill on the way out, tons of vista points and views of tahquitz rock.  It took 2.5 hours with stopping for pictures and multiple stops on the way back up due to my asthma and recovering from bronchitis.  Once I build my lungs back up I’ll definitely be back.', '1 hr and 25min round trip.', 'Nice 2 hr hike ', 'Went on Black Friday with a friend. Definitely a very busy trail on a holiday as it is also closer to downtown Idyllwild. Smooth easy trail and basically level.  Near the Humber Park end of the trail there is a sign for "Climbers Trail". This goes straight up the side of the mtn to the foot of Lily Rock. If you don't mind stopping to catch your breath a few times there are wonderful views besides the awesome sight of this massive rock. Took us only half an hour to come back down that trail to the Ernie Maxwell one. Very pleasant hike.', 'Nice views nice length hike', 'The description says it all. Easy hike. Nice views. Trailhead is downhill from main parking area. Get Adventure Pass ($5) at Ranger Station or Chevron. Parking gets full, so get there early. Lots of good breakfast spots in Ydillwild.', '', 'Go to the Ranger Station in town to get a permit to park at the trailhead.', 'Easy and pretty.', 'Pretty little scenic trail near Idyllwild with nice views of suicide rock.  Not terribly challenging even for this beginning hiker, and some lovely shaded areas as you saunter through the forest.  Little less than 5 miles, and it seems to be a popular trail as there were quite a few others enjoying the trail today as well.', 'Very scenic - A must hike for beginners', '', 'Great hike. We started at the top and enjoyed the chance to warm up before working our way back up. Others started at the bottom and were smiling as we passed them on their downhill stretch. Enjoy!', 'Very nice pleasant hike.Claims in he way out if you start from Humber park.', "This was my first time hiking.  It was also the first time with my 10 month son and I was nowhere near trained to do it, but I did complete it!!  I'm glad we started at the bottom to go uphill and then the return was downhill.  Trail was nice but it gets hot in late mornings in the summer.", "easy trail. hiked this with my wife and three kids. beautiful views and didn't break a sweat. if you're looking for a super easy but pretty trail this is it.", 'beautiful trail. easy for the entire family.', 'A very nice trail. The trail is in Humber Park part of the San Bernadino National Forest. It was a little rocky, rooty, with some uneaven terrain. The path winds around what I assume is Humber Mountain. There are many beautiful old blueberry bushes. One hint-Stop and get an adventure pass or Silver Eagle pass to display on your dash as this is manditory.', 'Easy and beautiful trail!', "Got an early start to beat the heat and people.  Started the trail at 07:30 and it was perfect. 59 degrees and practically had the trail to myself for the whole first leg which took me about an hour.  On the way back definitely saw more folks but still not bad.  81 degrees, so getting warmer.  Finished the whole trail in 2 hours.  Saw lupine, giant paintbrush, western azaela's which smelled amazing.  The only negative was it was quite buggy.  Enough to become annoying as the morning heated up.  But all in all I really enjoyed it and it was nice to be able to bring my canine companion.  I'm a bit frustrated in general with the limited trails you can take your dog in this state.", "Did this hike since we didn't get a permit for Devils Bridge. It was a good length there and back, little to no incline most of the way, but a little anticlimactic since the side we ended up on was just a neighborhood road. Nicely shaded though throughout, which was a huge plus for a 90 degree day!", 'Perfect for an afternoon solo jaunt', "excellent beginner trail.you can take your dogs and it's a kid friendly hike.not bad at all.", "This is a great trail for beginners, families and folks that don't typically get out. You follow the trail out and back so navigating is easy. Elevation gain is minimal so even someone that doesn't usually exercise should be able to get through it and get a taste for the outdoors.", "Excellent trail, well marked and heavily traveled. Beautiful scenery and great for dogs.  If you park in the parking lot it's all uphill on the way back.", 'Easy and basic. I went on a Saturday afternoon and found a parking space. Parking requires an Adventure Pass.', 'One of our go-to hikes as we live just about 1/2 hour away.  Beautiful scenery, nicely maintained trail.  Lots of shade.  Not too many people if you get there early.  Idyllwild is a great town to have lunch and window shop in afterwards.', 'an easy to hike trail. definitely kid friendly and dog friendly.', 'Hiked this today with my 10 year old. He is finally getting into the outdoors. With all the recent rain there were several small streams. It was a very easy and well maintained trail.', "April 3, 2017. This was a well maintained pretty trail but I wouldn't call it diverse. We saw pretty much the same scenery way up and back. Gradual smooth climb one way then back slow decent.", '', 'Not too hard, great with dogs. A couple creek crossings and still a small amount of snow in a few spots on the trail.', 'great hike with dogs and beautiful views', "Absolutely beautiful my favorite trail in Idyllwild I love it here it's a 4 mile easy hike teamed about 2 hours to complete, about 2 1/2 if u stop for a picnic", 'Beautiful views, beautiful trails....', 'The scenery and sunsets from this trail are spectacular.', 'very peaceful. good place to get nature pictures.', 'Nice hike, not busy. Beautiful fall scenery.', 'Nice easy hike. Views often hidden by trees.', 'Easy trail, some good scenery but trees will get in the way of the best views and camera shots. It's a rather busy trail with lots of hikers, their dogs, car noise from the road next to it and construction noises from nearby homes. Not the most ideal trail considering what the area offers, but it's easy enough for everyone and family friendly. An Adventure Pass is required for this trail, but a Wilderness permit isn't according to a posting on the Ranger Station board.

AllTrails has you starting the trail in the south and walking north which is a slight uphill trail most of the way, parking starting from here is on the side of the road. If you follow Fern Valley Road from Idyllwild it will lead to Humber Park where the north trailhead is located right next to the first set of parking spots. This allows you to "warm up" walking downhill before the trek back.', "This is a beautiful, rolling trail that winds across the mountainside through a variegated forest of Ponderosa pine, fir, Western red cedar (or hemlock - I'm bad at telling them apart), and both evergreen and deciduous oaks along with manzanita shrubs wherever the sun pokes through. There is parking at the end the app sends you to as a trailhead, but it's alongside a dirt road and is quite limited. If you use the parking lot at the park, be sure you remember your Adventure Pass as it's National Forest and I did see a ranger there. If, like me, you forget your pass, there are places just outside the park where you can squeeze your vehicle onto the side of the road to park before you hit the steep edge. The trail does have some elevation change, though in the low hundreds of feet. The lower end is at the dirt road, so if you use the parking lot be prepared for a gentle climb on the way back. Footing is decomposed granite, though this is indeed mountain hiking so there are occasionally clusters of small boulders to navigate around. If you have weak ankles or just want to be on the safe side, hiking boots might be advisable. Most of the trail is smooth, though. For the same reason, although the trail allows horses this is really a spot for trail horses and not a weekend trail ride for a show horse. Finally, remember to bring plenty of water - there is no running water at either parking area although the park has pit toilets - and don't forget that even in the shade, at over 4,000 feet in Southern California the sun is very strong. Sunscreen is still a good idea for those who are sensitive to the sun.", 'Great trail with pretty much shade everywhere,which is great for dogs !', "My family of 7 loved this hike!  Perfect for my children.  We have 5 children under 10.  The baby was on my back and I felt sturdy on the trail carrying her.  My only criticism is that the APP took us to the end of the trail to start where there wasn't parking.  We made it work but found out from other hikers that it's easier to start at the other end.", 'Beautiful, shady trail!', 'Planned to mtn. Bike, sign at the trailhead says no biking.', 'Great easy hike.', 'Great for a beginner like me', "really enjoyed the hike but sadly, I thought I was on devil's slide, ooops. I did hike up devil's slide for about 40 minutes after, but that one will have to wait.

but this was a great warm-up for today is deer spring trail, tomorrow back to devil slide, the real one this time.", 'Easy with beautiful scenery', "So, I was in Idyllwild today to get our Wilderness Permit for tomorrow's hike on the Devils Slide Trail to Tahquitz Peak Lookout. Drove up to the trailhead to walk around a little bit, then decided to explore the Ernie Maxwell Scenic Trail. I ended up making it a 4 mile hike. This was a nice little trail. It's 2.6 miles one way. The trail is pretty much half shaded and half sun. At around 1145 in the morning it was close to 90 degrees. The sun was hot and so was the breeze while in the sun. However, in the shade it felt about 15 degrees cooler and the breeze felt great. Starting this hike from Humber Park means you pretty much go down for the first part of the hike and up for the return leg. Bugs and Horse Flys were abundant on the trail due to the heat, so use bug spray if you go. Great easy family hike!", 'It was nice and had shade. Really nice.', 'Heavily traveled with an anti-climactic end at a parking lot. The views from the middle of the trail were fantastic though.', "we had a great time we went 2 days in a row live right down the mountain, first day brought my eight-month-old on my back, second day brought my six year old she loved it. went all the way it's a beautiful trail.", 'Easy but beautiful hike. Not to hard.', 'Super nice hike. My girlfriend and I hiked the kiddos on our backs, and dogs on the leashes. We went late spring and saw beautiful yellow and purple flowers. Plenty of shade as well. Over all beautiful hike, and not too steep of an incline either. Dog and family friendly.', 'nice walk 2.5 hrs round trip.', "Kicked my butt, lol. I'm so out of shape. Did hike in 2.5 hrs. Parked at Hubber park parking lot, hiked down to bottom of trail, then hiked back up. We went in group of 4 persons; 2 adults, an 8 yr. old and a 7 yr. old. The hike up was a challenge, because 60% felt like a  steady incline.  Im sure this is an easy trail for many persons that are not so out of shape. I'd suggest parking at the trail head at the bottom of the hill and hike up, so return hike is mostly downhill. ", 'Easy day hike through heavily wooded forest. Manzanitas were in bloom and the views were spectacular. Inspiring views of Marion Ridge, Suicide Rock, and Lily Rock.  On a clear day you can see almost to the Pacific. This is one of the best beginner mountain hikes in the region.', "Lovely hike we took in the late afternoon. We started from the bottom and went up but the incline isn't too rough. Very nice winding trail through the rocks and trees.", 'It was fun little hike.', 'Overall, it was a nice scenic hike. Though, sometimes it felt a little too close to the town as we could hear home renovation and saws throughout the entire trail. It offered great views of the valley.', "Nice enough trail, but it basically tracks the roads in Idyllwild, and you're walking behind houses (hidden a decent amount, and far away, but still), always aware you're in town.  Compared to other hikes in the area, it is mostly flat, so if you don't want much up and down, this is a nice easy hike.  But it would not be at the forefront of my list for any active hikers, especially given all of the other hikes in the area.  We hiked this as the first part of the Devil's Slide/South Ridge Loop, and for that, I highly recommend.", 'Good hike with friends and family.  The trail was very busy.  Certainly not conducive for quiet and relaxing.  None the less, the views were great, the weather was great and the time outdoors is always a blessing.  Although the trail is rated as easy, if you are out of shape (me) it is easy going down but a challenge going back up.  Stay hydrated and nourished and you will be good.', 'Easy fast hike for with the kids.', 'Great easy hike. Beautiful views!!', "Super easy hike on single track.  It is 2.6 miles in and out.  If you hike before 11am you will be shaded most of the way.  Dogs are welcomed and all of the dogs we met were super well behaved.  Our dog loved the hike.  

If you start from Huber Park it is down hill in and then uphill out.  The climb is so gradual that it isn't a big deal.  If you prefer to start at the bottom and hike up first than google the trail name and you will find directions to park at the bottom. If you park at Huber Park you MUST get your parking permit at the Ranger Station (and some businesses) a few miles down in town.  You cannot pay at the parking lot.  And if you decide you want to take the other trails (totally recommended) you must get a wilderness permit at the Ranger Station.  So don't just show-up at the parking lot, come prepared.", 'Hiked this trail on July 31, 2015 - perfect weather (especially after getting out of the Palm Springs heat!) and perfect warm up hike for me, my wife and two dogs.  Great combination of shady forested sections for cooling down and open sections for awesome views. Hiked down about 2 miles from Humbar Park, had a great picnic lunch on top of one of the numerous huge boulders, and then hiked back up.  Saw 1 snake, 1 skunk, numerous squirrels and untold number of lizards.  BTW, Final Score:  Lizards - 871, Dog - 0!!
A definite recommend!', 'Nice easy walk. Lots of people and dogs. We had a good time.', "I hiked this trail with a friend, twice in late July. We finished the first time right when it started to get dark, and then again during sunrise. It was obviously very hot cause of the time of year, but there was plenty of shade due to the tall trees. You have to get a $5 pass per day, but both times we went to buy it the place wasn't open, we went anyway.The views are amazing once you get some elevation, and the trail itself was very clean, no trash. We only ran into a few groups, probably because of the time of day we went, I imagine it's a popular trail. Even in July/August it was still suprisingly green around the water sources. The elevation is pretty moderate, but can be a little challenging in the heat if your pack is large. All in all I can't think of anything that would of made it better, so it deserves the 5 stars.", 'Easy hike. Not crowded, and made for a nice afternoon with my dogs.', 'One of my favorites!   Beautiful scenery.   It was a little more dry than last year, but still beautiful.', 'If you were using this trail to get into town either from the PCT or a long loop trail, be aware at the end you drop off in the middle of a dirt road with no directions into town. I was fortunate to have a wonderful older couple give me a ride back to my car at Deer Springs trailhead. Beautiful trail though!', 'Nice trail with slight elevation changes each way...loved the forest.', 'Nice, easy hike.  Good for training my 6 year old and teen daughter in the basics of hiking.', 'Easy and Fun!! Great hike, all though it was short I enjoyed myself very much.', 'Awesome beginner trail. Lovely views and a nice afternoon workout.', 'Dog friendly', 'This was a really nice hike, it was pretty easy, but jeez was it beautiful! It was pretty chili in the morning, but by late morning it was warming up a lot. I will for sure be going back to this area to hike some more trails. There was also very minimal snow/ice even in the beginning of January.  ', 'I love this hike! It has both shaded and sunny spots. Beautiful views. Too bad there was not a good rain to see the little water trails going. Very easy and fun for dogs too. ', 'Nice, relaxing hike. There was only a mild elevation gain and it was beautiful for a fall hike. There were many types of trees and also some nice views of the mountain terrain. Overall this was a good hike if you want something quick, but if you are looking for amazing views and a challenge, this hike does not include those things.', "Had a GREAT time and plenty of nice views. We went on Sunday Sept. 15th 2013 around 11am. There were a total of 12 of us from ages 4-49, and everyone did well including the 4 year old named Adam (aka the dude). We started off at Humber Park and hiked down seeing a small rattlesnake and plenty of lizards. The trail was CLEAN and clear and was well marked. Hiking back up (the other 2.5 miles) was challenging at times for the smaller kids and some of the adults, due to the higher elevation but nothing that a few breaks along the way didn't fix. Overall is was a NICE hike and I would recommended it to anyone.  John. (PS Hiking Club).", 'We used this trail as an intro for our 5 year old son.  He loved it and has now completed several hikes in Calfornia and Oregon.  Great views, easy on little people, and enjoyable for the adults.', "Great hike for dogs. Overall an easy hike, didn't notice the incline on the way there but definitely noticed on our return trip. Lots of places for the dogs to explore and climb on and friendly people along the way. ", 'Like others have mentioned, its an easy hike.  Very scenic and straightforward. We saw more people here than we did in Deer Springs.  It seems more popular with tourists. We opted for this one on the day we were leaving and it was a great closing hike. It starts on one trail-head and ends on another so you can opt for either if you prefer going uphill/ downhill first. We did check-in with the the ranger office first before starting. ', 'Headed out on a Saturday mid-morning with our four and six year-old daughters.  Parking lot was crowded, but we did manage to find a spot.  Lots of people and dogs on the trail, but it added to the adventure.  Trail is well maintained and with beautiful views.  Our six-year old is quite the trooper when hiking, and it was easy for her.  The four-year old became tired frequently, so we took many mini breaks along the way.  We love Idyllwild, and will continue coming here regularly.  This is a fantastic, moderately easy trail.  ', 'Awesome hike. Really friendly people. There are really cool streams along the way. ', "Lovely hike with slight incline, but ends at small creek where we ate lunch and panned for fool's gold!", 'Very beautiful and easy hike.', "It's a nice easy trail and can be used for a loop. I live a mile down the hill form the trailhead and it's a way to hike to devil's slide without walking all the way through town. I have also been on it with my son and 4 year old grandauter on her first hike this year and she did fine. Great starter trail.
", "Very nice, easy trail.  If it's your first time in higher altitude...might be a bit harder.  Bring lots of water.", 'This is a great hike for beginners.  The majority of the trail is shaded which makes it perfect for sunny days.    There is a small rewarding creek at the end of the trail and if you keep heading up toward the parking lots there is also picnic tables and restrooms.  No need to wear water shoes.  Adventure pass is required and dogs are allowed on the trail.', 'First time in these hills. Loved it!! My Family and I really enjoyed the hike, oh and the dinner after at a Mexican restaurant in town. Well worth the trip. Both the views and the food. We will definitely be back, so many trails up there.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Tahquitz Peak via Devils Slide Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'nature trips', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Tahquitz Peak via Devils Slide Trail is a 8.1 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Idyllwild, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking, walking, nature trips, birding, and horses and is accessible year-round. Dogs and horses are also able to use this trail.
